Custom bowl w/ smoked salmon.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Custom bowl w/ smoked salmon.'}]
text: Was craving for some espresso to jump start the day and found The Good Boys nearby. <br><br>It&#39;s a small local coffee joint a short walk from Tai Seng station that also offer some pretty fresh food options in the morning. <br><br>Atmosphere was pretty chill inside and the espresso was nice and stiff. Was also happy with the customized bowl options since I don&#39;t usually do heavy start like toasts, pancakes, and waffles. They have nice protein selections to choose from and everything seemed really fresh. <br><br>I created a smoked salmon bowl with guacamole and a nice Onsen egg was just about perfect even without any dressing. The smoked salmon provided the savory element complementing the natural sweetness from the avocado. Onsen egg gave it the creaminess to replace the dressing, and Tobiko gave it that extra hit of umami to round everything out. <br><br>Probably one of the nicest and cleanest breakfast I had over the last 2 weeks or so.

text: Lunching at @thecoconutclubsg<br><br>Chicken Leg Nasi Lemak (S$14.80++)<br>Served with a serving of coconut rice, anchovies, peanut, cucumber, fried egg, and sambal.<br><br>The rice was yummy. I can just eat it with rich spicy sambal!<br><br>Assam Pedas (S$15.80++)<br>Snapper braised in tangy &amp; spicy broth<br>Love the tangy sauce, plus the freshness of the fish.<br><br>Cendol (S$4.10++)<br>Mung bean jellies toppings with shaved ice , palm sugar, coconut milk, and a dash of evaporated milk<br>Topup S$1.20++ for red bean<br><br>Although I was quite full when I started on this dessert but I finished it easily. It was so creamy and fresh. I wish the coconut milk used for this dish was available for sale. The green jelly strips were smooth and soft. Non of those hard factory made texture.<br><br>Kuih Platter (S$5.60++)<br>Assortment of freshly-made Malay and Nyonya Cake <br>So soft and yummy delicious.<br><br>Get 10% discount for OCBC credit card holder with minimum S$20 purchase. Promotion valid till 29 August 2020. Not valid for delivery and online orders.<br><br>The Coconut Club<br>Address  : 28 Ann Siang Road, Singapore  069 708<br>Tel  : 6635 2999<br>Open  : <br>Mon - Sun : 11am - 3pm<br>Mon - Sat : 6pm - 9.30pm<br>Website  : <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thecoconutclub.sg&amp;s=4006c1ce60017a3573193c36a13f40096160bdc8548e039afc6cec9791ba4994" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">thecoconutclub.sg</a><br>MRT  : Chinatown (NE4/ DT19)<br>Note  : strictly no pork nor lard, all ingredients are halal sourced

text: coconut club nasi lemak - still good but somehow the portion and standard has dropped. this trip, it was the iga bakar (chargrilled twice cooked beef short ribs) that shone. fall off the bone meat and super delicious when eaten with sambal hijau and sambal belajo. order that. the bbq stingray was ok-ish if you need another dish to make up a meal.

text: When I come to Singapore the thing I crave isn&#39;t chicken rice, chili crab, or carrot cake. What I want is a fragrant bowl of coconut rice, a nice fried chicken leg and nasi lemak.  The coconut club delivers a real solid nasi lemak and is definitively worth the wait and the small premium price you pay (12.8 SGD), which is only expensive if you compare to a hawker stall. <br><br>Food: 4.25 stars<br>Service/environment: 4 stars <br>Value: 4.5 stars<br>Overall: 4.25 stars<br>Recommendations: &#34;the basic&#34; nasi lemak, cendol with the read bean<br><br>The nasi lemak here hits all the notes that I&#39;m looking for. The chicken has a crispy skin is nice and moist, the rice has a light coconut flavor to it and, and the mix of fried fish/nuts give some nice added texture and crunch. <br><br>I have never had cendol before and I&#39;m happy to try it here for the first time. It was really delicious and is a must if you are a coconut fan. The shaved ice is super flavorful and has hints of sweet coconut and coffee. (Highly recommed)

text: Had the Nasi Lemak based off a review I read on a blog. SO glad we went and that is what I ordered. We also had a spicy clam dish and that was equally as tasty. Not like eating at a hawker center, which was a nice break from our food explorations. There was a decent line to wait, but it was 100% worth it.<br><br>The space was beautiful, and the service was friendly and quite speedy. It was very busy inside so we shared a table with another couple that we did not know. Not expected, but didn&#39;t hurt our experience at all.

text: Nasi lemak is the way to go. Yes, you should end your meal with some chendol, but you are missing out if you don&#39;t enjoy the nasi lemak.<br><br>When you walk in, the open and bright interior welcomes you. The menu is simple and classic. The establishment is modern and trendy. The combination of the two creates this fun, casual, and nostalgic dining experience. <br><br>Overall, this is a great place to unwind after a long day, catch up with some friends, or as the first stop of your incredible night.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/WISJJ8SxZod-mm6xOURr1A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coconut-club-singapore?reviewid=0mO3YxfredlzhPyrH26pNg&select=WISJJ8SxZod-mm6xOURr1A', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coconut Club - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: We spent our day and a half in Singapore going from one place to another: eating, eating, and eating some more. The Coconut Club was recommended by his friend and it was near where we were staying so it was a no brainer for our food itinerary.<br><br>We showed up a few minutes before opening time and were one of the first to get seated. This place is known for its nasi lemak and so naturally, that&#39;s what we ordered. It was divine. It looks so simple on the plate but all the components complemented each other.<br> <br>Based on Yelp, we thought that The Coconut Club would be cash only but that is not the case at all. They accepted all major credit cards, which prevented us from having to run to the ATM.

Today&#39;s special dessert - coconut jelly.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Today's special dessert - coconut jelly."}]
text: I must be slacking. This must be my 4th if not my 5th time back at at The Coconut Club for lunch and I have not written a review for it. Maybe subconsciously I don&#39;t want to share this place with others. :-)<br><br>Very popular place for lunch in An Siang Hill. The owner is meticulous about his source of coconut and that is clear when you taste the nasi lemak.  <br><br>Menu is really simple. One main dish of nasi lemak with 2 pcs of chicken (breast or leg aka light or dark), peanuts, fried anchovies, fried egg sunny side up, crunchy cucumber slices and a spoonful of sambal chili.  Besides the main dish, there are lots of sides like otah and sotong(squid). The main dish is big and I hardly have space for the sides. <br><br>A good plate of nasi lemak must be fragrant with coconut without tasting like you are eating coconut. Nasi lemak at TCC is very good. I love the chicken pieces. So tender and deliciously marinated with ginger and other spices. Every little side items are fine so well. The ikan bilis (fried anchovies) is crispy. The peanuts are just the right size. <br><br>Only one thing I&#39;m unhappy about. The side of the plate is too shallow. I kept pushing my food out onto the table. Maybe that&#39;s just me. <br><br>Lots of drinks of local flavors to choose from. Homemade calamansi (lime), homemade barley, bandung (rose syrup with evaporated milk) etc. <br><br>For dessert try the chendol. It is made with palm sugar and coconut milk. You can have it with it without red beans. Go for the red beans. Today they had a special coconut jelly dessert that is so beautifully done. Looks simple but tasted complex. The jelly is smooth not like agar agar. The coconut meat gave it a nice texture. Small dish big taste (of coconut of course)<br><br>Definitely a place to visit but be here around 1130-1145. Past that it will fill up and if you have a party of 6, be ready to wait at least 30 minutes.

text: Excellent hearty brunch! Their signature dish, nasi lemak, was on point. Perfectly cooked egg, coconut rice, crispy and juicy chicken with nice selection of sides. Spice up how you like. Also choose from light or dark meat.<br><br>We also tried the steamed fish cake which was not to our liking. Mackerel in what tasted like a fishy curry sauce, would not order again. Should have tried the shave ice dish everyone was raving over.<br><br>Worth the wait for a tasty meal!

text: Located in Chinatown not far from the CBD. You have to come here for The Basic - a local Peranakan specialty with coconut rice, chicken, an egg and spices. Also, do not skip dessert - the cendol is a coconut shaved ice with palm sugar on top, so refreshing and not very sweet. There might be a wait but it&#39;s worth it.

text: Hadn&#39;t realized the restaurant location had moved up the street; was walking in circles before being directed to the correct location. They are located at #26 (not #6), just a 2mins walk up the street. <br><br>When we finally got to the restaurant, we were seated immediately (2 people at 6:45pm on Tuesday evening). <br><br>The staff was friendly and approachable. <br><br>Ordered the nasi Lemak and a side of the chicken satay. You can order your chicken as leg or breast. I went with leg. I enjoyed the meal. I&#39;ve not had this dish before, so it&#39;s difficult to make any comparison. It&#39;s a classic dish you can find anywhere and at a cheaper price. <br><br>But for my first experience. It was enjoyable.

text: This is my go to place for delicious nasi lemak. <br><br>The rice is really infused with coconut flavor and is not overly strong. The flavor also does not taste synthetic like some other places. <br><br>I will suggest to just get the nasi lemak and maybe a lemongrass drink. That is light and refreshing. <br><br>The nasi lemak comes with sambal (not too sweet or spicy), fried egg with runny yolk (not all the time), cucumber, crunchy ikan bilis and peanuts and two pieces of fried chicken. The fried chicken is yummy, the best thing next to the rice. <br><br>The side dishes are ok, not that special or fantastic to warrant the prices. Same for the desserts. <br><br>It gets crowded fast, so you will only be seated if everyone is your group is there.

Teh', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Teh'}]
text: Small but cute place. Made it at 2:30 pm right before they close. No queue on a weekday. Food came out pretty fast. Service was pretty good for Singapore. Make sure to bring cash just in case their machine is still broken!<br><br>The traditional teh ($2.50) was good.<br><br>The iced lemongrass was pretty much ice water with lots of sugar infused with a hint of lemongrass. I found it too sweet and not that flavourful.<br><br>The nasi lemak ($12) was pretty standard. The rice was not that rich or creamy. More on the dry side I found. Not that flavourful but can still taste the subtle hint of coconut. The sambal was really spicy but alittle sweet. The fried egg was done okay. Runny yolk and not overcooked.<br><br>The chicken was good with very flavourful batter. I really liked the crunch. It was not dry inside.<br><br>The sotong ($15) was cooked well. Not tough. Very spicy but delicious.<br><br>Food overall was good, but as expected in eating out in Singapore, prices were steep.<br><br>Up to you to decide if it&#39;s worth it to pay this much for air conditioning and a cleaner environment compared to the cheaper more traditional hawkers with almost the same quality. Maybe it&#39;s nice to experience this just once.
Great reputation - certainly lives up to the billing - though the pricing is appropriate for a trendy spot in Chinatown.  Nasi lemak of course, and great otak otak.  Some delicious desserts too!

Nasi lemak plate, with the sambal sotong on the top right', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Nasi lemak plate, with the sambal sotong on the top right'}]
text: Great place for nasi lemak! It is more expensive (S$12.80) than what you would pay for nasi lemak at other places, but I think it&#39;s well worth it for the quality of the food and the pleasant, air-conditioned environment.<br><br>Food:<br>- Nasi lemak: The restaurant offers this as their only entree, and it doesn&#39;t disappoint. The chicken was juicy and tender, while the sambal was delicious with just a bit of a kick. I thought the flavors mixed together very well and I couldn&#39;t stop eating it. You can also ask for more rice as well!<br>- Sambal sotong: This dish was basically chopped squid in the sambal sauce. Was a bit pricey and I wasn&#39;t a huge fan of the taste, so I would recommend just sticking with the Nasi lemak.<br><br>Service:<br>I showed up at 7pm on a Saturday and the restaurant was pretty full, but it only took about 10min for us to get a table inside. The waitress was quite funny and also took the time to explain the menu to us in detail. The inside of the restaurant is quite nice and not too crowded, which made for a good dining experience overall.<br><br>Price: $$<br>Though more expensive that most nasi lemak places, still pretty reasonable at S$12.80 for the basic plate. I found this pretty filling, especially given that you can add more rice.

text: Seriously the best Nasi Lemak in Singapore!<br><br>Yes, it will cost you more than a hawker meal, but each part of this dish - the chicken, the ikon billis, the peanuts, coconut rice - is done with attention to  ingredients and preparation.<br><br>AND, you get to sit inside :)<br><br>They have recently moved to a larger space, so perhaps the wait lines will be shorter? Nothing to complain about here, just a warning if you are short on time.<br><br>Enjoy!

text: Best Nasi Lemak this side of the causeway. <br><br>You know those restaurants that do just one dish, but do it phenomenally well? This is one of those places. Runny egg, tender chicken, amazing rich flavourful rice. Each ingredient comes together perfectly on a plate of affordable joy.

text: Overhyped and overpriced. <br>Average rice, chicken portion is big, but taste is ok.<br>Otah is extremely salty! And overpriced (10$ for one)<br><br>Interior is nice, looks more like an Instagram trendy brunch spot than a place for authentic nasi lemak.<br><br>Chendol is good though!<br><br>Long wait time, we came before it opened though so only waited 15min.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=u5FxG3p2FjWNFAmHA_mDQw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Q9YgHz-MPhTDXi_F4j6uXA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Q9YgHz-MPhTDXi_F4j6uXA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Q9YgHz-MPhTDXi_F4j6uXA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Q9YgHz-MPhTDXi_F4j6uXA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Q9YgHz-MPhTDXi_F4j6uXA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Q9YgHz-MPhTDXi_F4j6uXA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Willis W.', 'displayLocation': 'San Gabriel, CA', 'altText': 'Willis W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=u5FxG3p2FjWNFAmHA_mDQw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 294, 'photoCount': 38, 'reviewCount': 429, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I was very disappointed with the service and the clam dish I ordered. I came for a late lunch and half the restaurant was empty but it took a while to get seated and get my order in. The server was very apathetic and obviously didn&#39;t want to be there. I figured it was because I looked like a tourist. We ordered Nasi Lemak and a spicy clam dish. Warning, do not order the clams. They served unopened clams and I asked the waitress if it was edible and she just stared blankly and walked away. I didn&#39;t want to take the risk because I was on vacation but a quarter of the clams were unopened. Please do no serve food that is inedible. <br><br>Nasi Lemak was the only good dish here. It is more expensive than any other place. The flavors were unique and the chicken wasn&#39;t too dry.

Everything is so sub-standard. Rice is not fragrant, chilli not strong nor sweet,  peanut not roasted enough, except chicken is quite nicely fried. Ordered otah and turned up lukewarm. We asked to heat it up, took another 8 mins and still lukewarm. For $12.90 this nasi lemak is not worth the money except if you considered being in aircon room. <br>Most staff has a no smile approach, some even just lazily hang around waiting for the junior staff to do all the work. Too eager to clear and basically hygiene wise, is bad cause the staff just take the tissue from table across my plate where I am still eating. What if something dropped from the tissue then my plate of food is contaminated.

text: The Coconut Club<br>6 Ann Siang Hill<br>Singapore<br><br>Nasi Lemak in air conditioned shop house.<br><br>Very good nasi lemak even though I&#39;m not a nasi lemak fan.<br><br>Ikan bilis are crispy yet not hard. <br><br>For chicken it is only chicken thigh, no other choice. Comes with sambal.<br><br>For fish today it is selar fish. It has just the right texture. Not overcooked like it so often is at Hawker stalls. Black sauce with onions and chilli is so good.<br><br>Kueh salat has a strong taste of I can&#39;t quite make out what (coconut?). Not as good as Chalk Farm&#39;s.<br><br>Chendol has a lot of gula melaka. Okay, not great.<br><br>Ice lemongrass drink. Not nice.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/BlkgGthJFbB8eMNkFm1f0A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coconut-club-singapore?reviewid=GK_SUSH7rSsrwBD3iZA40w&select=BlkgGthJFbB8eMNkFm1f0A', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coconut Club - Singapore, Singapore. Nasi lemak and sayur lemak!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Nasi lemak and sayur lemak!'}]
text: Despite the price tag and what I thought would be too hipster to be good, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food at The Coconut Club! Of course, I still thought it was utterly overpriced, but for a nice restaurant in Club Street with a/c and yummy food? Aiight, I&#39;ll pay for it.<br><br>I went on a Friday night and got a seat right away which is a nice change for Club Street that&#39;s always bustling and with people spilling onto the street. Service was fairly prompt, and it would have been nice to have the specials on the board instead of me having to ask if the menu was all there is to it and then the server then filling in the gaps on their specials of the day.<br><br>I ordered the nasi lemak (of course) and the sayur lemak (which is apparently the less creamy version of sayur lodeh - it certainly tasted that way too) which was one of the specials. The nasi lemak came out looking delicious! The rice was coconut-y and fragrant, the egg was a nice oozy crisp, the ikan bilis was fried without being too hard, the chilli was a little too much on the spicy side (and just not as delicious as the one at Adam Road) and the chicken was glorious. The chicken was a full thigh and drumstick, was marinated in this delicious marinade (lots of local herbs - lemongrass and the like) and fried to juicy perfection. Yum. The sayur lemak had a really good broth - possibly ikan bilis? I made the unfortunate mistake of mixing all the chilli into it and ended up sniffling my way through my meal although it was really quite delicious. Although they also serve alcohol, my dining companion and I both got the lemongrass tea which was serviceable.<br><br>This was all-in-all a very satisfying meal, and although I might still return to Adam Road for my nasi lemak fix (at a much lower price point too), I wouldn&#39;t say no to anyone asking me to get nasi lemak if I were ever in the Club Street area.

text: Too expensive. Chilli was sub par. Chicken was too dry. The Ikan bilis was ok. <br><br>The only good thing was otak otak.<br><br>However unlike most other restaurants in Singapore, customer service was great.

text: Amazing!  I find myself looking forward to this every time I head back to Singapore.<br>It is as close to home made Nasi Lemak as you can find outside.<br>The only thing is they are only open for lunch...

text: Absolutely delicious nasi lemak, with friendly and generous servers that are sensitive to food preferences. Best meal we&#39;ve had in Singapore so far in every way.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8oFVYUVoieIaXvoJlE3-OQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crown-bakery-and-cafe-singapore?reviewid=quzZgZRoYmuv-pbXtilGuw&select=8oFVYUVoieIaXvoJlE3-OQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Crown Bakery & Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Ok7cbappFpHbbusmE0X2_g/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crown-bakery-and-cafe-singapore?reviewid=quzZgZRoYmuv-pbXtilGuw&select=Ok7cbappFpHbbusmE0X2_g', 'altText': 'Photo of Crown Bakery & Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/rwtda62vKJOwIFVRtavO-A/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crown-bakery-and-cafe-singapore?reviewid=quzZgZRoYmuv-pbXtilGuw&select=rwtda62vKJOwIFVRtavO-A', 'altText': 'Photo of Crown Bakery & Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/q_UOwmAqDaBZadELQN6LsQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crown-bakery-and-cafe-singapore?reviewid=quzZgZRoYmuv-pbXtilGuw&select=q_UOwmAqDaBZadELQN6LsQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Crown Bakery & Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: Our gathering was planned at Evans Lodge but we ended up in Crown Bakery instead due to unforeseen circumstances that the place we initially thought was still operating was no where in our sight. Crown Bakery is located in an old school building, Crown Plaza which is about 8 minutes walk from Botanic Garden. I like the contrast between this modern looking bakery and the rundown building.<br><br>Interior of the bakery looks modern and just by one look at its facade, you can tell that they are selling artisan breads.<br><br>Coming here for Brunch, Crown recommends the Crown Breakfast. The price might seem abit step for a brunch but portion is good for 2 pax. Look at the centre of the wooden board! The Crown Puff Pastry was the total scene stealer. They recommend to break the edge of the pastry and dip it into the sunny side up&#39;s egg yolk!  Served along with the centrepiece crown pastry are,  red wine-braised oxtail, chicken cheese sausage, Canadian back bacon, sauteed mushrooms, baked tomato &amp; mesclun salad as its side.<br><br>Crown Breakfast - $29<br><br>Since the Crown is for the King, why not try a dish for the queen, the Eggs Benedict. Though the poached egg might be slightly overcooked, I&#39;m still in love with the combination where poached eggs were served with shaved honey baked ham, both sitting on the Crown&#39;s fluffy Sourdough English Muffin, coupled with Hollandaise sauce and mesclun Salad as its side. You can choose to have sourdough muffin or multigrain but the former is definitely recommended.<br><br>The Queen&#39;s Eggs Ben - $15<br><br>We had something new from the menu and that would be their Steak Sandwich serving with Mesclun Salad as their side too. Ciabatta was Crown&#39;s handcrafted and toasted. What I like best was its mouth watering sirloin steak grilled to medium well perfection, stacked with layers of lettuce, tomatoes and drizzled with onion marmalade and topped with gherkin. Recommended!<br><br>Steak Sandwich - $18<br><br>What a satisfying branch I had! Having visiting Crown Bakery randomly, its definitely worth going back once more for their branch and sandwiches.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/2HPHcjv9IpxyvI7W7vTezg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crown-bakery-and-cafe-singapore?reviewid=KiucKrdQK4ZCDVg1GzYLlA&select=2HPHcjv9IpxyvI7W7vTezg', 'altText': 'Photo of Crown Bakery & Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Earl pear bread pudding ($12). It&#39;s tiny.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Earl pear bread pudding ($12). It's tiny."}]
text: Earl pear bread pudding ($12) - 3 stars<br>3 stars because I paid $3.80 for it using the Sugar app. Otherwise it&#39;d probably be a 2. Don&#39;t think this is worth $12 at all.<br><br>Other breads seem to have a good texture from the little samplers I nibbled on.<br><br>There&#39;s free wifi - they give you a code at the counter that&#39;s valid for an hour.<br><br>Ambience - 4 stars<br>Would love to come back for brunch or tea with friends.<br><br>I tend to park on the roads by Coronation Plaza and Fairprice, but they can get pretty full. Never tried the underground parking lots - maybe those aren&#39;t too expensive.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vx9SxTHT5CH1SBdt08QNJg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crown-bakery-and-cafe-singapore?reviewid=9AiFr8jTZuZ9Ix9ZNiWs7Q&select=vx9SxTHT5CH1SBdt08QNJg', 'altText': 'Photo of Crown Bakery & Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EP0eEHvINiSRED0nit8XfA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crown-bakery-and-cafe-singapore?reviewid=9AiFr8jTZuZ9Ix9ZNiWs7Q&select=EP0eEHvINiSRED0nit8XfA', 'altText': 'Photo of Crown Bakery & Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Almond cheese brioche to go with my flat white coffee - perfect morning', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Almond cheese brioche to go with my flat white coffee - perfect morning'}]
text: Great freshly baked breads and pastries - all baked on site. Simple expresso coffee menu but has an interesting tea selection. Despite the simple coffee list, I enjoyed my flat white, which used a nice chocolatey and nutty roast. I ordered the Almond Cheese Brioche, which was lovely - soft, fluffy and perfectly matched with almond cheese.<br><br>The cafe adopted a Danish look, like those Scandinavian cafes sporting hues of blue, white and lots of natural light. Light jazz music plays in the background. The overall ambience is beautifully enhanced by whiffs of fresh baked breads sneaking in from the glass-separated kitchen/bakery (which was surprisingly well-staffed despite a labor-staff environment here in Singapore)<br><br>I consider the prices on the moderately-high side (not exactly cheap for croissants priced between $2.20 to $2.80).

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Qr-WoW6Vye4aH3I-YZ2ZyQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Steffenie S.', 'displayLocation': 'Bukit Timah, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Steffenie S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Qr-WoW6Vye4aH3I-YZ2ZyQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 341, 'photoCount': 1742, 'reviewCount': 357, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Came here for July Yube with a few Yelpers :)<br><br>Before coming here, did my research on what to get. I wanted to try a number of dishes but I decided to go for two instead. Here are my reviews of what I&#39;ve tried..<br><br>1) Macaron croissant - buttery, crispy and flaky tops, the fillings were not too sweet.<br>2) Earl Grey Orange Loaf for take away - the earl grey flavor is extremely strong and the bread  wasn&#39;t soft. The orange peels and walnuts inside the bread enhanced the taste.<br>3) Lemmy Lemonade for beverage<br>4) New Zealand Cream Cheese Danish - the cheese danish was also flaky (more dessert-like flakes) and tasty and the cream cheese on the top was not too sweet - tried a small bite of this.<br>5) Hainanese chicken bread with chili sauce on the side - mild taste and the small bits of chicken and a dip of chili sauce helped to enhance the chicken rice flavor in the bread. <br><br>This cafe offers both indoor and outdoor seating. Unfortunately the indoor seating is limited so you might need to come at the right time. <br><br>When you go in, you will see different kinds of breads or pastries on the side. Then you will need to line up before you get to the counter where you order dishes or beverages on the menu. <br><br>Unfortunately for us, they got our orders confused or even missed our orders. On my end, they forgot to serve me my drink and had to get the cutleries on my own. Price wise it is definitely on the pricier end as I paid around $15 for three items. <br><br>Will probably go back there to try out their green tea or earl grey brioches in the near future.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hhZ8K7UBJSztdz5kZSOD1Q/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/238-coffee-stall-singapore?reviewid=XoqVv485zTV8NeKE7_IFyA&select=hhZ8K7UBJSztdz5kZSOD1Q', 'altText': 'Photo of 238 Coffee Stall - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: This stall offers the best &#39;homemade&#39; iced lemon tea in Tiong Bahru Market.<br><br>I&#39;ve actually tried the iced lemon tea at every stall, and personally hate the ones where they add that lemon/lime syrup drink to enhance the citrus flavour.<br><br>Not here. Here it&#39;s just brewed black tea, already refrigerated and portioned, topped up with ice, and then jazzed up with a freshly squeezed lemon wedge and a slice of lemon. It&#39;s sometimes a wee bit too sweet (they&#39;re not always perfectly consistent), but generally it really hits the spot.<br><br>The sugar cane is also very good. <br><br>If you can&#39;t find it, it&#39;s basically the corner stall that&#39;s on your right as you come up the escalator.

I&#39;m usually adverse to hawker centres because they are such warm, crowded places. So for me, there&#39;d better be darn good food to be worth the trip down, and a great stall with iced drinks. Thankfully, I&#39;ve found 238 to be consistent each and every time I&#39;ve visited. While people swear by the kopi, I just can&#39;t because it&#39;s simply too hot. Instead, I always opt for the sugar cane with lemon, freshly squeezed and strained on the spot. I&#39;ve tried all the sugar cane stalls there are at Tiong Bahru Market, and 238 still remains unsurpassed. Icy, sweet, tangy, and importantly, sugar cane fibre free. The server inside will first pick out a fat wedge of lemon and squeeze the juice into a plastic cup filled with ice before plonking the squashed lemon body inside. The cup is then filled to the brim with sugar cane and handed over to you, while you dish up your measly $1.40. It&#39;s a small price to pay for a refreshing cup full of temperature regulating joy.

text: We were looking for more Thai Milk Tea after our trip to Thailand and we heard about Tuk Tuk Cha. <br><br>Their Thai Milk tea is pretty authentic! It was a little too much on the sweet side for me, but you can customize how much sweetness/ice you want when you order.

Iced lemongrass drink', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Iced lemongrass drink'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9rektdXPF5Xh3cXHPrbH5g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tuk-tuk-cha-singapore-2?reviewid=Iw0toEDwEU7mHiGBzbumdQ&select=9rektdXPF5Xh3cXHPrbH5g', 'altText': 'Photo of Tuk Tuk Cha - Singapore, Singapore. Aloha coconut shibuya', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Aloha coconut shibuya'}]
text: I like the shibuya toast. Warm and buttery with coconut ice cream dripping on it, it was pretty awesome. As a snack or dessert, it was more than enough to feed 3 of us. We also had the iced lemongrass drink which was not very sweet and was refreshing. <br><br>The place was smallish with a huge table and chairs around it so you would have to share the space with others. <br><br>The service was also quite non-existent. The whole time we were there, I felt like the staff could not wait to get rid of us (or any customers). They did not inform us when our order was ready, and when we realized it and went to collect the food, the vibe given was how could we not know the food was waiting. <br><br>We had trouble finding this and actually walked up and down the stretch 3-4 times while consulting the directory map. Turned out it is a kiosk like stand in the middle of the walkway. This is next to Boost Juice and faces away from Kay Lee roast meat.

Milo toast $3.80', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Milo toast $3.80'}]
text: From the owners of the Bedok Point $1 boat noodles come Tuk Tuk Cha!<br><br>Tuk Tuk is the famous motorcycle taxi used in Thailand. The staff here are all mostly thai and you can tell, once you make your order!<br><br>They sell thai milk tea, green tea thai milk tea, yuan yang and other hot and cold drinks ranging from $1.70-$3.20.<br><br>A regular thai milk tea costs $2.80 and a large costs $3.20. I had a regular thai milk tea $2.80 with mango pearls 50cents which I really enjoyed. The mango juice bursting in your mouth wasn&#39;t the best idea with the thai milk tea but it was still refreshing.<br><br>I witnessed the staff boiling and pouring the thai milk tea, so you&#39;re assured you&#39;re getting real thai milk tea! The entire dining area sits maybe 10 people, at bar top level. The whole area is surrounded by hundreds of carnation milk cans!<br><br>We also had toast with thai milk tea kaya $3.80. Yes there&#39;s like 9 cubes of bread for like $3.80. It might sound overpriced by I really loved the crispy exterior of the bread, together with the fluffy inside that seemed to have butter melted on the inside.<br><br>I wouldn&#39;t eat this daily for sure, as I would rather get my kaya toast, but it is a nice treat. They have also recently expanded to have an outlet in raffles city, next to gong cha and also a heartland outlet in Sun Plaza, Sembawang.

Thai Milk Tea, Homemade Lemongrass', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Thai Milk Tea, Homemade Lemongrass'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Q8Sd0Gdkg6RUbT3WVWshCg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tuk-tuk-cha-singapore-2?reviewid=tP2frDWl9eIs_u85M_dbDw&select=Q8Sd0Gdkg6RUbT3WVWshCg', 'altText': 'Photo of Tuk Tuk Cha - Singapore, Singapore. Aloha Coconut Shibuya Roast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Aloha Coconut Shibuya Roast'}]
text: Tuk Tuk Cha is a small cafe offering thai style desserts and drinks. Currently it has 4 outlets in Singapore. One of the outlets is located in Suntec City Mall. The cafe was small with a small dine in area of about 10 paxs. One would not miss the tuk tuk vehicle which front the dine in area when passing by the shop.<br><br>Aloha Coconut Shibuya Roast ($10.80)<br>It was served with coconut ice-cream, shredded fresh coconut, and honey, on top of the crispy toast. Although the toast looked quite thick, it sliced easily as it was quite crispy. The toast itself was quite yummy being buttery and honey sweet. The ice cream was quite milky and rich. Overall quite a delicious combination.<br><br>Thai Milk Tea ($2.80/regular), Homemade Lemongrass ($2.80/regular)<br>Not sure if the toast was too sweet. We felt that the drinks were just nice and not too sweet.<br><br>Overall the food was great. Service was great too. Although we were the last customers left, the staffs did not chase us out.

Stumbled across Tuk Tuk Cha while roaming around Suntec City, and found the homemade taro kaya toast to be fantastic. You get 9 cubes of toast with a serving of taro kaya sauce for $3.80 which I thought was reasonable. Paying $10.80 for an entire toast topped with ice cream seemed a bit much in my opinion. <br><br>The toast was perfectly crisp and conveniently bite sized. The Taro kaya sauce was delicious, not too sweet yet enough to give your toast the kick it needed. <br><br>I also tried the Thai green milk tea which is priced at $2.80. Previous yelpers had noted how they witnessed the workers brewing the tea right in front of them, but my experience was a bit different. Perhaps they have tried to operationalize the practice to be more efficient, but all I saw was the workers pouring pre-made Thai milk tea into my cup and sealing it. I think it took away from my perception of authenticity, but regardless, the drink was good. <br><br>I would perhaps come back here if I happen to be hungry in suntec, but likely would not come back craving it.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Nt6PM7c1I-06abuHqUhKmA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tuk-tuk-cha-singapore-2?reviewid=W16aapcHzs4QqjCBTM3ZGg&select=Nt6PM7c1I-06abuHqUhKmA', 'altText': 'Photo of Tuk Tuk Cha - Singapore, Singapore. Aloha coconut shibuya toast.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Aloha coconut shibuya toast.'}]
text: Super mediocre. I came here because I saw a mouth watering photo of the shibuya toast on a blog site. What a lie! <br><br>I&#39;m all for &#34;Instagram worthy&#34; food pictures but the presentation of the toast sucked. It was served in a plastic container. It did not look nice to eat. It was not only because of the presentation, but also how it tasted. The toast literally tastes just like toast. Topped with coconut ice cream. And some pieces of coconut meat. Nothing extraordinary about it at all. The portion was quite small too. Disappointing. <br><br>However, the drink I ordered was delicious. Green Thai milk tea. It tasted like green tea and Thai milk tea blended together (duh). It was really nice.
nice place. only issue is car park is not nearby.<br><br>food is good. a nice place to chill out and also casual business meeting

text: The cafe has been a staple of Dempsey for years. Of course the food is great but the ambience and lots of greenery around the cafe makes this such a great location to just chill. <br>Whatever you decide to have, you must always leave some room for its sticky date pudding - my one weakness and must have at PS Cafe.

text: What a cute little café! Not only is the name cute, but the whole café is just a joy to dine in.  My bestie Ginny and I enjoyed a relaxing brunch at this beautiful café, and I must confess I was in love.<br><br>The Place:  PS Café opened up in 1999 as a cozy café hidden within Projectshop clothing store in Singapore.  It&#39;s what one would imagine when thinking of Sunday brunches and lazy afternoon teas and has since opened up several branches and become a popular choice for locals and Expats alike.  The one that I went to is just a little hidden and off the beaten path within Dempsey (i.e. hipper and prettier version of Orchard).  It&#39;s this little white, glass house nestled in beautiful greenery.   You can&#39;t help but smile when you see it.  White brick walls and dark wooden floors welcomes you as you step into the restaurant.  Weather permitting, I highly recommend you get a table on the patio, where you can just stare into the beautiful surrounding. <br><br>The Food: So, beautiful and hip ....does equal pricey menu.  Not going to lie, PS Café is on the pricier side in terms of brunches, for the both of us brunch came out to be approx.. $80!  Ginny and I both had their special &#34;Portobello Mushrooms, Poached Eggs, and Asparagus&#34; which set us back $24 each (buuuuuuut it was super delicious), fresh orange juice $9.50 x 2, and coffee $4.00 x 2.  In addition to the menu items, there is also a large display of baked goods, ranging from muffins to carrot cake....mmmmmmm!  We both really enjoyed our time and our meal there - but maybe not an everyday place for me (would have given it 4 stars if it was a bit less). <br><br>Tip: They are famous for their fries! I didn&#39;t try them as I was too full but next time, I&#39;ll be sure to try their Truffle Fries ($15).  If you guys try it, let me know how it goes.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/x5j3jLRKwVcMA2kwdP-YkA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=4_x5GXHosn5iXJblXRw3AA&select=x5j3jLRKwVcMA2kwdP-YkA', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: On our last night in Singapore, we ventured out to Dempsey Hill and had dinner at P.S. Cafe. We got seated outdoors in the patio and the weather was perfect.  The truffle fries were addicting but I mostly enjoyed the bolognese than the burger (my friend and I shared each other&#39;s entrees).  We also made sure to save room for dessert. I&#39;m not a big fan of banana cake, but let me tell you, the banana cake was to die for!<br><br>[TIP] They will call a cab for you.

text: When you are in Dempsey Hill, PS Café is most recommended place to visit for drink, or coffee or light meal or brunch.<br><br>It is located little off from the museum, galleries, shops area but distance is walkable.. 5 minutes from shops...<br><br>It is not clearly visible from outside but be sure to look for PS Cafe sign.  I think best choice would be to use google map.  I got lost and I got a help from Google Map.   Entrance is like walking into someone&#39;s garden..  After 50 ft of walk into forest/garden path, you will see beautiful restaurant/café.<br><br>I noticed most of the customer&#39;s were foreigners or tourist..  I don&#39;t think local people comes here since everything is little pricey.<br><br>I love the interior design..  So beautiful.  Very modern looking with classical touches throughout the restaurant.  I wanted to seat outside at the patio but weather was just too hot..  Inside is fully air conditioned.<br><br>I visited this location around 3 PM.  It was too early for dinner so I had Lychee drink and cake for dessert...  Chocolate cake was so good.. But taste of coffee was so so...

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MpGM4qSOdpCO4bpuyRJ--g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=wzCc_daNLXydmsWXRa_HDA&select=MpGM4qSOdpCO4bpuyRJ--g', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. atmosphere at night', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'atmosphere at night'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yaDyeIYsQsUeVEBGH74EfA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=wzCc_daNLXydmsWXRa_HDA&select=yaDyeIYsQsUeVEBGH74EfA', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Amazing architecture', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Amazing architecture'}]
text: I was torn - on whether to give 2 or 3 stars, and decided on 3 as I am an architectural geek, and this place had me from the get go.<br>When I first saw it, it reminded me of the case study houses in California - white, mostly glass, Bauhaus style. Sitting remotely in that beautiful greenery, which just adds to the effect. <br><br>However, the most beautiful architecture does not help when the main purpose of a place does not live up to its premise.<br><br>We arrived late Sunday afternoon for tea and drinks and had to wait for some time to order. The guy seemed funny at first but then pulled a face at my husbands order of a Negroni and a salad. Sounds strange but I was there..<br><br>When our drinks and food arrived, my husband had to get rid of around 10 ice cubes from his drink, reducing the (very watery and non-Negroni tasting) cocktail to a shot.<br><br>My Bloody Mary was ok but for the price I was expecting a highball size, at least, and not a water glass.<br><br>To cut the whole story short, we stayed longer, enjoyed the view and the quiet, but the service (we had 5 different people over the course of our stay attending to us, extremely slow, kept forgetting orders etc.) would&#39;ve made me leave otherwise.<br><br>I wanted to love it, but the extortionate bill does not match the service provided or the &#34;OK&#34; food - not to mention the inconsistency with drinks.

text: Guys, before I even START my review, I have to sing the praises of PS&#39;s HEAVENLY sticky date pudding. That was the BEST dessert to EVER hit my tongue. I can&#39;t believe it. It was hot, moist, just the right density, the sauce was perfectly caramelly with just a little saltiness, and the vanilla bean icecream completed the whole thing. Like, man. That was so good. <br><br>Two things to know before dining here: if it&#39;s busy, you might wait 40+mins for food, and if you&#39;re sitting outside, bring mosquito repellent. There&#39;s not many bugs out there, but if you&#39;re like me and happen to be a walking Mozzie Buffet, sitting right by the jungle can be an....er, interesting experience. <br><br>HOWEVER. The food here is great! I absolutely LOVED their Pad Thai Salad - the prawns were tender and well cleaned, the veggies were fresh and crunchy, and the peanut sauce and flavourful spices were delicious. 10/10 would order again. I also loved their ranges of Gin - the subtle tastes and flavours were really fun to explore. <br><br>Tried the truffle fries and honestly don&#39;t have too much to say. They were pretty average, and the first batch we had to send back to the kitchen because they were stone cold :/ the hot ones were nice enough, but I wouldn&#39;t order them again. <br><br>Also, I&#39;ve already raved about their Sticky Date, but we also grabbed PS&#39;s specialty brownie...which actually wasn&#39;t that great, to be honest! It looks FASCINATING, stacked a mile high with huge fluffy marshmallows and covered with ganache, but the brownie itself was more the consistency of a sponge, and it was sickeningly sweet. Even the ice cream wasn&#39;t enough of a break between the hectic chocolate gooeyness, so we all ended up going cross-eyed from sugar overload and only eating 1/4 of the slice all up. Considering the calibre of the other meals we ordered, this one was a bit of a disappointment. <br><br>Service: 4/5 stars<br>Food: 4/5 stars overall<br>Atmosphere: 5/5 stars<br>Speed: 1.5/5 stars on a busy day.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/TvL9EZQ6tjl23zAJqRhJ5g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=qTx_di3g3jiagGeNL39Yew&select=TvL9EZQ6tjl23zAJqRhJ5g', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. decadent truffle fries', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'decadent truffle fries'}]
text: I came here on a Thursday night with a friend. We usually operate on a tight budget so this was a rare indulgence for both of us. <br><br>I ordered the PS Burger and shared a plate of truffle fries and a sticky date pudding with my friend. <br><br>I wasn&#39;t a huge fan of the burger as I felt like it was a little bland. The fries that came with the burger, however, were thickly cut and wonderful! They came with a mayo dip that seemed to be infused with a zesty taste and some herb that I couldn&#39;t quite identify. In short, it was wonderful.<br><br>The truffle fries and pudding were, as always, sinful goodness. Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to visit the cafe. <br><br>The atmosphere was great, as always, but service was slow. We came before the peak dining period but still faced issues with having our water refilled in a timely fashion. Though, that wasn&#39;t too big of an issue in the grander scheme of things. <br><br>All in all, a great place to visit!

text: Not my favourite restaurant. The good thing of the restaurant is its location, Dempsey hill and the restaurant is nicely decorated. However, service is bad, I visited this restaurant twice and both times it took really long to wave your hands around to get attention of staff to come to serve you. Some staff even got annoyed when being called them. <br><br>Food quality is not matching the expensive price. I tried several main dishes there but they could not make any good impact on my memory.

I&#39;ve been here several times and yes... PS Cafe can be pretty overpriced... and yes... Not everything is AMAZING. But I love the vibe of the original restaurant at Dempsey and I can&#39;t ever complain about my favorite sticky date pudding so I will always keep coming back.<br><br>Whenever I visit PS Cafe, I&#39;ll always order the sticky date pudding or the ginger pudding. Both are delicious and I always make room for them. Not a fan of anything a la mode though, so I usually request for the ice-cream on the side, or not at all. Their cakes go great with tea (or coffee, if you are on that side of the camp) and their selection is fair but nothing to gush over.<br><br>My favorite thing about PS Cafe at Harding Road is its amazing location and how it feels like a greenhouse that&#39;s cool (thank you air-conditioning) and yet is surrounded by greenery everywhere. And the best part is how a lot of the greenery was kept as it was and isn&#39;t some pruned garden that they created around the restaurant. It makes for a lovely afternoon visit so you can enjoy being surrounded by nature.

text: Came here for a brunch on Sunday. Foods are excellent. I order a lasagna and my wife some chicken parmigiano. Although the chicken they brought was not well cooked (still a little bit pink, which is not advised for pregnant women), the taste was still good. They made a new one but the quantity looked smaller.<br>I enjoyed my lasagna, making me want to bake one myself soon.<br><br>The environment is nice, with a direct view on the park.<br><br>Giving only 3 stars because the chicken was not well cooked and no free WIFI !

text: This is a great place to have an afternoon chill time with friends. PS Cafe has both indoor and outdoor seating areas. The surrounding lush greeneries keep the place shaded and cool. <br><br>My friends and I visited PS Cafe for tea and dessert. Although we planned for just having the cakes, we had to order the truffles fries- the smell was just too tempting! The desserts are alright- not bad! <br><br>I say- visit this place if u have to chill and enjoy the ambiance.

Grapefruit Lychee Caipiroska', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Grapefruit Lychee Caipiroska'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kkgr7JuN9xIxMVSKqvSjwQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=9ySSQCud9FtWk7MpRWg1lA&select=kkgr7JuN9xIxMVSKqvSjwQ', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Flourless Orange Cake (with orange butterscotch sauce)... I think.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Flourless Orange Cake (with orange butterscotch sauce)... I think.'}]
text: Came for Thursday afternoon tea with a friend.<br><br>tl;dr: Great atmosphere, cakes are generous for their price, drinks are yummy. Oh, the smell of truffle fries wants me to come back...<br><br>Overall score: 4.2/5 - will return. Great for tea.<br><br>---<br>Atmosphere<br>---<br>PS Cafe on 28B Harding Road isn&#39;t easy to find unless you know what you&#39;re looking for, but when you do find it, you&#39;ll realize why. The entrance is to the &#34;back&#34; of the establishment if you&#39;re coming from Dempsey Hill, and is located on Harding Road on the way to the White Rabbit. It&#39;s sunk low into the ground, on a hill.<br><br>The interior decor is astounding, and it clearly reflects its founders&#39; taste in fashion and design (did you know that PS Cafe stands for Project Shop Cafe, for back when it was a cafe attached to a fashion goods store?) A tall ceiling combined with floor-to-ceiling glass partitions keeps the venue air-conditioned and cool while maintaining the feel that you&#39;re still sitting in a cafe in the middle of a rainforest. While the view looks down the hill at the side of a clump of trees/the forest, it actually adds to the experience as the wood is mirrored in the construction of PS Cafe.<br><br>Chalkboards subtly hint at menu options in discreet locations, while the volume stays at a level where you&#39;re not afraid to talk above a whisper, but neither are you struggling to hear what your buddies are talking about.<br><br>Score: 4.5/5<br><br>---<br>Food/Drinks<br>---<br>My buddy and I split a slice of the Golden Banana Butterscotch Cake. Originally, I thought we were going to order our own slices, but then he pointed out how big they were. They&#39;re quite sizable, and for tea or dessert, one is perfectly fine for two people to share. It wasn&#39;t overly dry nor wet, and the taste of banana was subtle and not overbearing. It was accompanied by ice cream, which complimented it perfectly. For the price you&#39;re paying, it was well worth it.<br><br>I had a Grapefruit Lychee Caipiroska, which I thought was splendid and refreshing for the hot day that it was. A little too much ice for my liking, but it came with sliced grapefruit and lychees floating inside, a touch of effort which I greatly appreciate in a drink. Flavorful and yummy, took the edge off of the vodka that was used, which was perfect.<br><br>I will add a caveat that this place has me wanting to come back after seeing my friend&#39;s coffee affogato and smelling the truffle fries from the table next to ours.<br><br>Score: 4/5<br><br>---<br>Service<br>---<br>Polite and friendly would be how I would describe service. Despite ordering maybe two drinks and one food dish, the servers let us continue to sit for about two hours, even though the first sitting for dinner was already filtering in and being served (I felt woefully underdressed in my shorts at this point in time, lol).<br><br>Score: 4/5<br><br>---<br>Miscellaneous<br>---<br>Nothing to say here that I haven&#39;t already said.<br><br>Score: nil/5

text: This place is the poster child for over priced trash , nice venue , very attentive staff. <br>Nice place for coffee or drink. But avoid the over priced menu. Plain and simple food just isn&#39;t nice or worth the price.

text: The view and location reminds me a lot of Ubud, in Bali amidst the greenery. I come here almost every Sunday, and it was never the time we don&#39;t queue up for atleast a good 20 minutes. It is always so packed!<br><br>The food is good- I tried the steak sandwich and the burger. They come with fries on the side, instead of normal fries I normally switch it to truffle fries. Ordering the truffle fries alone is such a waste as I only come with one other person. The truffle fries comes in big serving... And I can&#39;t get enough of it! It&#39;s damn good! I like the chicken parmigiana too. The spaghetti aglio olio was alright.<br><br>Lastly, don&#39;t go home without having dessert. Everyone kept saying the pecan lime cake, but please do try the banana butterscoth which comes with ice cream! It&#39;s so on point and u will never regret it. It&#39;s a big portion, so you might want to share it with someone :)

text: Well wow wow whoa. This place was a bit of a trip. Beautifully designed with fun drink and food menus but almost too westernized for our taste that evening and that early into our trip. If you&#39;re looking for the flavors of home (US) in the shape of a juicy burger and fries, this place won&#39;t disappoint. Well, I wasn&#39;t disappointed. My date wanted more from the burger (he&#39;s hella laowai) but the scraps he gave me were delish. Be prepared to spend some cashola but for the quality, portions and ambiance, it&#39;s worth it.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/6KQO-zmP9CKqevaKKDWmPg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=JTjFRHmzLyvjuuX6JNGTeg&select=6KQO-zmP9CKqevaKKDWmPg', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Reuben sandwich. Very soggy. Very wilted. Very sad.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Reuben sandwich. Very soggy. Very wilted. Very sad.'}]
text: &#34;The ambience is nice, but the food is so-so.&#34; - I&#39;m definitely misquoting Paik Choo here. <br><br>For ladies-that-lunch and you KNOW you need to have that little finger crooked while you sip your tea with a slice of lemon. If being seen while you have your coffee and cake is important, then THIS is the place.<br><br>Service - The waiters are generally more pleasant and attentive. The hostess had an incredible dismissive and disdainful attitude. She actually made me feel bad for trying to spend money at her place of employment. Too bad I was too lazy to find another place to eat. Damn my lack of principles! And I found such a nice sheltered parking lot, too.<br><br>Food - Truffle fries - Meh. Shepard&#39;s pie - salty, other assorted mains, too uneventful to remember. Reuben sandwich (see pic) sad and wilted.<br><br>Desserts - Cakes are huge. But expensive. So share if you must. Cakes are on the dry side. And had a dense sponge texture. Like a kitchen sink sponge. Not that I have tasted one. (That&#39;s my story I&#39;m sticking to it.)<br><br>Price - The price of starters and entrees are stupidly expensive. I mean, seriously ridiculous.  $8 for a coke, go figure. $28 to $40 for entrees. Desserts are about $18. Wha-what?<br><br>Final note: I come here at most once a year. Only because I work 5 minutes away, and its a nice place to bring overseas colleagues to impress them. I am shallow that way. But beyond that, there are a million other places with better food and better service.

If you want to die of a heat stroke and get shitty service, go to PS Cafe.  I&#39;m starting to think that either my brunch expectations are too high, or my friends don&#39;t like me.  <br>Either way, I keep going to brunch places that everyone RAVES about, and I&#39;m left scratching my head thinking, did I come to the right place?  <br><br>Headed over to meet a g/f for Sunday brunch around noon, thankfully she was there a bit early and snagged us a table, as the que was quite long otherwise.  <br><br>It took A WHILE for the waiter to come over to take our order, which I understand they were busy, come 20 minutes to take a drink order?  Nope.  We literally had to wave the guy over.  <br><br>Ordered my drink order, which he messed up, I drank my $18 lychee (it was supposed to be peach) anyway because I was scared it would take another 30 minutes to get one, and off we went.  <br><br>I had the eggs florentine, we split a salad and friend had bolognese.  My eggs needed salt.  I&#39;m still getting used to the fact that they don&#39;t put salt and pepper shakers on the table here (perhaps I&#39;ll keep some in my purse) so I asked for salt and it never came.  It took another 30 minutes to clear my plate, and another 20 for the bill.  By this time, something happened to the A/C as I was sweating my ass off.  Literally, my ass was stuck to the seat.  And I was wearing a dress.  Not cute.  Honestly for a $175 brunch (2 entrees, a split salad, 3 drinks, and thats IT) I expect a hell of a lot more on the service front than that.  It&#39;s a damn shame because the place is super cute, and the menu looked great, although I would skip the florentine.  Not good.  Will I come back?  Highly doubtful, if I want to sweat like that, I&#39;ll hit a hot yoga class.

text: We&#39;ve been to the restaurant on Dempsey Hill a couple of times now. The first time around was for brunch on the weekend. It was packed. We were both cheating our Paleo lifestyle because we weren&#39;t feeling well and were craving comfort food. <br><br>I had the special, which was crab cakes and poached eggs (I think - it&#39;s been awhile). The food was awesome and so was the long black coffee. They brought us a dish of honey for our coffee that was awesome - thick, gooey, and not overly sweet. Not a big deal to most, but I take my coffee pretty seriously! :) Hubby ordered the shepherd&#39;s pie, which was good, but not what he expected. It&#39;s a bit different than the American version because it has ground beef prepared similar to spaghetti sauce inside of it. The views were gorgeous and we were very pleased.<br><br>Our second trip was for dinner last night. We sat outside and I started out with the Pimm&#39;s Cooler, which is my favorite drink in all of Singapore thus far. I ordered the burger, hold the cheese and the bun and he got the chicken parm, hold the cheese and croutons. Totally hit the spot, and our server did a great job delivering our order - I know we can be a pain trying to make dishes work for Paleo. <br><br>This place is definitely our speed and we&#39;ll be back again and again.

text: Everything was amazing. The foods were really good although the portion was little big. I especially liked the mushroom soup. Fish with soba was also very good. BLT sandwich was also amazing.

Been here a few times for desserts. I particular like their dark chocolate cake which was very decadent and has a rich chocolatey flavor. The slice is huge though and comes with an ice-cream so would recommend sharing.  Their cheesecake is also quite good. A bit pricey but ambience is nice / a good place to meet up with friends.

Not my favorite place.  Menu is boring and nothing special.  I ordered Caesar salad and the dressing was warm, really really warm.  I&#39;m not opposed to warm salads, but it needs to be listed in the menu as such.  But it was a creamy based dressing and that makes me nervous as I&#39;ve had food poisoning from Warm Caesar salads.  <br><br>Staff refused to just take salad off of our Bill afer only eating two bites.  (I thought I may just had a portion that happen to be near the heat lamp so I tried another side of the dish) They insisted to give me another which when u explained that I do not like warm Caesar Salads.  They still brought me a new one and it was STILL VERY WARM.  I ended up leaving it there as I had no use for a dish I did not want.  I suggested they mention in the menu that this dish is served warm.  I think it fell on deaf ears.<br><br>There are so many restaurants in Singapore especially Dempsey Hill, that this is not worth even considering

The PS Cafe on Harding Road is a really nice refuge from the people and noise of the city. In general I am a city person but sometimes it is nice to go somewhere calmer. I have always felt that it is nice and calm and have always received good service here even when it is busy. <br><br>The food is however nothing special, I have had some of the brunch dishes such as as the pad thai and the &#39;leftover&#39; lasagna. The pad thai is decent but considering that there are a lot of Thai restaurants in Singapore I would say that one can get it cheaper and better elsewhere. The lasagna is nice but not something to base a visit on.<br><br>What I mostly like to do here is actually just have a drink and enjoy the environment. If it is busy they will most likely want you to eat something and my experience that most things are decent but nothing is outstanding or surprising. I do still not necessarily think that it is bad thing, I do sometimes not seek the new or exciting thing and then this can very well do.

I ordered the Morocco Miracle stack and it was one of the best dishes I have ever had. The seasoning was delightful, the vegetables had excellent flavor, and the presentation was beautiful. My husband had the smoked salmon benedict and it was superb. The hollandaise sauce was good, not a easy task. The service was good, attentive while still allowing us to enjoy the table. <br><br>The only reason that I am not giving this 5 stars is because the desserts were not as good as they could have been--not as decadent--given their description and presentation. (I have only been impressed with one dessert in Singapore, but I think PS.Cafe has what it takes to get the desserts on the map.) <br><br>Frosting on M&#39;s Carrot Cake, though perfect in taste and texture, is not enough in quantity given the size of the slice. It needs layers of frosting throughout to take it to the next level. <br><br>Dark Chocolate Banana Cheesecake had a suggestion of dark chocolate on the top. When the first words are &#34;dark chocolate&#34; I am looking for dark chocolate and this was Banana Cheesecake, though again the flavor was excellent and the texture was heavenly.<br><br>Flourless Orange Cake with orange butterscotch sauce was delicious. The orange was subtle, the butterscotch sauce superb, but I think again this is more of a cheesecake than a flourless cake. <br><br>I will return and order dessert as I desperately want to find the 5th star!

text: Love this place. The food and drinks were really good. The ambience was great. Can&#39;t wait to go back.
