Dessert menu', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Dessert menu'}]
text: Came with 3 friends on a Saturday night. I made reservation so I did not have to wait long before seated (Poor lady in front of me who didn&#39;t make prior reservation had to wait quite a bit).<br><br>The place is softly lighted. Although it&#39;s crowded, my friends agreed that this cafe is a pleasant hangout place for chilling or long dinners.<br><br>As for the food, the portions are huge and prices for mains range from $20 - $30. I ordered some curry rosemary lamb meatballs with long grain rice. The meatballs came in the size of ping pong balls. I like how the balls had the very mild lamb taste and stuffed a few pine nuts for that few surprise chews. We also ordered truffle fries. I have tried their fries at Ann Siang Hill outlet prior to this and it was delicious. But this outlet over fried the fries. So my friends didn&#39;t get why I was raving about it.<br><br>Overall this is a nice cafe for relaxing if you have a car or take cab. I took around 10 mins walk from the nearest bus stop.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=-SJ5GJ2WDxWC2IFyPJczvg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/O352q3Dwp8MyfKGlXUK8XA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/O352q3Dwp8MyfKGlXUK8XA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/O352q3Dwp8MyfKGlXUK8XA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/O352q3Dwp8MyfKGlXUK8XA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/O352q3Dwp8MyfKGlXUK8XA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/O352q3Dwp8MyfKGlXUK8XA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Mr. S.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco Bay Area, CA', 'altText': 'Mr. S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=-SJ5GJ2WDxWC2IFyPJczvg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 8, 'photoCount': 9, 'reviewCount': 187, 'eliteYear': None}
text: 4 stars for restaurant location, design and vibe. <br>2 stars for inattentive staff who either couldn&#39;t be bothered or just poorly trained. <br>2 stars for food. Two bland burgers and one pasta with a few shrimp, no drinks, no appetizers for $110. <br><br>P.S. I pass.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Z314KOC6_43Bu6F-ksRJ-g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eWTMEk03b6C1ymn-5A7OXQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eWTMEk03b6C1ymn-5A7OXQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eWTMEk03b6C1ymn-5A7OXQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eWTMEk03b6C1ymn-5A7OXQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eWTMEk03b6C1ymn-5A7OXQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eWTMEk03b6C1ymn-5A7OXQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Catalin D.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Catalin D.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Z314KOC6_43Bu6F-ksRJ-g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 4, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 22, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Served uncooked chicken. Sent it back and waited for replacement dish. No luck, no one cared so I asked for the check and left hungrier than when I came. Not coming back

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=PZyv5app-Gjt0rvtppP5TA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/tzHGDNHRXCy5MLMHSI1C4Q/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/tzHGDNHRXCy5MLMHSI1C4Q/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/tzHGDNHRXCy5MLMHSI1C4Q/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/tzHGDNHRXCy5MLMHSI1C4Q/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/tzHGDNHRXCy5MLMHSI1C4Q/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/tzHGDNHRXCy5MLMHSI1C4Q/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jeff Z.', 'displayLocation': 'Boston, MA', 'altText': 'Jeff Z.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=PZyv5app-Gjt0rvtppP5TA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 30, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 7, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Food is good. Atmosphere very good, kinda like a favorite hangout place for the housewives of Singapore. A bit pricey though

You can&#39;t beat the location of this spot and the decor was on point, unfortunately the rest really leaves something to be desired.<br><br>It was brunch time on the weekend but luckily we only waited about half an hour for a table.  They have an automated queue which seemed tricky for some patrons to figure out.  You have to enter a phone number so they can call you when your table is ready which can be an issue with international roaming fees.<br><br>The service for a place this pricey needs to be better.  Our server wasn&#39;t pleasant.  She seemed experienced but like she really just doesn&#39;t enjoy her job.  We were hoping for some condiments to accompany our truffle fries but she never came by to ask if we needed anything/how the food was.<br><br>The food was mediocre at best.  I ordered a club sandwich that had egg with creamed spinach.  The texture was mush and the flavors didn&#39;t work for me.  B had the chicken parm and wasn&#39;t overwhelmed with enthusiasm for it.  The portion of the truffle fries was huge but they were just meh.  <br><br>Our drinks were the most questionable part of the meal.  We ordered the fresh veg/fruit blends and were extremely put off that they were separated and warm.  I didn&#39;t really want to finish it but with such a hefty price and in desperate need of some greens, down the hatch it went.  <br><br>This place has SO much potential.  It was super busy so clearly people are willing to forgive the mediocre food and sub par service... shame, it could be so much more and a much better experience for guests.

I used to love going to PS Cafe for brunch during the weekend but I find that since practically a year, the food quality has degraded.<br>Is it cost cutting?, I am not sure but I wish their food was a good as before...<br>For example, their steak sandwich used to be so good. But the last time I ordered it, the bread and steak was different and ended up not being as tasty as before. The meat is so thin and dry now compare to the thick juicy one before.

A nice place it is, indeed!<br>The food: okay - but very far from delicious. We (4pers.) have visited this place for Dinner yesterday and really liked the Restaurant for its nice interieur. <br>We ordered Salads and Mains, it did not even took five minutes to receive our food after ordering - but... unfortunately sauces tasted the same (different meals). One main dish, a pasta, was very far from &#34;al dente&#34;.<br>Also, ordered a fresh juice from the menu and asked for a small extra. The waiter answered a &#34;no can&#34; because... we were told from the staff the juices are pre-mixed, not freshly made - well, but the menu offered &#34;fresh&#34; juices. <br>We finally got the impression: Sauces, Juices, Pasta,... all is pre-mixed, pre-cooked... no, we cannot recommend. One star for the Interiour design. None for the food. There are much better restaurants to go in Singapore.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/SEQHF88iiaQWAafR6Cb8RA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=LOo3hbt8org1ikqoTBfLNw&select=SEQHF88iiaQWAafR6Cb8RA', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: P.S Cafe is a quaint spot with a large seating area inside and outside. The acoustics do get a little echoey with all the glass walls, so I would suggest a sitting arrangement outside. <br><br>Had some coffee there and the sights are just great. You almost feel like you&#39;re in the great outdoors, only in the safe confinement of a modern structure. <br><br>The parking is fantastic. There are several reasons why I might brag about it, firstly its free, secondly its just by the road so its only a short distance walk, thirdly its a change from all the systematic parking you&#39;ll find in Singapore. I do enjoy good parking lots :P<br><br>The one and only reason why I frequent this place, the ambiance is to die for! And the parkings great, and the architecture is inspiring, and the service is decent, and the food is pretty good, and the coffee is good.... Yeah you get my point.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/QcCZbgTEadHX5cwLwIz6QA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=ZKr6A2wphix7JT-eE16mdw&select=QcCZbgTEadHX5cwLwIz6QA', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Interior of PS Cafe', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Interior of PS Cafe'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vNc-u90zV0MpUospBq5Muw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=ZKr6A2wphix7JT-eE16mdw&select=vNc-u90zV0MpUospBq5Muw', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Ribs', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Ribs'}]
text: Really like this place can&#39;t believe I&#39;ve only just discovered it - have always known it was here, but its so well hidden behind the foliage in Dempsey that you don&#39;t really notice it when you drive past - it has a little secret garden feel to it walking up to the place, but once you&#39;re inside its high ceilings, lights, cake, laughter - the quiet exterior is completely different from the warm interior. <br><br>Although pricey, it is a lovely place to go for a special night out or a date - and the food is surprisingly good!  The portions are big, and the ribs that I had were drop off the bone fantastic - even better than the ones at Lawry&#39;s the Prime Rib! The meat was soooo succulent and easy to take off the bone, and the coleslaw and fried onions that accompanied it were executed just as well.<br><br>The fries ($12) are huge, thus explaining the price. You could happily share a plate between 4 people - but it smelt so strongly of bottled truffle oil that it really took the flavour of the fries themselves away. Think it would have been better served salted and with sweet chilli and aioli. <br><br>All in all a very good experience, will be going back again!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=dpKkBNCSrXgwgqqXd5JqOw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/EgEsDqRePgHFIHlW_0tBUA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/EgEsDqRePgHFIHlW_0tBUA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/EgEsDqRePgHFIHlW_0tBUA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/EgEsDqRePgHFIHlW_0tBUA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/EgEsDqRePgHFIHlW_0tBUA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/EgEsDqRePgHFIHlW_0tBUA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Yann P.', 'displayLocation': 'The Hague, The Netherlands', 'altText': 'Yann P.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=dpKkBNCSrXgwgqqXd5JqOw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 9, 'photoCount': 9, 'reviewCount': 127, 'eliteYear': None}
text: On the advice of a friend of a friend (yup I followed that line of advice, as I did not know directly anyone living in Singapore ;-) )<br><br>So up Dempsey hill you will find this place.<br>Nice location, with a great terrace on a green area.<br>The inside decoration is modern and quite posh.<br><br>I went there only for coffee and cake. Coffee is great, my cake was average.<br>The rest of the food looked very nice though, and people seemed happy about theirs :-)<br><br>It&#39;s a typical place for expats, with a friendly but quite &#34;posh&#34; service, no real warmth in the service.<br>Seems a lot like the place to be because it has been declared as such, and not because it fully deserves it.

A lot of people say that as a brand, PS.Cafe&#39;s food is a little pricey, considering the quality. While not entirely unfair, I do feel that there&#39;s a consistency that is worthy of appreciation.<br><br>Of all the branches, this is my favourite for a casual night out. Nestled amidst lush greenery, when you sit outdoors it&#39;s almost possible to forget you&#39;re still in Singapore. Almost no roads in sight, just vegetation, it&#39;s a nice place to spend the evening, or even an afternoon. <br><br>The food and drink are, to me, are more than satisfactory. I love their house salad, a mixed green salad livened up by blueberries, sunflower seeds, and a delicious pomegranate dressing. Very addictive. I also thoroughly enjoy their mud crab pasta. While I usually don&#39;t order crab because I&#39;m lazy to work for my food, the flavour of the crab blends very well with the sauce, and I order it almost every time I go. <br><br>They have a great mushroom soup, though I forget exactly what they call it, and an excellent selection of cocktails. Their truffle fries are also a big hit, though the lactose intolerant should be aware that theirs come served with cheese. <br><br>When I first heard of PS.Cafe though, it was for their cakes and desserts. The Chocolate Blackout is IMMENSE, and I refuse to believe anyone can finish it alone. Their puddings are really good, though I found their key lime pie just &#39;okay&#39;. <br><br>Overall it&#39;s a little pricey to be a regular fixture on my weekly schedule, but a great place to head to when you want to meet up with friends you haven&#39;t seen in forever. It can be a little noisy on Friday and Saturday nights though, so if you&#39;re hoping for long intense conversations... it&#39;s not always ideal.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=L7zt8jZEE1Xj3ZT2fgO79w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Kathryn B.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Kathryn B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=L7zt8jZEE1Xj3ZT2fgO79w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 242, 'photoCount': 41, 'reviewCount': 350, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I hate to do this but I need to get this off my chest.  Yesterday after a wonderful brunch of quiche and sangria I was leaving this Dempsey establishment and admiring the bread selection. At the moment of almost grabbing the ash boule a rat crawled out from the bread, my friends and I screamed and ran from the restaurant. I hope they threw away the bread.  Either way I will never eat there again.<br>And thats too bad becuase I loved that restaurant. I fantasized about moving the restaurant out and living in the beautiful glass and concrete structure. I think their sangrias are some of the best breakfast drinks around. I am a huge fan of the food and decor. But a rat killed it for me.

This was one of my favorite places to do brunch when I lived in Singapore. The ambiance was very serene minus the flies lol. You definitely want to sit outdoors if the weather is nice. The best alcoholic drinks were the White Bouquet Sangria and the Rose and Berries Sangria. They were infused with both flowers and fruit...heaven<br><br>I normally order the pancakes which are pretty good.  The menu can be a bit pricey but so is everything else in Singapore :)

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=ScCkd6Ikf3zsWsYFRIH06A', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/WBl5X8Uq7HITKAmQhbPP0A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/WBl5X8Uq7HITKAmQhbPP0A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/WBl5X8Uq7HITKAmQhbPP0A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/WBl5X8Uq7HITKAmQhbPP0A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/WBl5X8Uq7HITKAmQhbPP0A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/WBl5X8Uq7HITKAmQhbPP0A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Martin C.', 'displayLocation': 'Central Business District, New Orleans, LA', 'altText': 'Martin C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=ScCkd6Ikf3zsWsYFRIH06A', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 2, 'photoCount': 19, 'reviewCount': 60, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Great atmosphere of old Singapore.  Need reservations otherwise long wait. Nice variety of food. French fries are<br>overrated and they need to change the oil. Burgers excellent. No key lime pie today. Salad with blueberries and pomegranate seeds excellent. Service fair. Price reasonable.  Wait staff disorganized and need training.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=OqpiWHnD2LPRLmP3x9BOgw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Peter T.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Peter T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=OqpiWHnD2LPRLmP3x9BOgw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 151, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 43, 'eliteYear': None}
text: A good environment to hang out with friends and chat. The drinks are a little overpriced but not unreasonable, especially when you consider its in the Dempsey area; everything is pricier there.<br><br>We had four drinks and the truffle fries, which were a slight disappointment to me. These are your typical frozen shoestring French fries, and while they did do the best they could with it, there&#39;s a lot of room of improvement in improving the quality of the potatoes they are frying with.<br><br>Drinks were pretty standard, with a few specialty cocktails.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=uAFRWzUiacIqHzHT5wfLGQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0wOPaE6MoqHSXLKbEI-36g/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0wOPaE6MoqHSXLKbEI-36g/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0wOPaE6MoqHSXLKbEI-36g/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0wOPaE6MoqHSXLKbEI-36g/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0wOPaE6MoqHSXLKbEI-36g/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0wOPaE6MoqHSXLKbEI-36g/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jason P.', 'displayLocation': 'Ewa Beach, HI', 'altText': 'Jason P.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=uAFRWzUiacIqHzHT5wfLGQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 273, 'photoCount': 142, 'reviewCount': 57, 'eliteYear': None}
text: A beautiful cafe in the jungles atop Dempsey Hill. A great place to enjoy a romantic brunch in lush jungles and unwind with a nice cocktails. Serving sizes are American sized and the breakfast is very delicious. The tea is amazing too. The only down side is the price. Quite pricey for something you can purchase at Denny&#39;s for half the price. But ita Singapore so it&#39;s expected.

Okay, let&#39;s just get it out of the way: everything on the brunch menu is yummy. Ev-ar-ee-thing. So, don&#39;t fuss over what to order, unless you&#39;re super picky. It&#39;s all good, yo. Fer realz.<br><br>All the P.S. Cafe outlets are pretty solid when it comes to food quality, I&#39;ve found. What they offer in terms of locations, though, is atmosphere and ambiance. THIS spot has the most relaxing brunch views of them all. The outdoor area opens up onto grass -- and lots of it. Bring the kids and the pram, let them run around while you sip your soy latte (soy! yay!) and read the paper as you tuck into some waffles. <br><br>COME EARLY as it&#39;s clearly no secret that this is a popular place for brunchin.&#39; You will have to wait unless you get here when they open, which is at 10am. But you won&#39;t regret it. You could hang onto that table all afternoon iffin ya wanna. <br><br>My only complaint (and hence the 4 stars instead of 5) is that the service is patchy. I should not have to ask you to top up my water. I also should not have to flail my arms wildly on the patio to get your attention. And I should not have to wait 15 minutes for you to bring my bill, only to discover that you&#39;ve brought the wrong bill, and then worry that you don&#39;t know what we ordered in the first place. <br><br>Get those last bits together, Harding, and we&#39;ll be on our way to 5-star brunch paradise.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=o5VTy_OiJqbuWvHZYDM3pw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Margo M.', 'displayLocation': 'Savannah, GA', 'altText': 'Margo M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=o5VTy_OiJqbuWvHZYDM3pw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 21, 'eliteYear': None}
text: It&#39;s really easy to get sick of this place if you eat more than a couple times. The atmosphere is nice and location is good however menu never changes. Their choices are bland and there are not very many options.

Great place for a lazy Sunday afternoon. Come with friends order cocktails (basil lemon mojito, yum!) and truffle fries and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere.<br>The crowd is very mixed with some families, couples, groups of friends a handful of hipsters, Westerners and locals.<br>It&#39;s one of my favorite restaurants at Dempsey Hill because it&#39;s more secluded than the others and with all the green around you, you barely feel like you&#39;re still in bustling Singapore.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=5GUadxRaN73Jf0fdhaVCFw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'David J.', 'displayLocation': 'Miami, FL', 'altText': 'David J.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=5GUadxRaN73Jf0fdhaVCFw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 26, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Difficult to find, entrance dark and needs cleaning, not welcoming, place needs to be refurbished, very noisy with loud music, difficult to have a conversation, main course came with cold mash potato and vegetables, cod was good but accompanied salad was too small, service was average but they still charged for it

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=1Fx3krf1zjVRDooyCS21Ug', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IaS3wqd5vgsODNFWtI5b8A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IaS3wqd5vgsODNFWtI5b8A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IaS3wqd5vgsODNFWtI5b8A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IaS3wqd5vgsODNFWtI5b8A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IaS3wqd5vgsODNFWtI5b8A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IaS3wqd5vgsODNFWtI5b8A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Evans T.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Evans T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=1Fx3krf1zjVRDooyCS21Ug', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 9, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Tasty Western foods and sweet sinful desserts! <br><br>This food joint offers diners a selection of tasty Western foods and sweet sinful desserts. On entering the restaurant, The zinc roof, large yellow round lamps, lounge music and beautiful view gives the restaurant a unique rustic feel, while still providing a relaxing and air-conditioned environment for patrons to dine comfortably.<br><br>Food - Portion of food was decent, however, price is a bit on the high side. <br><br>Chicken Rossa Penne- This pasta dish offers an interesting and rich mix of delicious ingredients (chicken, bacon, mushrooms) served in creamy tomato sauce. <br><br>PS. Fish &amp; Chips - we had better fish &amp; chips elsewhere. However, the fish fillets and fries were still delicious enough for our palates<br><br>BBQ Ribs- succulent and juicy pork ribs are covered in a thick layer of barbeque blackcurrant sauce, wonderfully tender and moist!<br><br>PS.Profiteroles - sinful dessert that was pretty normal, cream puffs covered in chocolate sauce and embellished with almond flakes.<br><br>Truffle Shoestring Fries - Juicy fries are endowed with truffle oil, and topped off with just a tad of grated Parmesan cheese and parsley.<br><br>Overall, soft lighting, relaxing music, unimpeded view of the greenery, and rustic restaurant décor make this the perfect place for hanging out with friends and loved ones. The restaurant also serves nice food!<br><br>Check out our full review and photos at <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.eatandtravelwithus.com%2F2014%2F03%2Fps-cafe-at-dempsey-hill%2F&amp;s=60dfa2fcac305dbf94a6f0c83e386005c7805be96bca942a8c4bc1e1e82b61f6" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">eatandtravelwithus.com/2…</a>

I do a lot of lunches here both for business and pleasure. It&#39;s pricey given it&#39;s casual setting. It would even raise a few eyebrows in Beverly Hills for the audacity of the brunch menu prices but ... welcome to Singapore! If it&#39;s even remotely decent western food it&#39;s going to be priced like truffle oil. I usually do soup and/or salad and have to say the lunch menu has never let me down. This is on par with the cafes I used to grab lunch in San Francisco. I also get the most consistently good soy lattes here. Dinner time is a little more dressy. It&#39;s a nice spot to come for a good cocktail and a nice meal out on the patio. <br><br>Brunches are a zoo. Seriously, it&#39;s like Disneyland on New Years if you come on a Sunday. The brunch food is pretty good though I&#39;ve occasionally had some very sketchy [read: raw whites] eggs. Now this happens a lot around town so even in high end places I&#39;ve kinda given up on my old friend eggs benny. <br><br>Desserts are to die for. The carrot cake is my current crush but I also had a brief entanglement with the ginger toffee cake that could have got serious. Don&#39;t miss dessert even if you have to take it to-go.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/1Y7HdzAP27i2BIPP9H7Pxw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ps-cafe-singapore-8?reviewid=K0V6ZDgGvCxboyCLRT4fog&select=1Y7HdzAP27i2BIPP9H7Pxw', 'altText': 'Photo of PS.Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Pies, PS cafe', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pies, PS cafe'}]
text: This outlet, while quaintly surrounded by the greenery, is not recommended if you don&#39;t drive - well you can take a cab there but will have to call for a cab when you&#39;re done. Unless you don&#39;t mind the walk through dempsey down to holland road to take the bus. <br><br>It&#39;s a really romantic atmosphere if you&#39;re walking in here in the evening, the pathway is lined with candles before you enter the bustling cafe. It&#39;s usually full of people, you&#39;d be lucky to get a table on weekends without making a reservation. I&#39;ve been here for dinner once, I found the food too average for the price (or maybe I didn&#39;t order the right stuff). Had the chicken parmiggiano and truffle fries. The chicken was a little bland and the fries, while served in a generously hefty portion, significantly lacked the truffle flavour, it almost feels like they forgot the truffle somehow. I like the touch of parmesan cheese on top but could do with more cheese!<br><br>I&#39;ve also been here for a tea break. My friend and I were on a pie hunt and PS cafe have some really good pies. Their display of desserts will have you salivating! I had the key lime pie while my friend had the chocolate walnut pie. The key lime pie was an absolute delight of citrus burst in your mouth, so refreshingly good! I just didn&#39;t like whip cream on top of it that had some coconut sprinkles, I&#39;ll be sure to tell them to skip that the next time I order it, the pie is fine on its own. The walnut pie was really rich, we couldn&#39;t finish it!<br><br>Final verdict: Come here for a nice date night or if you live nearby otherwise there are other more accessible PS Cafes in town but definitely DO NOT miss out on the key lime pie! Oh but not all outlets serve the key lime pie though, the one at Ann Siang for one, doesn&#39;t serve the key lime.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=_o0_ZA3wgZsXC4eGZ21dLQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/OtXzW_J53CFl89Cx5QKzEA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/OtXzW_J53CFl89Cx5QKzEA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/OtXzW_J53CFl89Cx5QKzEA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/OtXzW_J53CFl89Cx5QKzEA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/OtXzW_J53CFl89Cx5QKzEA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/OtXzW_J53CFl89Cx5QKzEA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Laura M.', 'displayLocation': 'Portland, OR', 'altText': 'Laura M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=_o0_ZA3wgZsXC4eGZ21dLQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 82, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 19, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Whoever has a big sweet tooth will appreciate the choices of dessert ....go for the cakes!! The slices are massive! <br>It&#39;s nice to sit outside on a cool evening...can get crowded on a weekend

Good food for those looking for a change from the usual SG fare. <br>We started with the Truffle Fries-which were a huge serving and very tasty. Definitely enough for 4 people. It was a bit much for 2. <br>I had Flamed Shrimp Torteglini and my friend had the Miso Cod. Both were very good.<br>Prices were high, but overall a nice place for dinner. Being in Dempsey, it provided a nice area to walk afterwards, but definitely not MRT/Bus friendly.

PS Cafe is no stranger to the cafe market in Singapore. One of the first eateries to make Dempsey hip, it is vastly different to its other branches in Orchard. This one is tucked away amidst verdant greenery and with ceiling-to-floor glass windows, the view and light streaming in doesn&#39;t get better.<br><br>Great for weekend brunch, or afternoon tea, or dinner, there really isn&#39;t a bad time to come. The menu has favorites such as a big breakfast, truffle fries, a hearty mushroom soup and decadent desserts. <br><br>Prices are slightly verging on overpriced for a place people come for brunch or dessert but you&#39;re pretty much paying for the ambience and the cool yuppie looks other yuppies give you.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=CTcOW0_88prY9lfgc6xL2A', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Richa S.', 'displayLocation': 'Arlington, VA', 'altText': 'Richa S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=CTcOW0_88prY9lfgc6xL2A', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 18, 'reviewCount': 55, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Great brunch place, even though it&#39;s overpriced. Also super long wait time during weekend peak brunch time. but the location is lovely with seating outside with greenery. The coffee and pastries are good as well as the breakfast options.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=_Sy0izMlyQ0_M-vLpmmfyw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ai81DC5mT-mx6S4apjwPgQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ai81DC5mT-mx6S4apjwPgQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ai81DC5mT-mx6S4apjwPgQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ai81DC5mT-mx6S4apjwPgQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ai81DC5mT-mx6S4apjwPgQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ai81DC5mT-mx6S4apjwPgQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Lillian S.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Lillian S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=_Sy0izMlyQ0_M-vLpmmfyw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 103, 'photoCount': 2, 'reviewCount': 63, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I really really like this spot! I had brunch here with some friends and I got the blue cheese quiche drizzled lightly with some balsamic vinaigrette type of sauce and I enjoyed every single bite of it! <br><br>I&#39;ve also been here for dessert and I&#39;ve tried the key lime pie (AMAZING), pecan pie, and a cheesecake. All were great but the key lime definitely stood out!<br><br>overall - great place to just chill, grab a drink, enjoy food and friends =)

text: The PS Café in Dempsey Hill is my favorite branch of the restaurant. Its set amidst lush greenery and is set up like a greenhouse. Chose to sit inside, but I prefer sitting outside facing nature. <br><br>The food is a bit pricey here, but you pay for the ambience as well. Ive tried a lot of food here and its mostly Western with a bit of fusion Asian thrown in. Their fish and chips are good, as are their truffle fries and salads. <br><br>They have interesting drinks and cocktails and my favorite to get is the lime and mint soda--kind of like a non alcoholic mojito. Definitely come here for the desserts. The apple crumble is pretty good and served with vanilla ice cream.<br><br> A nice place to go for brunch on the weekends.

Out of all the outlets that P.S. Cafe has around Singapore, the branch at Dempsey has got to be my favourite. The restaurant is nestled in the greenery of Dempsey, and has an alfresco dining area which is really pleasant to sit at in the afternoons. Food, as with all the P.S. Cafe restaurants, is decent - though some might call it overpriced. Come for the desserts which are massive, and good enough to share with 2 other people. Also come to people watch. The crowd at this branch tends to be trendier and better looking than the other branches. <br><br>Side note though: this branch gets massively overpacked over the weekends, so reservations are recommended.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=QZqj0zcaOXV63mVVVLAhhQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/x5r99h9GAwEtB_JLWsLe5Q/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/x5r99h9GAwEtB_JLWsLe5Q/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/x5r99h9GAwEtB_JLWsLe5Q/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/x5r99h9GAwEtB_JLWsLe5Q/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/x5r99h9GAwEtB_JLWsLe5Q/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/x5r99h9GAwEtB_JLWsLe5Q/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'PJ R.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'PJ R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=QZqj0zcaOXV63mVVVLAhhQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 33, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Tucked away in the greener part of Dempsey Hill is the fantastic place! High ceilings, funky straight forward decor makes this cafe one of the more charming of its style in Singapore.  The large menu features a great selection of comfort food items all for under $30.  Service is always very warm and friendly, in fact one of the friendliest bunch of floor staff in Singapore. PS Café have really recreated that funky comforting café vibe that I miss from places back in Sydney and Melbourne.  The selection of cakes and desserts are not to be missed, regardless of if you have room for dessert.<br>Weather its been a Monday night after work or a lazy brunch, every time I&#39;ve set foot in this place its packed. Though when you have a restaurant in a fantastic location, that provides the full package in terms of service, food and ambience its not hard to see why its so busy

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=bHfBMb8ABQpmSR1wzzZAFw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'MJ B.', 'displayLocation': 'Hoboken, NJ', 'altText': 'MJ B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=bHfBMb8ABQpmSR1wzzZAFw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': 2, 'reviewCount': 162, 'eliteYear': None}
text: When I go to restaurants, I&#39;m always keen on the Specials.  So I have chosen their Specials a couple of time and they are a miss.  We went there sometime Christmas and it was just a couple of ham slices piled up with a very salty sauce.  We all had the same thing and they came looking different from one another with different serving sizes.<br>So lesson learned -- stick to their basics -- Ceasar Salad, Truffle Fries, Eggs Benedict...<br>Service also becomes bad when they are full -- so avoid weekends!

Love, love, love this place. The glass house, the green surrounding, the truffle fries, the cakes - it&#39;s one of the must go places in my opinion and I recommend it to all of my friends who visit Singapore. Prices are reasonable for the ambience and quality.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=IZXO5FHilspTMpsXm6sfpQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Jesse E.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'Jesse E.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=IZXO5FHilspTMpsXm6sfpQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': 2, 'reviewCount': 29, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Service is phenomenal. Food was delicious. I ordered pizza here and was very pleased. Truffle fries were on point. The desserts are to die for. Highly recommended.

Truffle fries and deserts my dudes. That&#39;s what matter at this place. The entrees and appetizers I&#39;ve had here have been satisfying but not exactly memorable. However the milkshakes, pastries, and fries I&#39;ve had here have all been fantastic. Order their truffle fries and a milk shake for a classed up version of the old frosty and fries combo at Wendy&#39;s. Beware though, it&#39;s kind of expensive for what you get - but it&#39;s Singapore, everything is expensive.

I tried PS cafe with a friend on the recommendation of her coworkers. The place was gorgeous and we were able to sit outside, probably because we got there on a Sunday just before 11am. Of course we had to order the truffle fries based on the recommendations. I had the eggs benedict and my friend had the pesto pasta. I must admit her pesto looked really good, but my benedict was everything I was looking for as well. The truffle fries more than lived up to expectations. I definitely recommend this place and hope to return!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=pMeVabelnBG1hBNRPbdJyw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Stephanie J.', 'displayLocation': 'Miami Beach, FL', 'altText': 'Stephanie J.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=pMeVabelnBG1hBNRPbdJyw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 12, 'eliteYear': None}
text: The service is horrible.  Waited for drinks, silverware and water.  Not once did our waitress check on us to see if our food was good, when serving, they just drop off the food and don&#39;t comment on what the dish is.  The drinks are far from good (i.e. Mixed or gin infused spirits). The food is just average.  Nice location.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=xAqigbzISUDtROsECay8SA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Sarah S.', 'displayLocation': 'West Lafayette, IN', 'altText': 'Sarah S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=xAqigbzISUDtROsECay8SA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 1, 'eliteYear': None}
text: My favorite place for desserts! The queue can be quite long and sometimes the waiters are so busy! But overall great place and good food!
Food was good but can improve in the service aspect. We were not attended to as fast as normal and it took a long time to process the credit card for payment.

A pricey establishment indeed but set a in quieter part of Dempsey facing lush greenery, probably best experienced when you seat alfresco. Choose between regular tables or low couches if you&#39;re intending to kick  back and do some reading. This is one of the first places in Singapore where I tried the Sticky Date Pudding and it was pretty good. Careful with the caramel or it could get a little too sweet. The general standard of food is good with your typical modern bistro spread with the only factor being ridiculous pricing. Other than that, people do indeed come for the environment. With an urbanized landscape like ours, how often do you get to sit facing a mini forest and enjoy your cuppa.

Having only been here once, I asked what was their most popular famous dish and just ordered one of those.  (BBQ Chicken)  the chicken came in a quarter slice with rice and sambal sauce. While the flavor was tasty itself, the chicken was dry. <br><br>This restaurant is located in a convenient location for businesses employees nearby. There is both indoor and outdoor seating.

Pain Au Chocolat', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Pain Au Chocolat'}]
text: After brunch at Antoinette, popped by The Alley Luxe and long decided I would try the drink from their Aurora series. Honestly, I would not think the drink would blow my socks off but it definitely would score on the aesthetic side. When I was in line, i saw the &#34;Morning Dawn&#34; on their tv screen which has a lighter hue. I thought it looked really pretty. Just when I was the next one to order, I changed my mind and ordered the &#34;Northern Lights&#34; just because it was the 4th most popular drink at The Alley.<br><br>NORTHERN LIGHTS - Overall: 4/5<br><br>Aesthetic point 5/5 <br>It was so pretty!! <br><br>Taste 3/5 <br>It tasted somewhat like soda, I was not sure what it really tasted like but it was pretty sweet. I had to stir many times and at the end the drink has not much taste to it. I did stir many times so maybe I needed to stir more??<br><br>One of us tried the Matcha Brown Sugar Deerioca Milk and mentioned that was so good compared to the Brown Sugar Deerioca Milk we had a week ago. <br><br>SERVICE 5/5<br>Staff was nice. Told me the Northern Lights would take 10 mins to make. She also asked if I was a member and invited me to sign up using the QR code displayed at the order counter.<br><br>AMBIENCE 4/5<br>Finally saw a few empty tables. It was around lunch hour on a week day. My complaint?? This store needs a lesson in cleaning. Staffs need to clean those tables periodically. Humans can be nasty, so we can&#39;t trust them to keep the tables clean after they left the premise. <br><br>Overall, better overall experience with the drinks and ambience today.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hZBKcWP3idRuIf-sErB7Jg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-alley-luxe-singapore?reviewid=0U170o2HwwWw8tMJ8dwe8Q&select=hZBKcWP3idRuIf-sErB7Jg', 'altText': 'Photo of The Alley Luxe - Singapore, Singapore. Looked a lot better than it tasted', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Looked a lot better than it tasted'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yQJmE6LY8uvCh6zyTAskOQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-alley-luxe-singapore?reviewid=0U170o2HwwWw8tMJ8dwe8Q&select=yQJmE6LY8uvCh6zyTAskOQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Alley Luxe - Singapore, Singapore. Planter aka mill tea with oreos', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Planter aka mill tea with oreos'}]
text: My friend&#39;s told me The Alley had the best boba in the world and it couldn&#39;t be farther from the truth.  #sorrynotsorry Perhaps I had really high expectations when I heard that and was sadly disappointed.<br><br>Or maybe, I should have stuck with just a regular milk tea with boba to really experience and savor the essence of the boba but I didn&#39;t.  I wanted to try something different, something unique.<br><br>But before I even get to the actual taste of the drinks, it took FOREVER to get the drinks.  Have you ever heard of fast, cheap, and good - where you can only pick 2 - because as long as you have 2, you&#39;ll never meet the 3rd criteria.  But sorry to say, this place was not fast, cheap, nor good!  Sigh.  The drinks were not good, the boba was not good.  We sadly, didn&#39;t even finish them.  Sad.<br><br>Not sure what the hype is but definitely had way way better drinks/boba at other spots.

text: The cafe was opened recently by the people behind Lola&#39;s Cafe. The menu here was limited to drinks such coffee and tea, plus a display of tarts, cakes, waffle and ice-creams. Dine in area was also limited. <br><br>Flat White ($5.50)<br>Not too strong but it was pick me up with its chocolaty taste.<br><br>Lychee Rosewater Cake ($8/ slice)<br>It attracted me with the rose petals on top, plus its juicy pieces of lychee in its fillings. The cake was soft and moist. But what hit me was its alcoholic taste.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=OID9ZOyljsyx7HVAP_29aQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ai Lin M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Ai Lin M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=OID9ZOyljsyx7HVAP_29aQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 7, 'photoCount': 180, 'reviewCount': 180, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Their golf ball pineapple tarts make this an address to keep and return to over and over again. Uniquely shaped and larger than the usual pineapple tart, these are generously packed with sweet pineapple filling and feel a tiny bit sinful. They have, nevertheless, become a mainstay in my family during Chinese New Year. <br><br>The best part, however, is that they are on sale all year around, and I usually find myself being carted off with numerous plastic containers of these goodies each time I travel overseas to visit family or friends.<br><br>Service is excellent, and the bakery is run by people who really take pride in the morsels they produce. On most of my visits, I&#39;ve been handed freshly baked goods to taste, usually resulting in me being too full to steal a golf ball from my own container on the way home.

Bean curd tarts', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Bean curd tarts'}]
text: I was a bit put off on going here since the reviews made it seem like the prospect of a bean curd tart in my future was slim to none. BUT it was only a 10 minute walk from my hotel so I went one afternoon. The woman running the cash register scolded me for not calling ahead to place an order, but luckily they still had plenty of tarts left! I snagged a box of 8 for 9$sgd. They are delicious. I really like egg tarts so my original assumption was they would be close to that. The crust is thick and reminds me of a shortbread cookie with a bit more moisture. The filling is a sweet tofu but not overbearing. It&#39;s a lovely dessert for people who don&#39;t want too sweet! They held up well in the fridge for 3 days while we snacked on them.

I&#39;ve heard scary stories about how popular their Beancurd tarts are that they are sold out as early as within one hour. So to prevent this food tragedy, I ringed up the shop like an obedient (or kiasu?) person to reserve my box of mixed Beancurd tarts.<br><br>Fast forward, I did not imagine the shop to look so modern, unlike the old-school pastries that they sell. It is not like a bakery shop where you take a tong and think what you want to have for breakfast the next day.  Most items are kept in the chiller behind the cashier table. However, there is a display cupboard showing the available items so if you want a box of assorted slice cakes, you have to ask the lady.<br><br>I grabbed one of the pre-packed goodie ($3.50) whose appearance and name perked my curiosity. &#34;A Classic Treat from the 1960s&#34; <br><br>This colorful retro-looking scones eh no....rock buns are sweetened naturally with the assorted dried fruits. Rest assure that these rocks won&#39;t break your teeth as you pluck of morsels and toss them unstoppable into your mouth. The pineapple golf balls looked as if they lack a bright golden egg wash. But I finally understand why they need to be pre-ordered in advance during CNY. If you only eat the biscuit part like me, they are perfect--Crumbly, not too milky or sickly sweet or sticky. However, the pineapple filling are simply too much( covering about 80% of each tart). <br><br>And tada....the legendary Beancurd tart. Without the eggy custard smell, they are still wobbly and better than having just tau hway. These are delightfully crumbly and butter, like those from Chin Mee Chin. Shaped like a deep-dish ramekin, one is enough to fill an average stomach after dinner. I feel sorry for egg tarts now because beancurd tarts beat them hands-down. ($9 for a box of 8) <br><br>Though assorted flavours sound exciting, they really aren&#39;t because they taste the same, for instance peanuts is just a few steamed peanuts tossed into the filling. Not peanut butter. Same goes for the longan, grass jelly, ginko nuts and white fungus, red bean, egg white.<br><br>Come to think of it, other countries have tau hway but i think Singapore is the only place with Beancurd Tarts. Another great reason to stay here:)

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/PEJdfsqCma503nWhImC1Yw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/le-cafe-confectionery-and-pastry-singapore?reviewid=_wJrs_Q4xSq43L_WZzEcgQ&select=PEJdfsqCma503nWhImC1Yw', 'altText': 'Photo of Le Cafe Confectionery & Pastry - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Nn1tXvCuaqPiYspePYqiRw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/le-cafe-confectionery-and-pastry-singapore?reviewid=_wJrs_Q4xSq43L_WZzEcgQ&select=Nn1tXvCuaqPiYspePYqiRw', 'altText': 'Photo of Le Cafe Confectionery & Pastry - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/sAaYGD_S5J5HVoPQCu_z9w/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/le-cafe-confectionery-and-pastry-singapore?reviewid=_wJrs_Q4xSq43L_WZzEcgQ&select=sAaYGD_S5J5HVoPQCu_z9w', 'altText': 'Photo of Le Cafe Confectionery & Pastry - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}]
text: This store has been around for ages, now with a few branches and he Middle Road outlet is the first and original store, with the walls plastered with news paper articles featuring the store over the years.<br><br>Other than your traditional pineapple tarts, Le Cafe also have other specialty items such as coffee cookies, rum balls and the bean curd tart.<br><br>What is a the bean curd tart you may ask? It is simply a buttery tart filled with tau huay.<br>The smooth light tarts can be ordered together with logan peanuts and chin chao. (grass jelly).

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/IkTbbe4iCHg7AK49tlPKiQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/le-cafe-confectionery-and-pastry-singapore?reviewid=3qBh2UnkkGPOeCLUYQsbsw&select=IkTbbe4iCHg7AK49tlPKiQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Le Cafe Confectionery & Pastry - Singapore, Singapore. &#34;golf ball&#34; pineapple tart', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': '"golf ball" pineapple tart'}]
text: Every Chinese New Year, the missus and I will buy Le Cafe&#39;s pineapple golf balls for family and relatives. However, the pre-order starts about 1-2 months before Chinese New Year, order too late and you might miss the ordering period! There are no orders or purchase allowed from the shops 1 month before CNY. However, pre-order means you need to order at least 4 or 5 bottles of 20 pcs minimum and collect a few days before CNY. If this is too much for you, the secret is to go on CNY eve morning to try your luck at buying the orders that were not collected. Each bottle is about $20~ - these are expensive pineapple tarts at $1 per piece but worth every cent.<br><br>On top of the pineapple tart golf balls, the missus and I are also enamored with chicken floss seaweed twist and will always pick up a bottle along with our golf balls. It&#39;s a tangy mildly spicy chicken floss wrap in a twist of baked skin lined with seaweed. Ah, words does not describe how addictive it is.<br><br>Le Cafe also do chinese wedding cakes and guo da li sets. The missus&#39; aunt actually used them for their wedding almost 30 years ago! This is an old timer in Singapore and here to stay. This is a family business with 3 branches all within the family. The kind of business we like to support, as authentic Singaporean as it gets.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=XsIVj_AszmnnsykBrKgdHw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'SH K.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'SH K.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=XsIVj_AszmnnsykBrKgdHw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 2, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 250, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Tofu tarts are heavenly! What I like to do is to put them in the fridge for a few hours as I think they taste better real cold!<br><br>I prefer the plain ones to the ones with &#34;filling&#34;.<br><br>There also have an outlet just outside Cambridge market.

They are uber famous now for the beancurd tart despite located few doors down Rochor beancurd, or maybe that&#39;s why its location is advantageous. While I love eating the smooth curd or a buttery sweet crust of their tarts, the pineapple golf balls are my true weak spot in this confectionery. They have that same characteristics of their tart shells, buttery and sweet, but also it melts in the mouth, but just firm enough to take bites out of it. It might be too big for most mouth, but perhaps not for my boyfriend. Still, the pineapple filling has a nice grated texture, sweet and sour and very fragrant with a caramelised taste. <br>The next time you go down for the tarts, pick up some golf balls too!

Le Cafe has awesome beancurd tarts. It&#39;s light, smooth and and not too sweet with a perfectly textured crust. The lady proprietor admonished me for not calling beforehand to pre-order but I guess I was lucky they had stock.<br><br>They also have other pastry selections which include pineapple tarts and cookies which are apparently really popular during Chinese New Year.<br><br>But the beancurd tarts take the cake for me.

This stall has a long history and definitely stood the test of time. I remembered that when I was schooling, we often ordered our refreshments of cakes and pastries from them as my school was nearby. I grew up eating their confectioneries and pastries. <br><br>In the recent years, I got reacquainted with this store when a colleague bought the beancurd tarts for our tea break and it rekindled my interest in patronizing the stall. This came about way before the overhype beancurd pudding craze in singapore. Their beancurd tart is rather unique very similar to egg tarts but with a smooth and creamy texture for its filling.  You can get a box with assorted flavors and they tends to snap out fast. <br><br>Personally I am not a fan of pineapple tarts but I heard their pineapple tarts are awesome too.

To my knowledge, there is nowhere selling beancurd tarts in Singapore. The tarts here are the perfect midday snack - light, smooth beancurd on a crumbly crust that isn&#39;t too sweet. The last time I visited the store, I noticed that there were different flavours for the beancurd tarts but I didn&#39;t get to try them as I was picking up an order. <br><br>The shop also sells pineapple tarts that are the size of golfballs. You&#39;ll have to order these way in advance during the Chinese New Year period as they are immensely popular! The pineapple tarts (or balls?) are the perfect combination of pastry and filling (I don&#39;t like the typical tarts with a mountain of filling) and don&#39;t feel that heavy despite of its size. The shop also sells old school cream cakes. <br><br>More of a pick-up-and-go counter than an actual cafe (despite of its misleading name), the staff here are efficient and always offer me a free pineapple tart when I come to pick up my orders.

Korean ice kachang haha', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Korean ice kachang haha'}]
text: Always on the lookout for a good shaved ice dessert in Asia.<br><br>Lately we&#39;ve had our share of chendol and ice kachang having taken a trip up to Penang so the Korean-style &#34;patbingsoo&#34; was a welcome change of pace.<br><br>After getting over our initial juvenile ways by referring to this place as &#34;Insta-dong&#34; over and over again to many fits of giggles, we sat down and tried their standard red bean pat bing soo which comes with a heap of ice cream, a generous serving of mushy sweet red beans which is more the Korean style vs the whole red beans found in SE Asian ice desserts. There were also bits of mochi with more red bean paste inside, and sliced almonds. <br><br>DELICIOUS!<br><br>The ice was super fine. I believe the ice is typically courser in this Korean ice dessert but they&#39;ve managed to pull it off really nicely with super fine ice. Yum.<br><br>You have to come check out insta-dong!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/jNjPgR5HLQJxlrjZBVfJEw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/mr-teh-tarik-eating-house-singapore-5?reviewid=5LKtFYie00xi4VlGXNQt3g&select=jNjPgR5HLQJxlrjZBVfJEw', 'altText': 'Photo of Mr. Teh Tarik Eating House - Singapore, Singapore. Excellent mee soto with very rich broth from the satay stall. (Black things on the left are star anise, not to worry.)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Excellent mee soto with very rich broth from the satay stall. (Black things on the left are star anise, not to worry.)'}]
text: The mee soto at the satay stall is *very good.* Well, the chicken itself is fine/average -- but the broth was simply outstanding. It&#39;s a heavier, darker, more spiced broth, so if you like a lighter, clearer broth this may not be for you, but I&#39;d eat mee soto here over the famed Inspirasi stall (Bedok) anyday. It&#39;s pricey at $4, but it does come with begedil. I&#39;m not a huge fan of begedil, but this one was excellent -- the potato was almost a mashed texture. They also make their own sambal just for the mee soto.

Shop front, good place if you need some halal option.', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Shop front, good place if you need some halal option.'}]
text: Mr. Teh Tarik is a well known halal coffee shop for lots of Muslim community in Singapore. This is a new location after they move from the other side of the road in geylang. <br><br>Always the same all Mr. Teh Tarik outlet run 27/7 so it is not an bad ideal if u looking for some halal late night meal.<br><br>The food choice here are good, we got western, Indian, Thai, fish soup, satay, ayam penyet (Indonesia fried chicken) and also noodles store. <br><br>Here also can get food like rojak and a famous Putu Piring (do come early the store close at 8 plus)

My breakfast this morning', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'My breakfast this morning'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/7C_CSeOXdFxb4FLea5Z8dA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-49?reviewid=ioFFf6DjVdy2t5QPUT-8tQ&select=7C_CSeOXdFxb4FLea5Z8dA', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Traditional kaya toast set', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Traditional kaya toast set'}]
text: This is my favorite toastbox, located at B4 @Ion Orchard near the escalator (turn left when heading down the escalator).<br><br>My usual will be the kaya toast. When I was still a little child, my mom would make her own kaya. My mom&#39;s kaya was so good. Kaya is not something I eat very often, I don&#39;t know why. I mean after all where can I get kaya when I am in Atlanta? Recent times a friend of mine who seems to love a good kaya toast from Toastbox got me hooked on this simple breakfast.<br><br>Sometimes I will order the kaya traditional set which comes with a slice of kaya toast, two soft boiled eggs and a beverage. Other times I just order the toast and a beverage from the al la carte section.<br><br>I wish the staff would crack the eggs for me like those at Ya Kun, but ok I should not be so lazy. The kaya toast here definitely edged out those at Ya Kun.<br><br>I like this location not only the toast was made perfectly every time, the staffs are always nice. I usually head over here really early and then stroll around and wait for the stores at Ion or other malls to open. <br><br>There seems to be a very long line around 9-9.30am. One needs patience ;)

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aP3XspNtpPibPU18WKY8ZA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tantric-bar-and-may-wongs-cafe-singapore-2?reviewid=xHZz8eKT0XZS5txvS1mskA&select=aP3XspNtpPibPU18WKY8ZA', 'altText': "Photo of Tantric Bar & May Wong's Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Anna May Wong", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Anna May Wong'}]
text: Not 1 night in Bangkok, but in Singapore and we hit probably 6 gay bars. Tantric &amp; May Wong is an eclectic bar which actually has 2 outdoor courtyards plus 3 distinct themed bars. <br><br>One first floor bar was tantric and loungy. The other first floor bar had a &#34;cool&#34; vibe  complete with the air conditioner blasting and blowing to unintentionally feel like you&#39;re in a freezer. <br><br>Anna May&#39;s upstairs is styled as a decadent Art Deco Golden Hollywood era lounge with gilded framed pictures of Anna May Wong, the first Asian American woman screen star. I liked the upstairs best with its unique decor and opulent feel, as if your rich gay uncle was the designer. It was really crowded and bumpy though, if you like that kind of thing.<br><br>Most of the time we stood outside to drink and watch the parade of cute boys coming and going. This seems to be the only bar with gaysians and ex-pats/visiting gay white guys freely mixing. Since I was here with Dutch friends, we fit right in.

text: Wanted to order 4 shots and 1 shot of tap water and 2 cocktails but they said a tap water shot is not possible for my boyfriend who doesn&#39;t drink for New Years. Wouldn&#39;t recommend .. just unfriendly! There are better bars on this road!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=AJhM1_CWTxLrR8YV50Iv_Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2nMuvQApHShCgxdHyicWGg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2nMuvQApHShCgxdHyicWGg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2nMuvQApHShCgxdHyicWGg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2nMuvQApHShCgxdHyicWGg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2nMuvQApHShCgxdHyicWGg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2nMuvQApHShCgxdHyicWGg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Steven W.', 'displayLocation': 'West Covina, CA', 'altText': 'Steven W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=AJhM1_CWTxLrR8YV50Iv_Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 438, 'photoCount': 349, 'reviewCount': 193, 'eliteYear': None}
text: One of the main gay bars in Singapore with multiple floors and rooms. Drink ordering is extremely efficient (they come to you). Gets packed on the weekend nights!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/STucl8CBNDYBl30HFY_U5Q/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tantric-bar-and-may-wongs-cafe-singapore-2?reviewid=IxnL3BhPuTfgJmIPUWM-hw&select=STucl8CBNDYBl30HFY_U5Q', 'altText': "Photo of Tantric Bar & May Wong's Cafe - Singapore, Singapore", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Tantric is a bar that I go to when i want to get drunk for cheap. At $10 for a double shot, it&#39;s a bar that one never leaves sober. The crowd is spotty/awesome (depending on your taste) - you&#39;ll find a lot of white guys hanging out there, and a lot of Asian boys who like white boys, and the occasional straight person helplessly wandering around the bar, wondering what&#39;s going on. No matter what your taste, at $10 a drink, you&#39;ll find that things look pleasant after awhile. <br><br>The bar itself is actually spread over 2 stories with an outdoor courtyard. The upstairs is decorated in a slight Shanghai theme, with posters of an old Chinese movie star called May Wong (yeah, no idea who she is either) covering most of the walls. There are really comfortable couches on the 2nd floor, though they tend to be really popular, so be prepared to fight it out with queens for a seat. The downstairs has way more space, and occasionally turns into a dance floor, depending on the time of the night, and the number of drinks that people have had. It tends to have a feeling of a meat market though at times, and people might get a bit touchy as you wind your way through the crowd to the toilets at the back of the bar. Whether that&#39;s good or bad, again, depends on your taste (:

You cannot not know Tantric if you have pink friends. This is an institution and always fun to hit the other gay bars around the area after that. <br><br>Drinks are strong and cheap (by sg bar standard anyway). An awesome night of gay pub crawl starts here!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=7FsA2X4WuSKGhVRz1eqN-Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Jam O.', 'displayLocation': '16e Arrondissement, Paris, France', 'altText': 'Jam O.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=7FsA2X4WuSKGhVRz1eqN-Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 4, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I have been there many times ...people on friday and saturday drinks a bit expensive but still a good place to go and dance mert people

I&#39;ve been coming here for years - and will be for years to come!<br><br>Great drinks, noisy atmosphere, the place to be seen and see, and it could serve almost any social purposes - whether you&#39;re coming in a group, on a 1-on-1 date, a small group of friends, alone (with the intention of going home with someone or alone or to meet new people, etc)... there&#39;s so much you can do here!<br><br>A recent improvement - the sitting area in the terrace is no longer for smokers (you have to be on the balcony now - but since the fans blow the smoke over the seats it doesn&#39;t make much of a difference, really) - but still not really comfortable for me unless I have a thirst to be there (and that comes along very seldom), so DYMK or Backstage will be a better bet if you want a comfortable bar - but Tantric is gay-city!

One of the oldest gay bars in the Gay Stretch, I&#39;ve been coming here for.. a decade? It hasn&#39;t changed very much. It&#39;s still full of white boys and the azn boys who love them. But the $10 drinks really help, no matter your gender -- or orientation.<br><br>The shophouse it&#39;s in is quite homey, if you can indeed call a gay bar homey. Most nights it&#39;s the same: a place you go to repeatedly if you&#39;re a regular. On special nights like on Pink Dot nights, it&#39;s packed silly to the brim.<br><br>One of the standards. Can&#39;t recommend it excessively, can&#39;t say anything too bad about it either.

I usually go to tantric to get drunk, then head over to Play so that it doesn&#39;t seem so bad. Also because I like to think I&#39;m an awesome faghag. The boys love me, I love the boys!<br><br>But in all honesty Tantric is really pretty cool. There are not many places left in Singapore where you can get strong, potent drinks for $10 or maybe even less. As a girl, sometimes it is lovely to hang at a place where you can wear next to nothing and no one will even look at you. Isn&#39;t that very first world, progressive and empowering? Service is always fantastic- the staff are cherry and efficient. I especially like the ambience upstairs- theres always some random music playing into the background but nothing too load, the couches are super fantastic and non sticky (who cares they might be damn dirty, its comfortable) and its gets just the right amount of buzz for you to feel happz but still be able to carry on with a conversation.<br><br>It would be great if there were separate male and female cubicles, because sometimes I really have to pee (especially when I drink) but then there might be some guy shitting inside :(. But usually its not a problem, and the people queuing up for the toilet are all super chill about things like that. If you&#39;re planning to pay by card, do note that unlike other places, here there is a min charge of $20 before you can do so.

Two-storey bar for the boys, with outdoor seating and a very laid-back vibe. This establishment has been around for the longest time and is just opposite Taboo (gay club), so a weekend night usually entails drinks at Tantric before hopping over to Taboo or Play. The crowd can get pretty rowdy and it is often jam-packed on weekend nights. <br><br>The upstairs has plush couches and the ground floor tends to be more crowded and crazy and there&#39;s standing only unless you are sitting outside.  <br><br>The pros about this place: <br>- STRONG drinks for cheap prices ($10 nett for a strong vodka tonic) <br>- Good looking guys<br>- I like the music : it&#39;s a lot of pop, top-40s and dance tunes<br>- Easy to meet people<br><br>Cons: <br>- Slightly grotty<br>- Can get way too crowded, and crowd can be a little obnoxious sometimes

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=02jvVn-1vS_i_ZBlxG5rZw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Erik D.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Erik D.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=02jvVn-1vS_i_ZBlxG5rZw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: While a cute venue with nice staff, the management is horrible. Just because it is a gay bar, our community flocks there because there is not much else here in Singapore. Not a reason to come. The place is always empty and seriously if you want to cruise... Just pathetic at Tantric... Nothing tantric about it! Go to Dorothy&#39;s! Much nicer atmosphere without having the feeling of being in a ghetto!

Taufu goreng', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Taufu goreng'}]
text: Highlight: Small canteen like cafe located in Macritchie Reservoir that serves some local eats and drinks. <br><br>Prices: 3.75$ for appetizers and 5-8$ for local entrees. <br><br>Food: We ordered the Taufu goreng, Nasi Lamek, and Curry Chicken. <br><br>Taufu Goreng: we personally prefer our taufu drier with more peanuts. This dish was made a little wetter with carrots shredded on top. It&#39;s a more &#34;vegetably&#34; dish compared to the ones found in Geylang Serai. So if you like your dish less &#34;nut&#34; heavy, then this is the place for you. <br><br>Nasi Lamak- you don&#39;t come to Singapore and not try this dish as the standard Malaysian dish to try. It&#39;s a rice with sides dish that usually comes with fried things. This one in MacRitchie had fried fish cake, a sunny side up, fried chicken wings, and then anchovies with peanuts. It&#39;s a very dried and flavorful dish if you don&#39;t mind something proteinacious and calorically dense- this is not a green colorful dish. The dish here is pretty good- not my style but glad we ordered this signature Malaysian dish! <br><br>Curry Chicken- I love a good Singaporean curry- it&#39;s a little tumericky and more powdery than the creamier soupier versions you see in the US. It tastes more herbal- stew some potatoes in it for a few hours and it&#39;s the most delicious combination you can have. Curry chicken here was spot on and came with some rice. <br><br>Overall- it&#39;s not your biggest variety that a food circus would have, but it has the representatives of what Singapore is known for. It&#39;s more of a snack stall, so you won&#39;t find more authentic dishes that require large fires and woks. You&#39;ll find rice dishes and things that can be put out for a long time that do not require freshly made food for it to taste good. <br><br>Drinks were between 120-400 SGD depending on what you&#39;re getting. If you&#39;re hiking here, I recommend the 100 drink which is your gatorade electrolyte replenishment out here.

Fresh coconut $4. Helped me hydrate after a long run.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Fresh coconut $4. Helped me hydrate after a long run.'}]
text: Small cafe located at the MacRichie reservoir park, nice place to hang out after spending sometime at the park.<br><br>I came here after two hours of jogging at the park. Quite hot and tired, my body wanted fresh coconut. Coconut helped me replenish my very dehydrated body, felt so much better after finished drinking.<br><br>They also sell some food but be aware of monkeys. I saw them take food from others. They also like to take your wallets and phones. Guard your food and belongings from monkeys.<br><br>People are nice. We watched each other&#39;s from getting attacked by monkeys, lol. Table near the pillars should be avoided, easy target for monkeys.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=M1tsfz6V2O1JGyinpNQMCg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'M M.', 'displayLocation': 'Manhattan, NY', 'altText': 'M M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=M1tsfz6V2O1JGyinpNQMCg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 28, 'reviewCount': 43, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Would not recommend.<br><br>I walked by Flee Away and decided to pop in for a coffee because it looked quite cute... It&#39;s decorated head to toe with toys and airplanes with a somewhat vintage vibe. A very kid friendly appearance, but I appreciated the quirkiness nonetheless. Excited by the ambiance, I approached the counter to order my coffee. The woman working was exceptionally rude throughout our entire interaction. I decided to get my order as take away because of her attitude I did not want to linger there any longer. Upon leaving I thanked her and said &#34;have a nice day&#34; to which her response was &#34;yes, okay&#34; without even looking up at me. I was baffled by how such an adorable place could house such a grumpy woman that acted as if my coffee order was greatly inconveniencing her... and the coffee wasn&#39;t even any good!

text: Back here one more time with one of my foodie friends. Was around this area and I remembered Erik and Marcus saying that the Chendol Smoothie was good during the 1st Elite event in Oct 2014.<br><br>This time round I also looked more details into the interior designs and the small goodies on the glass cabinet where you can purchase. It was pretty neatly design. As I am more visual person, I tend to go for bold and light colors (yellow, green, blue, orange) and I realized that this place had a combination of the colors I love.<br><br>Besides that, saw familiar faces at the cashier. I doubt they recognized me as I was with a group of Yelpers when I first visited two months ago. Before stepping into this cafe, I forgotten which smoothie I wanted to try and finally decided on Chendol Smoothie. Since I wanted to go and explore more food choices in Bugis, I ended up getting my smoothie to go. <br><br>Whoops.. And I checked in after I purchased the smoothie. No more 10% discount :( The drink was served pretty quickly and I left the place within 5 minutes.<br><br>While walking towards Bugis, I took sips of the smoothie. I asked my friend to taste it first and then I tasted it. After the first sip, it became addictive. It is much better than the real Chendol. The smoothie was blend in perfect amount of ingredients. I could also taste the green colored jelly on it. It was pretty thick smoothie that it took me quite awhile to finish it up.<br><br>One downside of the smoothie was the straw. They provided the normal straw and a spoon. It would be better if I was given a bubble/boba tea straw so I can consume the corn, the red bean and the green colored jelly together in one go. When I reached bugis, all the heavier ingredients were left behind and I tried eating it with a spoon but it wasn&#39;t as good as the smoothie were gone and the heavier ingredients were left over.<br><br>Overall, I love the smoothie. Just that it was on the pricier side. Will definitely come back for more rounds of Chendol Smoothies when I am craving for one :)

Coffees served old school with cute biscuits', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Coffees served old school with cute biscuits'}]
text: Cute as a button! Don&#39;t be put off by the roadworks outside, because behind the front door Flee Away is an escape from the noise and heat outside. It&#39;s a cafe, but with a twist. Yes you can eat and drink, but look closer at the menu for a few surprises. And while you&#39;re flexing those eyeballs, look up at the walls and ceilings for old antique trinkets that make you feel like you&#39;re in a child&#39;s bedroom. There are perspex boxes by the front door and inside you will find locally made nick-nacks that you can buy and take home. A great spot for unique gifts with a Singapore flavour.<br><br>The menu is intriguing. There&#39;s familiar flavours like Chicken Curry and Laksa, but they&#39;re served up in entirely inventive ways. The Chicken Curry &#34;sandwich&#34; was incredibly tasty, though I&#39;m glad to have shared one as it was incredibly rich. I don&#39;t even know what the &#34;bread&#34; was but apparently it&#39;s a well known Chinese food item that is never used in sandwich format. <br><br>The same innovation extends to the drinks menu, especially the milkshakes.  At Flee Away you can order fun milkshakes like &#34;Happy Birthday&#34; flavour that features cake mix inside. Why eat Red Velvet Cake when you can drink a milkshake that tastes like it? <br><br>The coffee isn&#39;t going to win any awards for third wave artistry, but it&#39;s passable and comes served in a cute teacup loaded with little lion biscuits in the side. <br><br>The ambience here is nice, with great music and staff who really want you to have fun and enjoy yourself. You won&#39;t feel bad spending some hours here working or reading, so feel free to bring a book and settle in with some food and drinks.

Try their desserts!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Try their desserts!'}]
text: A small quirky cafe. They are about 2 months old, tucked neatly at Dunlop Street, this little cafe offers a small and unique menu. A must try is their Red Velvet Milkshake and their popular sago gula Melaka pancake.

This place has been here ever since I started working in town. It&#39;s the closest thing to Ya Kun you&#39;re gonna get. Both kaya toast and butter toast are good. However, there was one time I was served butter sugar toast with a thick slab of butter. It was pretty gross,like I was biting into a brick of butter. I like butter, so at first i was like &#34;score!&#34;,but after the first bite, I was feeling &#34;eww&#34;. <br><br>They serve lunch here too. Some local delights like nasi lemak, mee rebus, mee siam. As I&#39;ve worked around this area for the past 8 years, I&#39;ve tried them all at some point, but not good enough to have tried them again. <br><br>Come here for your coffee and toast fix. Lots of office workers in the morning. Good place to people watch and eavesdrop on conversations. <br><br>-1 star for that butter incident
