Breads', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Breads'}]
text: Summary: Four stars solely owed to the breads. Drinks are average or slightly below average. Haven&#39;t tried food items. <br><br>I go to church near this place so have come here several times for our small group over coffee drinks. I was not impressed and thought the drinks were so dull and the place was simply not worth my time putting it into a review. But oh boy did today change everything! <br><br>I had a chance to try their cinnamon bun thanks to my friend and I was in love. Maybe I haven&#39;t found too many good bread places yet, but I really appreciated the made-from-scratch, fluffy texture that lived inside the bread with just a dash of cinnamon instead of being smothered with it. (Yes, I am a sucker for such delicacy,) <br><br>So I wanted to bring back home the bun but the cinnamon bun was already all sold out by the time I left. So I chose milk plait as an alternative and it was also really good. But 3.5/5 goodness, not exactly 4. But again the texture was just so right. Couldn&#39;t stop myself from eating almost entirely to continue ripping the bread to its texture.<br><br>My friend told me that their baguette and ciabatta, rustic bread are all really good. Another good thing about Simply Bread is that the prices are reasonable. Both of my times were around $4,59 each. Will definitely come back for those.

Sticky bun ($1.85) - 5 stars<br>I remember the good old days when Simply Bread first opened along the Singapore river and my runs were interrupted by the smell of baking bread wafting in the air. I would make sticky buns on my own, but for the price (and to avert the temptation of finishing an entire tray), these sticky buns are a fantastic alternative.

Just a place to get different types of bread and rolls if you are living in the area. Nothing special. I do like the sticky bun as not many places have that. It goes very well with a cup of hot tea. <br><br>The brunch plate was typical with eggs, sausage/bacon and toast. The place is a bit small with some large tables which you could share with other diners as it can get busy with the weekend breakfast crowd. <br><br>It is fairly quiet in the afternoon, making it a good place to read with a cup of coffee and bun or teacake.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=X3bJXRs56JieQQjJH3Xk2w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Trish M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Trish M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=X3bJXRs56JieQQjJH3Xk2w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 16, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 4, 'eliteYear': None}
text: The bread is top quality artisan style and pretty good value. The sour dough loaf is so good I can&#39;t resist eating it, even when I am trying to stay off bread. It really is some of the best bread I have had from anywhere. I often buy the raisin knot as it is a great school/after school snack for the kids. The kids love the ciabatta loaf<br>I cant really comment on the coffee or eat in food but highly rate the bread. I buy a prepaid card which gives me 10% off as I regularly purchase from here.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8HZvW2wTeI9mvC57KyFeqA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/simply-bread-singapore-2?reviewid=vq-2O3QA0jR5Z52K2vUTeg&select=8HZvW2wTeI9mvC57KyFeqA', 'altText': 'Photo of Simply Bread - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: You&#39;ll find Simply Bread in a quiet corner of Cluny Court, just past Relish. I&#39;d say it&#39;s quite hard to have a craving for Simply Bread, because, true to their name, it&#39;s really just simple sandwiches which decent ingredients. Yet I guess it&#39;s the setting of the place that makes people come to it. It&#39;s really quiet and un-intimidating, good for a quiet read over a sandwich, or a catch-up with friends. <br><br>What I&#39;d usually get is the Salt Beef sandwich, mainly because it sounded the most unique off the pretty run-of-the-mill menu, and I&#39;ve also got the Roast Beef sandwich before, which was a fairly dry affair. Granted, they do use rather fresh (home-baked?) bread, but I like them toasted because it makes it crispy and for me that&#39;s my favourite part of their sandwiches.<br><br>If I came back again I&#39;d like to try their Shiitake mushroom sandwich, which does seem quite a treat, and I think is a fairly new item on the menu. Otherwise I&#39;d just stop by for a Sticky Bun, which has always proven to be a real winner with those with a sweet tooth.

Nice quiet place to sit down for a cup of coffee and of course a sticky bun cos they&#39;re simply delicious. I&#39;ve been buying bread from simply bread for over 10 years and have never been disappointed. <br><br>Unfortunately, 4 stars only because tables here aren&#39;t cleaned very promptly (perhaps cos it&#39;s quite a lean operation) and I was recently there on a hot Sunday afternoon when the ac was not switched on.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kmI9h6vv_4awLWAuTmTW_g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/simply-bread-singapore-2?reviewid=9fH6ioXZy1PidqXXsStGzg&select=kmI9h6vv_4awLWAuTmTW_g', 'altText': 'Photo of Simply Bread - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8fGj2UdGE4YdeboKd-q3eg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/simply-bread-singapore-2?reviewid=9fH6ioXZy1PidqXXsStGzg&select=8fGj2UdGE4YdeboKd-q3eg', 'altText': 'Photo of Simply Bread - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Tucked away in a serene corner of Bukit Timah, Simply Bread not only offers freshly baked loaves. They do a mighty awesome flat-white as well. Their menu offering includes an all-day breakfast selection along with classic sandwiches that are generously stuffed. Small bites like the &#39;Sticky bun&#39; (A must try) are also available if you&#39;re craving something to accompany your cuppa. Long communal timber tables layed across raw concrete floors give a homely feel making it the perfect place for a weekend brunch or even late afternoon tea.

Compared to the outlet at Guthrie House, this outlet feels significantly smaller. Perched on the second floor of Cluny Court, what makes this outlet comparably outstanding is the flood of natural light that brightens up the entire space, making the restaurant appear extra pristine. Unlike the Guthrie outlet, however, the way the food is displayed is probably compromised by the smaller space- I&#39;m not sure if I appreciate the fact that the bread counter faces the main corridor, is stacked three segments high and most of the bread just pile on top of each other.<br> <br>I&#39;m not sure if this is the same for the Guthrie outlet, but I had a ridiculous experience once upon a time. My friend and I bought a baguette ($3++) and requested for it to be sliced (it was pretty rock hard), and was told that each slice would cost an additional $1. I have no idea why we decided it was still a good idea to go ahead- probably we were afraid of tearing our teeth out with the bread if we were to dissect it ourselves. Anyway, the eventual cost added up to more than $11.. 300% off the original price, just for the slicing alone. Up till this day, I still cannot decide if we were being ridiculous (I think so) to have gone ahead with it or that the restaurant was ridiculous in coming up with such a surcharge, bearing in mind it was empty when we were and the slicing (by the machine, may I add) took all of 30 seconds. Surely this senselessness cannot be justified by manpower/time.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=G92i7VLFbSO5jJBrJmK0PQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4EeYZlLe-PYnhsKKaRZMHA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4EeYZlLe-PYnhsKKaRZMHA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4EeYZlLe-PYnhsKKaRZMHA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4EeYZlLe-PYnhsKKaRZMHA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4EeYZlLe-PYnhsKKaRZMHA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4EeYZlLe-PYnhsKKaRZMHA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Abdullah Al A.', 'displayLocation': 'Boston, MA', 'altText': 'Abdullah Al A.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=G92i7VLFbSO5jJBrJmK0PQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 19, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 6, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Nice quiet space to relax, usually not so crowded. Staff are friendly though not the best coffee shop staff I&#39;ve ever come across. Sandwiches are expensive, coffee and tea are highly recommended.

Great innovative spot with lots of press. Very creative menu options for a dessert I truly love - vanilla ice cream with a shot of espresso over it...the affogato.<br><br>This place takes that idea to the next level and starts mixing up all different types of ice cream flavors with different kinds of coffee and other toppings. Definitely worth a look for these reasons.<br><br>However, where my frustration comes is that there is no seating time limit policy and in a way it is a great problem for them to have. The place is a coffeehouse but also a dessert spot - you literally cannot eat an affogato if you have nowhere to sit. You can&#39;t have it for take out since the point of an affogato is a hot espresso over a cold ice cream.<br><br>Unfortunately, many patrons buy a shot of espresso or coffee and read a book or work on their laptop for much time as if it is a normal coffee shop, even during peak hours when there is nowhere to sit.<br><br>I hope they do figure this out as I would for sure come back much more often!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/IgoJ6jHKNsH8F-o-cLxkzg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-affogato-bar-singapore?reviewid=552IkBfnPkYbRFLrngxchA&select=IgoJ6jHKNsH8F-o-cLxkzg', 'altText': 'Photo of The Affogato Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Rum and raisin affogato', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Rum and raisin affogato'}]
text: Was in the neighborhood for brunch (also a good pit stop after you&#39;ve been wandering around the delightful Botanical gardens) and spotted this quaint affogato bar. Its tiny, so you might have to wait for a table, but the affogato is worth it! The gelato is creamy, and the espresso has a nice kick. The combination is great and they have some nice cookbooks that you can peruse while you dig in.
Soy latte ($6 for regular) - 3.5 stars<br>Decent but wish it had a... stronger soy taste. They use Pacific not Bonsoy.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Xh2J685V0soFDtS1DJSnBQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-affogato-bar-singapore?reviewid=8V57r_G-2wy-fRqJ0xvAHA&select=Xh2J685V0soFDtS1DJSnBQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Affogato Bar - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3tkO5WZ2AsP5znhzA1jcJw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-affogato-bar-singapore?reviewid=8V57r_G-2wy-fRqJ0xvAHA&select=3tkO5WZ2AsP5znhzA1jcJw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Affogato Bar - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Had high expectation for a delicious affogato since I was heading to THE affogato bar. But seriously, my least favorite affogato I&#39;ve ever had. <br><br>La opera is not my thing. The espresso was so bitter, the overly sweet chocolate ganache, almond sponge is all too much. The best part? Dark espresso ice cream but more like just normal coffee ice cream. And you can get away with $4.50 for one scoop. My buddy Lippy and I paid $15.90 for a bunch of Bla. ya.... should have just gotten a Milo Dino McFlurry.  yup, nice ambience, nice service but the affogato not so nice. <br><br>#latergram #affogato #drklingeats

Monday 1:36pm already out of La Opera and Banana R...hmmmmm.  small cosy place. parking not an issue. was told the sister company louge emhasize different flavor if this is a pass we will head to the other and the verdict is??? superb!! wonder mix. got the white, apple and choc.   All were well balanced ans not too sweet.

text: I had a bagel and a cappuccino this morning. The cappuccino was OK, but not special. It used some beans with some nutty flavor but I prefer the Arabica with some fruitiness in it. The bagel, on the other hand, was amazing. I&#39;ve come back several times just for the bagel.

Nacho cheese fries', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Nacho cheese fries'}]
text: Quirky little cafè hidden away. Nice service and not too busy. Quality food and eats, bring spare pants.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UDuy6drU0wkkGpRsWKCLSQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/flavour-flings-singapore?reviewid=NY-6SLeEzktF_J5FyS5KPA&select=UDuy6drU0wkkGpRsWKCLSQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Flavour Flings - Singapore, Singapore. Dirty Norwegian croissant', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Dirty Norwegian croissant'}]
text: Flavor Flings is all kinds of unexpected. A halal cafe in the middle of a HDB estate that is known for its salted egg croissants. Make that unexpectedly good. <br><br>The afore-mentioned salted egg yolk croissant is all kinds of decadent good. Perhaps a little pricey at $7 but worth the occasional treat. It&#39;s a light and flaky pastry with a rich, sweet, and savory salted egg filling that is so unctuous. It&#39;s yummy. Note: they do sell out of these so come early. <br><br>I&#39;ve also had the Dirty Norwegian croissant which is great for a brunch entree. It&#39;s the same flaky croissant with smoked salmon, poached eggs, with the same salted egg yolk sauce plus buttered cereal. It&#39;s everything great about the salted egg yolk croissant and then leveled up for brunch. Also served with a side salad that I appreciated and chicken sausages that I thought was extraneous and distracting. <br><br>Great casual spot for brunch.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yRpAgWwIn6EO6wkLe5mI4Q/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/flavour-flings-singapore?reviewid=haHiJMxCkjdodRhjFJYwpQ&select=yRpAgWwIn6EO6wkLe5mI4Q', 'altText': 'Photo of Flavour Flings - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I had the honey chicken burger takeaway and it was still warm and tasty when I got home. The fries were a tad soggy but that&#39;s to be expected. My daughter ordered smoked salmon with egg croissant. I&#39;ll definitely order again and try something else on their menu

text: Having brunch with friend, ordered the famous salted egg yolk crossaint $6.90 and aglio olio with salmon $15.90. The crossaint is good, flowing lava and the portion is big. However, no so much on the pasta as it looks like a mee goreng (Local fried noodle) to me and taste a bit too much peppercorn.<br>Cappuccino and mocha are just averagely good. Good ambience and friendly staffs, suitable for group catch up.<br>3.5 stars if you ask me, there is room for improvement. Will come back again in future.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=C8jnXWKxPfOCNqPhXd0t3g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/NJX0OVTyLyiw6zmeoQQZiQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/NJX0OVTyLyiw6zmeoQQZiQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/NJX0OVTyLyiw6zmeoQQZiQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/NJX0OVTyLyiw6zmeoQQZiQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/NJX0OVTyLyiw6zmeoQQZiQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/NJX0OVTyLyiw6zmeoQQZiQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Aris L.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Aris L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=C8jnXWKxPfOCNqPhXd0t3g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 179, 'photoCount': 84, 'reviewCount': 506, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I went there to try the salted egg yolk croissant..taste good!!<br><br>CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!!

I&#39;ve tried my fair share of salted egg yolk croissants, and flavor flings cafe has the best around in my opinion. It&#39;s not cheap but it&#39;s huge and the filling to crust ratio is pretty substantial. I would get one to share over a cup of coffee or tea! Recently the cafe has also expanded its hipster offerings to include raclette as well! Let me get a stab at it and report back :P

Fantastic Salted Egg Croissant. The one and only for sparking the nationwide slates everything craze. Now hey are starting the chessy everything phenomenon. The beef steak with the melting cheese right in front is simply magical.

Once Sogurt&#39;s flagship outlet, now remodelled and rebranded to Kara. Sogurt&#39;s co-founder was a student at USC (#fighton!) and was inspired by Yogurtland to bring the self-serve froyo concept back to Singapore. Kara cafe offers both savoury dishes and sweet desserts (including Sogurt froyo AND new ice cream!)<br><br>Ambience is great, decor is cute. There&#39;s a nice balance of the cuteness of what Sogurt used to be, and its more sophisticated counterpart, KARA. There&#39;s nothing not to like about the space!<br><br>Their menu features an interesting mix of cuisines (mix of Mexican, Korean, Japanese, etc). That, coupled with the decor and the craft beers, kinda gave me an LA vibe. I&#39;ve had the chance to try some of their entrees, including the grain bowls and the fish and chips. The food is decently good for a brunch date / with family.<br><br>I love that they still kept their self-serve froyo concept at the back of the store even after changing the style of the outlet. Ask for sample cups if you want to try any of the new flavours! They also have an interesting mochi waffle that you can order together with your froyo/ice cream!<br><br>If you ever need to rent a space, they also have a second floor that is able to host a good number of people for an event. <br><br>Parking right outside the store is limited (perhaps less than 10 lots). Would recommend either parking at Coronation Plaza nearby, or at the parking spaces near the private housings further in. <br>Alternatively, it&#39;s less than a 5 min walk from Tan Kah Kee MRT station (DTL)!

text: November 2017<br>Tempura fish bowl with quinoa ($16 + $3++) - 3 stars<br>The quinoa wasn&#39;t worth the top up since there wasn&#39;t much quinoa. It looked pretty and came with extra greens, but in the end it left me hungry. There was only one large slice of fish.<br><br>Soy matcha latte ($5.50) - 2.5 stars<br>It&#39;s been a long while since I&#39;ve ordered a soy matcha latte (I usually make them at home). It was nice to taste something different but this one tasted a little off somehow. I guess the flavour was too thin.<br><br>=============<br>September 2017<br>Tempura fish bowl ($16++) - 4 stars<br>Good! Not amazing though. Not sure if I&#39;d pay the original price.<br><br>Pork belly bowl ($16++) - 3 stars<br>My bad, I&#39;m not a fan of such fatty meat.<br><br>Used the offer on chope for one-for-one grain bowls. Have to try the rest of the food!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=g-P058qnhLVXnEZYKBaVug', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/36HFEbP1tXDRdCmQFx-DaA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/36HFEbP1tXDRdCmQFx-DaA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/36HFEbP1tXDRdCmQFx-DaA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/36HFEbP1tXDRdCmQFx-DaA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/36HFEbP1tXDRdCmQFx-DaA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/36HFEbP1tXDRdCmQFx-DaA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Alyssa Chloe T.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Alyssa Chloe T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=g-P058qnhLVXnEZYKBaVug', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 101, 'photoCount': 128, 'reviewCount': 82, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Cute cafe; I would have expected nothing less from the creators of Sogurt! The place was spacious and bright (at least the main hall was). <br><br>Food was pretty good. I had the beef bowl, which was pretty good and spicy. <br>However, for healthy food, it did have a lot of sauce (and salt). <br><br>My main gripe was the experience. <br>My colleagues and I (group of 7) went there for lunch, and had ordered our food. A little while later (maybe 15 minutes or so), a group of people form MediaCorp came into the cafe. We thought they were just stopping by to grab something to eat, little did we know they were going to film. We were approached by the staff to tell us that we needed to keep quiet while they were filming. <br>It was a really unpleasant lunch as we kept getting stared at when we were eating (it&#39;s not like we can help it when our utensils hit the plates/bowls). <br>We would have appreciated it if the staff had informed us of the filming before we ordered so that we could decide if we wanted to go somewhere else or continue to eat there in silence.

Healthy food place featuring salad bowls, grain bowls and less healthy dessert. The food is decent though a bit too saucy to be healthy. Desserts are a bit too sweet for me. But overall, a pretty nice space / good for catching up with friends.

Steam Boat', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Steam Boat'}]
text: Fantastic Authentic Place!!!<br>What a treat and a surprise to end up in this little restaurant. It was our first Dinner experience in Singapore and we were so happy to be there.<br>The Owner Katie was so nice with us and helped to chose our meals. The steam boat concept is based on 2 broth one spicy and the other not. you pick your meat and vegetables and cook them in the broth of your choice. We were surrounded by locals and most important regulars of this restaurant. I can&#39;t emphasize enough how great is this place. Thanks Katie for such a treat.

delicious authentic steamboat, Chinese-style! The ingredients are fresh and abundant, and the staff are quick and prompt in topping up the soup and water. I&#39;ve been here more than 5 times, and it&#39;s my fave Chinese-style steamboat place to frequent. (vs my fave ma la style steamboat - that would be Hai Di Lao or Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao). <br><br>I usually the tom yum and non-spicy chicken soup. The tom yum soup is thai-style, spicy and sour without being overbearing. Of course, the soup becomes denser after meat slices and other ingredients stew in it, and gets tastier and tastier. The chicken soup is alright, nothing spectacular but it does the job. They have plenty of the usual steamboat dishes like beef, chicken, etc slices, dumplings, veggies like cabbage, winter melon, potato and so on, and they also have fish glue. The staff squeeze it out and use a pair of scissors to snip off pieces into the soup, just the way it should be done! <br><br>The fried calamari was surprisingly light and good. We ordered it according to the server&#39;s recommendation, initially a little skeptical, but it was such a great decision. It didn&#39;t taste oily as fried food often does. <br><br>I&#39;ve come here with fellow interns too and they had a fantastic lunch set that 5 of us shared, that I unfortunately can&#39;t remember the particulars of. I&#39;ve also made reservations most of the times I came, though I&#39;m not sure it&#39;s strictly necessary if you don&#39;t mind waiting for a bit. <br><br>The decor is minimal, with metal tables and chairs and a more casual atmosphere. <br><br>Close to Novena MRT and malls like United Square nearby!

Curry Laksa', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Curry Laksa'}]
text: This restaurant is located in the food hall at the gardens by the bay.  There&#39;s a bunch of places to choose from, but the food here was pretty good.<br><br>We got a bowl of curry laksa which was good.  It was heavy on the coconut, if you like that kind of curry laksa.

So the food here is terrible and I think I knew it would be terrible when I walked in but I was so hungry and just came from travelling for 36 hours and did not care.  If you are in the area, take the time to walk 10 more min to Satay by the Bay or something (don&#39;t eat at this restaurant or in this food court at all.)  <br><br>Ordering was weird.  They make you sit with a menu but then you have to get up and go to the register to order and pre-pay.  Why not just make you do that while you&#39;re standing in the first place?  <br><br>I ordered iced gula melaka coffee, kaya butter toast and laksa.  The coffee was great.  I should hope you can&#39;t mess up something that is so sweet.  The kaya toast... I&#39;ve had better.  I think I should have gone with the steamed bread as the toast was dry without much filling.  The laksa... yuck.  Just yuck.  Didn&#39;t have good flavor, was cold when I got it and the cockles were definitely NOT fresh.  Actually, none of the seafood was.  <br><br>Definitely would never eat here again.  Would actually prefer to forget all about it.

Supposed to be lemongrass chicken Nasi lemak but don&#39;t taste that.', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': "Supposed to be lemongrass chicken Nasi lemak but don't taste that."}]
text: This is probably 2.5 stars place. <br><br>Temper your expectation as you are in a tourist attraction area where food is not the focus. The price is mostly under $10 which is not too bad considering you are in the middle of nowhere. <br><br>There are not many food choices inside Gardens by the Bay (unless you go specifically to Satay by the Bay) and this is one option for local food with local styled coffee and tea. <br><br>The food is really not fantastic but it is passably average. Do not get the chicken rice, it is definitely not one of the better versions around. <br><br>The nasi lemak is surprisingly ok. The rice has a coconut fragrance and taste and the sides of achar (pickled vegetables), ikan bilis, peanuts and sambal are ok. The fried chicken I is nice but I wish it has the lemongrass taste as stated in the menu. <br><br>The iced lemongrass drink is good too. <br><br>Service is efficient. <br><br>You can pay by credit card if the bill is above $15. Paywave is available too.

text: Came to explore Gardens by the Bay and decided to have lunch here. <br><br>Read online that the Hokkien Mee is nice here, so we ordered that and other items. <br><br>Hokkien Noodle - quite a big portion of noodles on a piece of banana leaf. The taste is slightly better than average. The Chilli that they gave with the noodles is really not worth any mention. <br><br>Chicken Rice - the meat was nice but not many pieces in total. The rice had a lot of ginger cooked in it and my girl didn&#39;t really appreciate it. <br><br>Signature Nasi Lemak - flavourful rice cooked in coconut and the accompanying fried chicken leg was well-seasoned and fried. Chilli is not bad for this dish. Flavour but no bite. <br><br>Curry Chicken with Steamed Bread - 4 square slices of traditional bread in a steamer with a bowl of chicken curry. The bread is ordinary and a bit mushy but served in a drama manner only. Heh. Average tasting and not spicy enough. <br><br>Not likely to come here for more as the food here was expensive and not good enough to worth the buck.

text: Avoid! The food is nothing like what it was shown on the menu. <br><br>The food is horrible. The presentation looks bad and the food tastes even worse. I know I shouldn&#39;t have any expectation from a restaurant inside a theme park, but this is supposed to be local Singaporean food. How bad could it be for them to own local food? It&#39;s really bad!<br><br>Laksa - probably the worst Laksa in Singapore. The broth looks bad and taste even worse. I&#39;ve had better Laksa outside of Singapore.<br><br>Kaya toast - toast is not even warm, feels like it&#39;s been made for a while, put aside, then add the kaya when there&#39;s order. Worst kata toast ever!<br><br>Kong Bak Pau - the bun is the best part really.... The braised pork is dry and too hard to chew. It&#39;s over cooked!<br><br>It&#39;s just food to fill up the stomach. There is no service here and we have to walk up to the cashier to pay at the end.

text: Hill Street Coffee Shop is one of the many eateries at Supertree Dining, located inside the newly launched Gardens By the Bay.<br><br>If you are looking at some local favourites or a nice kopi (Coffee) or teh (Tea), head down to Hill Street and enjoy some really good delights. Decorated to simulate the olden days in Singapore, the tables and chairs are also specially created to give an overall feel to the dining area. The menu comes in a form of newspapers and even the waiters are dressed up as &#39;kopi boys&#39;, similar to the past, to bring the whole experience to the next level.<br><br>If you&#39;re there, you have to try the steam bread. Not those buns (man tou), but really soft steamed bread. It was the simplest dish I tried in the day, but the one that I can&#39;t forget till today. It&#39;s simple amazing and really good! The bread is so soft, so warm and so tender! I wouldn&#39;t mind just eating that the entire day. Other local favourites like Hokkien noodles and nasi lemak are also served at Hill Street Coffee Shop.

text: the food that i ordered served well and good to have. all things good but staff definitely male serving was terrible. I can&#39;t hear from them anything when they serve dish or clean the table. they are doing god damn service all the time.

Hill Street Coffeeshop sits in the Supertree Dining area in Gardens by the Bay.<br><br>We were there on a Sunday at about noon and it was the only busy food outlet there. The service was prompt and food was served quickly. We ordered Fried Hokkien Noodles, Char Kuay Teow, White Fried Carrot Cake and Chicken Curry Noodles.the Char Kuay Teow was well done but lacked cockles, as stated in the menu.<br><br>The Fried Hokkien Noodles is unlike what you usually get at the hawker centre. It didn&#39;t have any gravy, but tastes great anyways.  <br><br>The curry chicken noodles was unlike what was shown on the menu. On the menu, the chicken were in shreds but when it was served, it was 2 large pieces of chicken thighs with the bone in. This made it very awkward to eat. The noodles didn&#39;t seem to have been blanched beforehand so they were quite dry in the gravy. The gravy was very tasty but a little too thick for my liking. Overall, it was still a pretty good dish. <br><br>The worst dish was the fried carrot cake. I ordered it as I saw someone at the next table having it and it looked great. But when it came, the carrot cake itself tasted sour, like it was old. My kids usually devour this but rejected this for the first time. I returned it to the kitchen and saw that the diners on the next table had left and barely touched theirs. I figured they must have had the same problem. They brought a fresh plate out for me and apologised. There were still some bits in there that tasted off, but they were mostly okay. By that time I was too full from lunch that I didn&#39;t finish the dish.<br><br>I thought the dishes on the menu looked great but the actual dishes kinda fell short in small ways.

text: Really nice place. Great food, drinks and hospitality. The Indian food is extremely delicious

I had a massive craving one day for financiers and was really pleased to find a place that made them fresh. While they are pricey ($3.50 each), I still got two to try - the matcha and regular one.<br><br>They were still hot from the oven when I got them, and wow! Nothing beats soft insides, crisp exterior, and a rich decadent buttery taste altogether. So simple, so good.<br><br>Come and get a few for yourself, and eat it right away!

text: My sis was the one who told me about Henry Charpentier. As if not everyone already know, Henri Charpentier is not the owner or related to this chain of bakery. The owner, a Japanese, was fascinated with the Crêpe Suzette created by the late French chef hence named the first Café (established in Ashiya in 1969) after him. <br><br>Since the one at Ion Orchard has not officially opened, my sis and I made plans to meet at the location at Orchard Central on Saturday at 1pm. <br><br>AMBIENCE 3/5<br>There was not much ambience going on. There are just essentially like 3-4 tables (plastic kind) and chairs are not the comfy kind. To be honest, I like my café in a enclosed setting. <br><br>SERVICE 4/5<br>Staff was very nice and patient. I was looking around, opted for a financier, then added a soufflé cheesecake and a iced tea. I arrived there before my sister, I wanted to order something and then grab a table since seatings are a premium. I probably took quite a while, my sis came from behind and tried to scare me :D silly sis!! Then she added another dunno what kind of cake and a iced coffee. <br>Maybe it was good she showed up before the staff rang up all my order, cos she went like she would pay. Hahaha!! Thank you sis!!! <br><br>Then I realized staff did not give me any syrup for my iced tea. Hence -1.<br><br>FOOD 4/5<br>Hmmm... I was not wowed by the financier or the soufflé cheesecake. I definitely have better pastries elsewhere. <br><br>I will definitely check out the new location when it opens at Ion Orchard. Hopefully it will open before I head back to Atlanta in July.

Left: cheesecake. Right: strawberry shortcake', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Left: cheesecake. Right: strawberry shortcake'}]
text: Mmm.. the cakes here are delicious. There is very limited seating, about 3-4 tables so we had to get our cake to go. We did manage to find seating elsewhere in the mall.<br>This is what we had - rare cheese cake. Wow, this was so thick and rich. You won&#39;t regret it.<br>We also had the strawberry shortcake. The sponge was light and fluffy, with layers of sweet strawberry in between. This was topped off with delicious cream.<br>If you get both, I would recommend eating the strawberry short cake first, because the rare cheese cake will overpower the strawberry shortcake and you won&#39;t be able to taste it as much.

text: Delicious financiers (miniature butter pound cakes).   We tried the Japanese version (pre-packaged) and the freshly baked one from the store (warm, delicious, buttery, bigger).   The taste was buttery, almondy, soft, very enjoyable.   We also got a cake (Mille Crepe) and it was moist and creamy.   Overall a nice stop for sweets.

text: 3.5 world record famous financiers apparently, including matcha.  lot to live up to.  good on the flavor and moistness but not a repeat item for me.

Simply the best gelato I&#39;ve ever had!  My daughter and I finished dinner nearby and used yelp to find a good ice cream place in proxumity and that led us to Butterknife Folk.  From a quick sample, it was clear that there was a lot of time and effort put into crafting such a great product and we ordered scoops for each of us.  <br><br>While speaking with the woman behind the counter, she shared the story of how their process of producing such fresh gelato and you&#39;ll realize it at first taste.  The process includes only fresh ingredient and takes multiple days to create it all, no shortcuts!<br><br>While in the shop enjoying our ice cream there was a steady flow of people who stopped in for a scoop or two, justifiably showing that it&#39;s worthy of a destination dessert stop.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Z2Dhhnuxuq1CWjBUegG4bA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/butterknife-folk-singapore?reviewid=GTONhpAh0XRZwRWnodQN-w&select=Z2Dhhnuxuq1CWjBUegG4bA', 'altText': 'Photo of Butterknife Folk - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/pF3knvTNoqzuzIolcCl0Bw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/butterknife-folk-singapore?reviewid=GTONhpAh0XRZwRWnodQN-w&select=pF3knvTNoqzuzIolcCl0Bw', 'altText': 'Photo of Butterknife Folk - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/wucDWDGhdpNYVnRATG9kLQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/butterknife-folk-singapore?reviewid=GTONhpAh0XRZwRWnodQN-w&select=wucDWDGhdpNYVnRATG9kLQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Butterknife Folk - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4R5TxMQ6Q_gziCgLqlVgwg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/butterknife-folk-singapore?reviewid=GTONhpAh0XRZwRWnodQN-w&select=4R5TxMQ6Q_gziCgLqlVgwg', 'altText': 'Photo of Butterknife Folk - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: Gelato That Makes You Warm and Fuzzy Inside<br><br>We&#39;re always on the lookout for new dessert places to try and boy we&#39;re we glad we heard of Butterknife Folk. <br><br>Located along River Valley Rd, Butterknife Folk feels more atelier / r&amp;d &#34;workshop&#34; than it does a cafe but make no mistake, what ever research they&#39;re doing here, they&#39;re doing it right. <br><br>Gelato - Double Scoop ($8.00)<br>What we liked is that they don&#39;t go overkill on the flavours. More often than not, we see a lot of these artisanal gelato places try to offer as many flavours as they can, and more often than not, a lot of the flavours fall short.  <br>Not here. While they may not have the biggest variety (it&#39;s still very substantial at about 15 flavours? I think), they do these 15 flavours well. <br>After sampling a few, we decided to go with Strawberry and Oat and Mascarpone. <br>The strawberry and oat was very pleasant and not overly sweet. It didn&#39;t taste overly sweetened or overly artificial and the oats ended a nice texture and chewiness to the ice-cream. <br><br>The mascarpone was very good too. Lightly sweetened, the mascarpone was smooth, not overly rich, and tested almost..... refreshing (I know, cheese? Refreshing?). It was like a scoop of fluffy Hokkaido cheesecake but milder in the cheese flavour (Mascarpone after all is a little on the tasteless side). <br><br>Amazingly, by combining both, we noticed tha it wasted a lot like a very yummy, strawberry cheesecake. Brilliant! <br><br>And what went fantastically well with the gelato?<br><br>Waffle Fingers ($4.00)<br>How clever. &#34;Sticks&#34; of wonderfully cooked waffles that were freshly made to order, very tasty on its own, paired with a syringe of maple syrup, and mixed in with the yumminess of the ice-cream. A wonderful combination that spells HAPPY. <br><br>Latte ($4.50)<br>As if the gelato wasn&#39;t good enough, it helped that they had really good coffee too. Coffee was rich, not overly acidic and a joy to have with the gelato. <br><br>Butterscotch Steamer ($4.00) <br>A little piece of heaven discovered by the wife. A little sweet for me but if you love Butterscotch you will definitely love this. <br>The drink is one of those that, with each sip, you imagine yourself in a nice wooden cottage in winter, sitting by the fire and sipping a cup of butterscotch milk with a loved one, feeling that warm fuzzy feeling inside. <br><br>This has to be the nicest ice cream / artisanal gelato places we&#39;ve had in a very long time. <br>Like their website says, their job is to make people happy and make people happy the do! <br><br>Do note that their flavours are seasonal and they will constantly change and update what&#39;s available. <br>We&#39;re waiting for the Carrot cake flavour to return!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/NDofzQsiCZvlTcalgUlTpQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/butterknife-folk-singapore?reviewid=reFlq7eHppMedbKrWxTprw&select=NDofzQsiCZvlTcalgUlTpQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Butterknife Folk - Singapore, Singapore. their cakes are so pretty!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'their cakes are so pretty!'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/F88cBiD20E0NRL7ecY4yzg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/butterknife-folk-singapore?reviewid=reFlq7eHppMedbKrWxTprw&select=F88cBiD20E0NRL7ecY4yzg', 'altText': 'Photo of Butterknife Folk - Singapore, Singapore. strawberry basil gelato', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'strawberry basil gelato'}]
text: after a long walk at Fort Canning, I was desperately searching for something ice cold and refreshing. knowing nothing about this area I was ready to walk into the first place I would come across to find a place to sit and drink..but everything I saw were massage and beauty spas...but as I walked up a little bit more, I saw a chalkboard sign that said GELATO INSIDE!  Bingo!!! in i went....<br><br>first thing I noticed...air conditioning :) then a lovely display of cakes..then..8 different flavours of gelato...i wasn&#39;t sure if this would quench my thirst..but as I was debating an attendant asked if I would like anything..so I asked for a taste of the strawberry basil. it was perfect. tart and sweet and most importantly refreshing. so I went for a single scoop in a cone. 5 bucks, and it was a good serving. as I paid she informed me there were seats in the back and water. so I found my way to a stool...plopped on the chair and enjoyed my ice cream. <br><br>they seemed to be setting up new furniture and putting the last minute touches on things.  decor was fun and clean. and as I mentioned the desserts looked amazing. will be stopping by again to taste them. a great new random find!

It&#39;s not all about the aesthetics: lacking in logo, but not in caffeine!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "It's not all about the aesthetics: lacking in logo, but not in caffeine!"}]
text: Took advantage of their 1-for-1 frappe promotion which I must say, is EXTREMELY worth it! The vanilla and hazelnut frappuchinos go down easily without leaving the sticky, syrupy coagulation at the back of one&#39;s throat which always appears when downing a frappe from Starbucks. Not overly sweet and makes a perfect dessert which simultaneously quenches one&#39;s thirst from non-stop shopping! <br><br>The only downside is that the caffeine made my chest feel all funny (I guess this attests to the aunthenticity of Vietnamese coffee?) and gave me the shits. But I chalk that up to my own intolerance. A+ for taste and ambience!

text: The beef pho here is meh. The soup broth taste more like spices than beef broth. Would not recommend this place.<br><br>Service - normal (self service)<br>Environment - clean and convenient (located within international plaza)<br>Food - eatable, taste not so good

text: Pricey coffee gourmet coffee shop located in the Marina Bay Sands Mall.  Service is ok since only 1 person was working when I stopped in.  I tried the Creation with the four different coffee beans.  It was pretty unique as the flavor changed as I was drinking it.  Never had coffee like it before.  The presentation took me a minute to understand as I usually get my coffee in a cup, not the apparatus and coffee beans on top of the cup.  They do offer snacks and there some seating so it is a nice place to rest and relax before exploring the complex and surrounding area.
Sommer rolls out of the microwave and not tasty at all. I didn&#39;t really like the coffee as well. $6,50 was a little bit too expensive.

text: Ripoff for a cup of green tea, it costs 5$ and it is not even the real thing its Lipton tea bag!

Egg Ben', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Egg Ben'}]
text: Coffee bean&#39;s all day breakfast menu Is one of the best breakfast I could wake up to!<br><br>Today, I woke up to their egg Ben and English breakfast. The egg Ben is warm and fresh! The bread is soft and crispy, eggs and cheese perfectly placed on the bread! Super tasty and just perfect for me as it is not too heavy or light for a breakfast!<br><br>Will definitely come back for more!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/dN-IzRK6CDIesL19I6od-w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coffee-bean-and-tea-leaf-singapore-24?reviewid=1ZaLUdev2I86NhOYoIKupw&select=dN-IzRK6CDIesL19I6od-w', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aRtqXUzH-OfjFwWBxevkZQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coffee-bean-and-tea-leaf-singapore-24?reviewid=1ZaLUdev2I86NhOYoIKupw&select=aRtqXUzH-OfjFwWBxevkZQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Good cold brew and &#34;nitro cold brew&#34; coffee, really good wifi and decent decor. What more can you ask for from a coffee shop?
The matcha green tea latte is made from a powder, but I appreciate that they don&#39;t charge extra for soy milk! $6 for a small and $6.50 for a regular. Wifi available.

Such is the beauty of globalization that you get the same brands everywhere you go. Looking for a cool drink off java, we ended up here when walking around Holland Village.<br>Place was quite busy with a mix of local and &#34;expat&#34; crowd. All the same drinks are available as in the home country. <br>I had the ice coffee, but unfortunately the espresso shot was too bitter for my liking - probably must be sitting there a tad bit too long.<br>My wife ordered a cold tea drink that was made well.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=6YUB481VjkkWDkP3XLy-XA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FhgYxpdcaNOGklxNnr27tw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FhgYxpdcaNOGklxNnr27tw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FhgYxpdcaNOGklxNnr27tw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FhgYxpdcaNOGklxNnr27tw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FhgYxpdcaNOGklxNnr27tw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FhgYxpdcaNOGklxNnr27tw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Kevin W.', 'displayLocation': 'San Ramon, CA', 'altText': 'Kevin W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=6YUB481VjkkWDkP3XLy-XA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 224, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 6, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Had the breakfast platter and everything was pretty good. Nothing too special but a solid dish nonetheless. Eggs were too well done but they weren&#39;t bad. The iced Swedish berry tea was also refreshing.

Had the portobello mushroom salad, a macadamia nuts cookie and an iced cafe latte. The mushrooms were really huge and juicy. Its really different from portobello that I had at many other cafes which is usually dry. The salad dressing was a little gooey but it tasted fine. The cookie was bad - hard, dry and pretty tasteless.

text: This was a great Coffee Bean- it was a nice treat while running around in the Singapore heat. Staff was nice, the coffee was good (love the ice they use!), but for a popular place, there wasn&#39;t enough seating. We would come here again!

text: Coffee Bean in Holland Village is a great place to chill. They recently went through a renovation to brighten up the whole place and also changed their menu. They have more of a restaurant menu now, complete with pasta, fish, salads, sandwiches, all day breakfast and desserts. <br><br>Along with the usual Coffee Bean beverages, you can have a meal to go along. I usually get one of their breakfast sets, which comes with a coffee or tea and its pretty worth it. Try their eggs benedict which is decent enough and comes with a side salad. Cakes are hit and miss here, I would stay stick to the cheescakes. <br><br>Sit outdoors and people watch and also feel free to bring your laptop as they have free wifi.

Whatever you do, do not confuse The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf in Singapore with the coffee shops of the same franchise you may have grown to love in California. The only similarity is the logo. All coffee I&#39;ve had from both this location as many others around the city and in airports I&#39;ve been trapped in has been so awful I&#39;ve usually just dumped it out.

text: If i could give this place 0 i would.  Horrible service, rude workers and average drinks. There are plenty of better milk tea places nearby. The young guy messed up both occasions we went and was rude. the one girl who helped us asked for us to give exact change but when we didnt have it, rolled her eyes and was annoyed she had to use a calculator to figure out was $10-$6.40 was.  Another occasion we walked by and no one was there although they were supposed to be open. Doors were unlocked, just no one there.

Dude, so good. White pearl + Aju jelly in green tea. OMG.<br>Seriously the best drink I ever had. I tried to get the same thing in the Philippines, but first, they didn&#39;t have white pearl... it just wasn&#39;t the same. WOULD COME BACK A+++++++++++++

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0E2I2yYO7QqJlVdfVFz4Qg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/arabica-singapore-4?reviewid=KvguxoigkgmII5pGmL2Ovg&select=0E2I2yYO7QqJlVdfVFz4Qg', 'altText': 'Photo of % Arabica - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Aom0kPis86-RvbuWUERaFg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/arabica-singapore-4?reviewid=KvguxoigkgmII5pGmL2Ovg&select=Aom0kPis86-RvbuWUERaFg', 'altText': 'Photo of % Arabica - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4QImwOhIe1K7PCxukxmeXQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/arabica-singapore-4?reviewid=KvguxoigkgmII5pGmL2Ovg&select=4QImwOhIe1K7PCxukxmeXQ', 'altText': 'Photo of % Arabica - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/6kThy7DLe0mYaYBpnScbYA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/arabica-singapore-4?reviewid=KvguxoigkgmII5pGmL2Ovg&select=6kThy7DLe0mYaYBpnScbYA', 'altText': 'Photo of % Arabica - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: % Arabica is taking world domination very seriously. Or at least in Singapore. Since it&#39;s debut in June 2019 last year with its first outlet in Kampong Glam, the famous HK coffee chain has branched out to Orchard Central (2nd branch) and just last week - Chip Bee Gardens in Holland Village, it&#39;s 3rd branch. All within 6 months. WOW! <br><br>Arabica coffee originates from HK but later made famous in Kyoto after the owner partners with a world champion barista. So now, everyone flocks to its Kyoto branch just to see this guy pull his shot and be mesmerized by his latte art. But then again, Arabica coffee has a huge following worldwide, people actually travel the world to drink their coffee and to pose with the famous &#34;%&#34; logo. Ok, we&#39;re done with history lesson!  <br><br>Now back to this branch in Chip Bee Gardens. The coffee shop is located along the stretch of restaurants behind the main road, next to Baker &amp; Cook.  As you walk inside, you&#39;ll be greeted with a huge, all WHITE minimalist counter for you to place your order. For you coffee elitists, sorry to inform you that they don&#39;t do pour-overs, only the usual latte, mocha, and even matcha latte. But hey, coffee&#39;s good despite the high price tag. There&#39;s also a limited choice of pastries if you fancy a bite to go with your coffee. But i would say, stick to your new year&#39;s resolution, stay away from gluten and cut down on carbs. <br><br>It will be interesting to see how they survive in the next coming months as there are many coffee options around the neighborhood. But knowing Singapore, a society driven by commercial brands, Arabica would definitely survive in the Hunger Games of Coffee. <br><br>I am torn in between a 3 and a 4-star review. Arabica totally deserves more than 3 stars but might be too early for a 4. According to Yelp guidelines, 4 stars mean &#34;Yay, I&#39;m a fan&#34; and yes, I am so ill leave it as it is!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MbP-Ciu6k-qqoYHUYMKv-w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/arabica-singapore-4?reviewid=uMJ63EDTOwLi7wk_uhXoyA&select=MbP-Ciu6k-qqoYHUYMKv-w', 'altText': 'Photo of % Arabica - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-hx-wsuljjzIG8_v_X1oDQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/arabica-singapore-4?reviewid=uMJ63EDTOwLi7wk_uhXoyA&select=-hx-wsuljjzIG8_v_X1oDQ', 'altText': 'Photo of % Arabica - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: It is super loud inside. The coffee preparation process is the noisiest ever. The staff keep hitting the coffee hopper - it&#39;s like they&#39;re taking out their frustrations on it. Luckily, in the outdoor seating area there are fans &amp; the area is shaded from trees so it&#39;s OK to sit there. <br><br>They use sugarcane straws which are of awful quality. I took one out and it had already broken. The second broke after a short while too so I just drank directly from the cup.<br><br>Had a sparkling lemonade. It was ok, though really an Italian soda  so I had to stir. It wasn&#39;t cheap but that&#39;s normal for cafe prices.

Shop front', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Shop front'}]
text: This was an unexpected treat after trekking around the shopping areas all day we had seen this place as a contender for a well deserved sugar fix to make it home.<br><br>At first glance the location is the same as any other lobby cafe, however the sheer variety of goods on offer was awe inspiring; and after the painful decision of what to try was the thrill that the cakes were not as sugary as you might imagine.<br><br>Considering how busy this place was the staff did a great job of keeping the traffic flowing and people happy.<br><br>Even better the coffee was top notch, served neither too hot or cold, nor bitter; all ip a great reprieve from shopping - the coffee eclair was especially delightful.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=zaKqXprDkpdHY1Xu4_wmCg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/iQoztw6na6lZ_47hkwyShw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/iQoztw6na6lZ_47hkwyShw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/iQoztw6na6lZ_47hkwyShw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/iQoztw6na6lZ_47hkwyShw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/iQoztw6na6lZ_47hkwyShw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/iQoztw6na6lZ_47hkwyShw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Alan S.', 'displayLocation': 'Brixton, London, United Kingdom', 'altText': 'Alan S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=zaKqXprDkpdHY1Xu4_wmCg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 6, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This place is great. Anything you want through from ham and cheese crossaints to eggs Benedict. This place has it all. I really recommend. Fast serving time, delicious food, the only thing it could improve upon to get all 5 stars, is the coffee. Apart from that, all great.

Firstly, I must say that their latte was absolutely amazing. I loved it loved it loved it! Their popular lemon tart was not bad but not exactly a must try. Having said that, I really want to try the rest of their pastries. They look good!<br>The service was very good too. Even though we walked in as they were just about to close, the staff took their time to tell us about their pastries and were apologetic about not being able to heat up our pastry. Knowledgeable, friendly and responsive staff! I hope they keep it up.<br>Five stars because their latte was just sooooooo good!!!
In addition the the baked good, which are excellent, the grilled chicken breast is also outstanding. Easily better than Poulet across the hall and probably also cheaper.

text: Very nice ambience . Suitable for family and children as there&#39;s a place where children can run around . <br>Had Cajun grilled cheese sandwich . It was nice , crunch on the outside , soft n fluffy inside , well marinated chicken. Not greasy at all . <br>Ice mocha just nice , not too sweet . <br>A very pleasant experience indeed .

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/A4OltgYP1HwMWIwUgaCWAw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-fabulous-baker-boy-singapore?reviewid=C5eWJwZZD7IG_PDykw89uw&select=A4OltgYP1HwMWIwUgaCWAw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Fabulous Baker Boy - Singapore, Singapore. Pancakes', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pancakes'}]
text: I went here on Easter Sunday with a couple friends and enjoyed the food and atmosphere quite a bit. It&#39;s set in a park, so it was exactly the kind of place that you&#39;d want to go for a cute brunch. We got pancakes (I got the plain and my friends got chocolate chip) and they were delicious and fluffy. I got scrambled eggs on the side and felt that they could have had a bit more flavor (nothing a little extra salt can&#39;t fix), but my friend got eggs Benedict and really liked those. I would recommend going here because it was a really cute place and wasn&#39;t too expensive, with pretty good food for both breakfast and lunch.

text: Unimpressed. <br>A great place to eat if you get hungry walking around Fort Canning but a less than charming vibe, employees that look miserable and a incessant electronic voice that speaks every time the door is opened, welcoming you to the place which I found tedious. <br><br>Definitely not what we were looking for for brunch.

text: Nice little restaurant with an extensive cake selection where you can eat yourself silly. The red velvet cake is very popular. Only downside is accessibility. For those who drive, you will have to park opposite at Liang Court mall &amp; take the overhead bridge on the 2nd floor of Liang Court. It&#39;s about a 200m uncovered walk from the bridge to the cafe so it&#39;s a bit of a hassle especially when it rains. <br><br>Staff are friendly. Space can get a bit crowded during busy periods as the tables are quite close to each other. There is a nice selection of mains to suit most taste buds.

Valrhona chocolate cake ($9.01 on Honestbee) - 4.5 stars<br>Good cake! They&#39;re right it&#39;s best served at room temperature.<br><br>Fish and chips - 3 stars<br>Too salty! But I ate this a couple hours after so maybe it would&#39;ve tasted less salty had I eaten it fresh...?<br><br>I got this via Honestbee delivery (<a href="/redir?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhonestbee.sg%2Fr%2FNICOLAL5385&amp;s=9013f56e2ccf3ef9523ffd6d674ec16c6f8a345340bb9a2c884919f7f2345fc1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">honestbee.sg/r/NICOLAL53…</a> for $10 off) and have to go down to the store to try their other cakes and food!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/lf3EPJElregOuLyH7cjx4A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-fabulous-baker-boy-singapore?reviewid=nWsasWdMYqM-qtluwdhNYw&select=lf3EPJElregOuLyH7cjx4A', 'altText': 'Photo of The Fabulous Baker Boy - Singapore, Singapore. Spicy chicken and waffles with coleslaw', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Spicy chicken and waffles with coleslaw'}]
text: Interesting location near fort canning park opposite from Liang court. It&#39;s in a busy location, but is slightly in the park, which makes it quite peaceful. <br><br>I ordered the spicy fried chicken and waffles. They told me it would take 15 minutes...its been more like 25. I had to personally ask the waitress to take my order...that was a bit ridiculous. Also, they had the audacity to give me the bill at a sit down restaurant before I even got my food. <br><br>However, the food was very delicious! The chicken was freshly fried and seasoned perfectly with the spicy buffalo sauce. The waffle was crispy yet soft the way I like it. The waffle was very tasty and airy. This dish was 5 stars! <br><br>Overall, I would have given 5 stars if the service was much better. I will be going again because I want to try some other dishes.

Stumbled across this amazing little restaurant while searching for a breakfast joint! I had the French toast with a glass of fresh orange juice and it was so delicious. French toast tasted more like little sugary donuts but it was incredibly scrumptious! Highly recommend if you&#39;re in Singapore!

The FBB champion breakfast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'The FBB champion breakfast'}]
text: So I came here for brunch recently and I was feeling a bit conflicted when writing the review.  I cant say I LOVED the TFBB champion breakfast that I ordered.  It was well made but just didnt seem as inventive as other things on the menu. Its my own fault and i probably had a mini seizure while ordering.  I saw the tuna melt at the table next to us and it looked GOOD.  <br><br>I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The owner seemed really nice and friendly.  The service was good. The coffee was very good.  The location as nice but a little hidden. I honestly had never noticed it before.  I really like places that have an interesting menu.  The items seem fun.  I enjoyed it but felt like I had been nominated for an award but didnt actually win it.  I think I need to go back for dinner. The chili crab mac and cheese and the tuna melt are something I&#39;m super curious to try.  I will need to try it again.

text: 3.5 <br>I would give them a 4 but they legit pissed me off.  I ordered a slice of the Beyonce Lemonade cake (yeah I did). It came with a pretty peach buttercream rose on top, I finished half of it and asked them to box it up.  It was delicious. I have had better.  The lemon filling they use was on point but the cake left something to be desired. I think they use a butter cake recipe that lacks complexity (aka well balanced flavor). Anyways, I was planning on having it for breakfast with my morning coffee.  I like to start my day off by looking at something pretty and there was a very pretty buttercream rose on top of my slice when I handed it to them to box it up.  In the morning... I open up my little box and the rose was gone!!!! They took it off my slice before boxing it up!! <br><br>WHY?!?! WHY WOULD THEY DO THAT?!?!?!<br>They literally ruined my morning.

Blueberry Lemon Cake', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Blueberry Lemon Cake'}]
text: First, I gotta start by apologizing to the Chef and Owner, Ju! I love you, Sweets and I&#39;m sorry it took me so long to finally come and sit down for a proper dinner. <br><br>Beyond all the great reviews that everyone has been ranting about, I really enjoy the atmosphere and warm hospitality by everyone. The food served are rich and supple, servings are very generous, just as Ju says &#34;My servings are very generous, just like me!&#34; ;)<br><br>I had the Ju&#39;s Prawn Pappardelle, while my friends has the Spiced Beef Burger and the Prawn Burger. The Burgers were served with Garlic fries, a great complement to lift the tastes of the burgers further. I cant comment on the burgers cos I havent tasted them, but for someone who doesnt usually have creamy pasta, the Prawn pappardelle was awesome. Rich but not overpowering, Ju managed to ensure that the pasta was still kept Al Dente even when it&#39;s soaked in the creamy prawn sauce.<br><br>For desserts, we had the Blueberry Lemon Cake and the Lemon Meringue Pie. The cakes here are big. The textures feel more like pound cakes rather than sponge cakes cos every mouth of cake is full and supple. Love the blueberry jam in between the layers of lemon cake as they complement each other perfectly with the sweetness of the blueberry jam and light lemon flavour. The lemon meringue pie had a really good balance of the sour lemon curd and the light meringue. The tart was buttery and give a good bite to the creamy tart.<br><br>With all the good food, the only downer is the size of the table. I wished they were slightly bigger to contain all the awesome-ness on the table. :P<br><br>For those who of you who has yet to try, head down soon! For those who love this place, good news is, they are going to undergo a little reno in Feb 14 and reopen with a even more hearty menu. Cant Wait!

Tuna melt!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Tuna melt!'}]
text: Would be 4-1/2 stars if we could! Stopped in for brunch after church. My husband had the pancakes, which he declared the best, most Western pancakes he&#39;s had since arriving in Singapore. Food was served piping hot, which means the dishes arrive singly. My oldest son had the Croque Monsieur, which was beautifully played and delicious. My youngest son had a BBQ beef grilled cheese, which he said he would definitely order again. I had the tuna melt, which was divine, but I only ate half of it to save room for dessert--which you must do! Amazing cakes... The attached picture doesn&#39;t include the refrigerated offerings! We&#39;ll definitely be back!

text: Nice place to hang out with friends and savor some unique cakes.<br><br>Finally got to visit this cafe after passing by it countless of times. <br><br>Visited on a Saturday afternoon, the cafe was crowded. Thankfully there was an empty table that could sit 6 of us. <br><br>They have a good selection of cakes available. We ordered the Earl Grey Cake, Lime pie and another cake which I can&#39;t quite recall the name. <br><br>The earl grey cake color was super appealing, somewhat a shade of purple but not quite. It&#39;s really pretty. An unconventional taste that isn&#39;t too sweet. Would recommend this - not that it&#39;s super tasty but more so for its unique taste. <br><br>The lime pie was really good! You could tell the love for this pie by the speed it disappeared from the plate. Just perhaps a tad too sweet for my taste bud, still a absolutely must have.<br><br>can&#39;t recall the last cake we had, it&#39;s good too. Given its name, the cakes meets our expectation. <br><br>A great place to hang with friends and hide from the blazing heat. <br><br>Limited parking at the park. Try parking across the street at Liang Court and use the 2nd floor overhead bridge to get to this cafe.

I think I've eaten almost everything else."}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/C1dN21CBKE9HuRx9fXQPwQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-fabulous-baker-boy-singapore?reviewid=4KgbyhxlZHrJTG9RT-lnWg&select=C1dN21CBKE9HuRx9fXQPwQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Fabulous Baker Boy - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I can tell I&#39;m going to love this spot.<br><br>First, it sits on some historical real estate - boss Juwanda says the building used to be the cafeteria of sorts for the old River Valley swimming pool (how fitting!), that has since been filled up and is now his front lawn. Better yet, his kitchen occupies the former men&#39;s changing room! Boss promises only fully clothed occupants now though.<br><br>Yes, the shop&#39;s called The Fabulous Baker Boy, but he does so much more. There&#39;s a  healthy menu that is being re-jigged to include some pretty yum Big Boy Tacos, which he did make for me and the Girlfriend today as an early preview treat! Look out for the guacomole - it&#39;s got a little something extra in it that makes it even more yum.<br><br>Also, look out for the prawn fettucine - I&#39;ve heard rave/ravenous/raving oh never mind. I&#39;ve heard great things about it, and it&#39;s set to be offered for both lunch and dinner services very soon.<br><br>Then we come to the cakes. Why hello there, my pretty... okay enough with the creepy tapping fingers, but the scheming minds are very much needed here, because you&#39;ll need to plan wisely to maximise how much cake you can get in your belly. There are just SO MANY OPTIONS. Always ask for suggestions - that way I found out that the Nutty Monkey (banana cake in peanut butter frosting and coconut flakes in between) had just come back on to the list! On suggestion, we&#39;d also picked up a slice of lemon and raspberry cake, which was a great choice to help cut through the &#34;jelat&#34;-ness/heaviness of the Nutty Monkey.<br><br>They&#39;ve got a variety of bevs for you to sit tai-tai style and watch the world go by - coffee, a homemade iced tea, and beer and wine too, if you&#39;d like.<br><br>Also try: everything else. But maybe on your next visit. Or maybe you&#39;ll be greedy enough to take some home with you.<br><br>Oh yes, and free (but small) car park too! Rejoice!

text: Place was a little out of sight but nicely situated. We were seated right away, granted we came in for a late brunch. Ordered the Chicken &amp; Waffle, Wild Mushroom Salad, Garlic Fries, and Grilled Cheese Sandwich. Overall they also tasted pretty good with good presentation. Interesting selection of cakes, unfortunately we ordered too much &amp; had no more space for dessert. But would have loved to try em for next time.

text: ate brunch too fast; no space for cake.<br><br>chilli crab mac &amp; cheese: good, but because of its size, gets progressively poorer the more you eat of it. it&#39;s a one note dish and you&#39;ll eat until you feel super jelak. they could halve the portion and offer it as a side. or you could just.. share. it.<br><br>prawn pasta: surprisingly good.<br><br>chocolate chip pancakes: also a surprise hit.<br><br>overeating was a bad mistake; because we had to haul ass back over the overhead bridge to the liang court parking lots.

TFBB menu!', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'TFBB menu!'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/iXQ6k1bA3QSXdcozz8YDLA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-fabulous-baker-boy-singapore?reviewid=ZmGLsnFZ3voqo8S_vxK4bA&select=iXQ6k1bA3QSXdcozz8YDLA', 'altText': 'Photo of The Fabulous Baker Boy - Singapore, Singapore. croque monsieur... sorry if the spelling is wrong', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'croque monsieur... sorry if the spelling is wrong'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/wv3_kVp-fVbGT-CuXVa9DA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-fabulous-baker-boy-singapore?reviewid=ZmGLsnFZ3voqo8S_vxK4bA&select=wv3_kVp-fVbGT-CuXVa9DA', 'altText': 'Photo of The Fabulous Baker Boy - Singapore, Singapore. my bff&#39;s crispy pancakes! bravo!', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': "my bff's crispy pancakes! bravo!"}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/JsEB3s6HugcREusR1k_Seg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-fabulous-baker-boy-singapore?reviewid=ZmGLsnFZ3voqo8S_vxK4bA&select=JsEB3s6HugcREusR1k_Seg', 'altText': 'Photo of The Fabulous Baker Boy - Singapore, Singapore. blueberry yoghurt and raspberry cake', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'blueberry yoghurt and raspberry cake'}]
text: this is one of the rare finds in singapore. you are immediately greeted upon arrival at TFBB with a warm smile and a quick check of the reservations list (note: do reserve on weekends. they are obviously fab). I was seated in a comfy corner and menu and order list are all there. <br><br>the menu... simple and easy to understand. well designed and obviously fab. i wanted to approach the counter to order but was immediately attended to promptly and my bff&#39;s crispy requirement to her pancakes addressed. i was escorted to the cake/pies/desserts from heaven section (maybe I have that i-need-dessert-now face). all the specials were introduced in detail and I felt at home. like how you will introduce your prized collection to your guest.<br><br>our orders of extra crispy pancakes and croque monsieur was well done and served properly. granted they kinda forgot my extra cup of latte ordered but overall they were attentive to detail. me and my friend left the table to decide on the cakes we wanted and when we returned to the table, voila! our water was refilled and my friend&#39;s tea was topped up with more hot water! this was without us asking! i am impressed!<br><br>While they have a policy on weekends that the turnover per table is 1.5 hours from reservation, we were not rushed out of TFBB. However, I can see why they need the tables. everyone wants a taste and feel of home on a saturday!<br><br>the dessert was well done. i had the blueberry yoghurt cake while my friend had the raspberry cake. very well done and not too sweet. goes well with a cup of coffee. one gripe is that their latte art needs a bit more work (not consistent and a little sloppy).<br><br>Overall, this is not just another restaurant checked off the list. a very impressive service staff that makes you keep coming back because you feel welcomed and at home. of course the dessert junkie in me is prepping for the next visit to try ALL their cakes. <br><br>TFBB, you live up to your name. continue to always serve fabulous food in a fabulous fashion. you have won me over with ur extensive range of cakes and sweets but most importantly, your hospitality. thank you for starting my saturday right.

&#34;If it aint broke, don&#39;t fix it. Don&#39;t reinvent the wheel.&#34; Those were the thoughts that ran through my head as i sat through the preview of The Fabulous Baker Boy&#39;s new dinner menu. If only Juwanda were to stick to his brunch fare and cakes, I&#39;m pretty sure people would love to have that for dinner as well.<br><br>Let&#39;s start with my favorite part of the meal- the cakes. TFBB is known for their cakes and while there were hits and misses (Green Tea Praline was too dry, Red Velvet a tad sweet), the latest addition, the Pam D&#39;OR stole the limelight. This cake was created in honor of Juwanda&#39;s muse, actress Pamela Oei, a dear friend of his. <br><br>What&#39;s better than sticky date pudding? A sticky date cake sandwiched with layers of butterscotch and cream cheese. Oh brown sugar, latte butter cream, and Valrhona chocolate. This cake wouldn&#39;t always be available in store but i think it should be made a staple. A 3kg 9&#34; cake will set you back by $105 and each slice is $10. Love this one!<br><br>Back to the dinner menu, skip the salads and starters as they are quite blah. The Almond Encrusted Salmon with a mango hollandaise ($22) had several decent elements, such as the fragrant fat-free mango hollandaise sauce that had just a hint of sweetness. The salmon was a little overcooked but still palatable and would certainly do well with more sauce. The contrasting textures could be enhanced with a creamier spinach rather than one that looked like it came through the cold pressed machine but the flavor of the veg was on point.<br><br>I thought the Duck Confit ($21) was regular and by regular i do mean that it&#39;s not too bad. One of the more flavorful dishes of the night and the plus points were that it was fork tender and not too dry. I liked the cranberry plum compote that accompanied the duck.<br><br>Steak Frites ($25) 230g NZ grass fed sirloin, grilled on the griddle, dressed with mushrooms and caramelised onions and the horrible fries. No comments on this one as it was forgettable. The fries were just horrid i can&#39;t even begin to describe them (gosh the oil).<br><br>Serious room for improvement in the Fish Burger ($14.50). The components that i liked about this dish don&#39;t maketh a burger- the tangy Siracha tartar sauce, hint of curry leaves in the batter and the buttery billowing brioche. The batter needs to be WAAAY thinner and the fish needs more flavor on its own. Comes with the same horrible fries. <br><br>The bastardized Fried Chicken &amp;amp; Waffles ($21) which was served with a half chicken. The horrors!!! Always chicken fillet. ONLY chicken fillet. I didn&#39;t like this dish due to the super hard and dense waffle and the overdose of syrup on this one (it was already drenched when served). TFBB definitely needs to work this one out man. That said, the meat was sufficiently moist though the buttermilk flavor could be enhanced.<br><br>Well well, that&#39;s my honest take on TFBB&#39;s dinner menu. Honestly i&#39;m pretty certain customers would be happy with an all day brunch menu here with some heartier options. I do hope they work things the kinks out for dinner. In the meantime, be glad that you can now enjoy a slice (or two) with the extended opening hours at TFBB!

text: gorgeous space, beautiful-looking food - but a complete disappointment in the tasting.<br><br>the fabulous baker boy ain&#39;t so fabulous, really. it was disappointing in the most, but too mediocre to wreck/ rack my brains for any semblance of a rant.<br><br>let&#39;s start with the good - the little compound it&#39;s housed in makes for a beautifully relaxing hangout: an open porch, the allure of a historic-type building standing lone in a patch of green overlooking the colorful buildings of clarke quay.<br><br>but the dishes are pretty humdrum. my salad with pumpkin was a sparse mound of leaves topped with bland pumpkin (caramelization of any sort would have really helped here) and served with a vinaigrette that seemed right out a bottle (luckily I got it on the side); a shepherd&#39;s pie was full of potato and a barely-there layer of cheese, and you had to dig deep to get at the bit of gravied meat; while the eggs florentine came with a strange saute of minced spinach and garlic spread beneath (depriving you of any freshness that would come from the greens).<br><br>the biggest let-down of the meal though, were the cakes. I expect a fairly high standard if you describe yourself as fabulous, and those expectations were certainly bumped out by the display of more than ten cakes. all tall, all colorful, and as easily orderable as they are pinterest-able.<br><br>but the flavors? non-existing. the only thing you could taste was the dry sponge that seemed to make a showing in both our slices, a stale sort of crumbly butter cake. the icing was essentially colored-but-barely-flavored buttercream<br><br>we took a mouthful each, and stopped after the first bite.<br><br>so the meal is marked for me by our leftover slices of cake - which almost never happens. most slices of cake still turn out pretty much edible: it&#39;s just butter, sugar and sweet stuff, no? but these were so bad we couldn&#39;t ourselves to eat anymore - which is when we headed to the lovely drury lane for a brunch part two.<br><br>I would steer clear. even their coffee choices are small and apparently tastes just as mediocre - so not even worth a suggestion for a sit-down for a cuppa. wholly disappointing - and I&#39;m not sure I&#39;ve had my brunch plans so thwarted in a long time.
