text: We have been meaning to check this place out for a while and finally did.  i love the fact that they have happy hour house pours of wine for 9 bucks.  the menu is very wide ranging.  we tried the chicken wings which were pretty good, but no dipping sauce.  the chicken kebabs were decent, but i found them dry.  the Hawaiian pizza was nothing special but still good and i loved the spaghetti bolognese with angel hair pasta.  for some easy and quick food this is pretty good and they don&#39;t charge service or GST.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=AbfS_oXF8H6HJb5jFqhrLw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Paco G.', 'displayLocation': 'México, D.F., Mexico', 'altText': 'Paco G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=AbfS_oXF8H6HJb5jFqhrLw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 44, 'photoCount': 22, 'reviewCount': 55, 'eliteYear': None}
photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/KLoRNzmRN69bnTFmXWAV1A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/eat-me-singapore-2?reviewid=sWRoqM2NZNlaKnIOTzfVMg&select=KLoRNzmRN69bnTFmXWAV1A', 'altText': 'Photo of Eat Me - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: This is the newest place in UE Square, replacing an ill-fated kopitiam that had no charm at all. Eat Me immediately strikes as a simple salad bar or vegetarian restaurant, mainly because of their tagline &#34;Lettuce satisfy you&#34; (pun fully intended, I think). Fortunately, it&#39;s more than that.<br><br>While vegetarian and vegan restaurants resort to preaching about how unhealthy, foolish and downright evil it is to eat any kind of animal product, Eat Me focuses on taste, freshness and balance. They don&#39;t eradicate meat or animal protein from their menu. Instead, they use it in sensible portions, as a complement to fresh veggies, just as your nutritionist surely told you to do. Another good thing is they emphasise the use of local and organic products. Vegetables are always fresh, and if combined with a bit of egg, duck, fish or beef, there&#39;s no way they can go wrong.<br><br>Eat Me&#39;s salads are delightful, and so are their very own cold-pressed juices. The make-your-own baked potatoes look tasty, but I have to try them yet. The star for me (and for many other customers, it seems)  is the Hulk Toast: a flavourful omelette served over a thick slice of wholegrain bread with heavenly avocado, cherry tomatoes and sesame seeds. I&#39;m not a big fan of omelettes myself, but this is fantastically well done. It has become my favourite local breakfast. Coffee is provided by the famous Sarnies. It&#39;s not the best, but it&#39;s certainly superior than what can be found at UE Square.<br><br>Among the overpriced bars, franchise coffee shops and fancy places around UE Square, Eat Me shines for their healthy, honest, unpretentious and appetising food. It is truly refreshing to have a local restaurant that serves healthy food that sells itself on taste, with no need for preaching. I&#39;m a big fan already.<br><br>Curious fact: they managed to get rid of the burnt fat smell that loomed in the kopitiam that was there before. That alone is a reason to admire them.

Although close to Robertson Quay and it&#39;s abundance of restaurants, UE Square has been pretty much a barren wasteland.  So when I heard about this new restaurant with the interesting name I thought I&#39;d try it.<br>Ostensibly it&#39;s a salad place.  Which sounded good to me.  The problem was in the execution of, well, pretty much everything.  It took about fifteen minutes to get our drinks served, and another 15 to get our salads.  This despite the fact that there were only a few diners there.   The salads consisted of wilted lettuce that looked like it had gone bad a few days ago.  Veggies that were either past their peak or poorly chosen.   And flavorlessly cooked beef and chicken.   It seems the owners put too much effort into being hip hipster hippies and not enough into learning how to choose ingredients and cook them properly.<br>To sum it up: Bad, slow service.  Terrible food.   <br><br>With so many great places to eat nearby, coming here is a foolhardy mistake.<br>Cross it off your list.  This is one place that needs to be economically Darwined out of existence.

Menu of breakfast items', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Menu of breakfast items'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/v1_ridaGhgr8B1a-gY037A/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/eat-me-singapore-2?reviewid=bZnn8T5hsJvi_61sS7xVDg&select=v1_ridaGhgr8B1a-gY037A', 'altText': 'Photo of Eat Me - Singapore, Singapore. Just one of the awesome salads served at Eat Me. This one is called  &#34;Big Miss Steak&#34;', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Just one of the awesome salads served at Eat Me. This one is called  "Big Miss Steak"'}]
text: Location is amazing for this place. If you live in Robertson Quay /River Valle area, no doubt you have been clamoring for a nice place to get some good clean healthy food. Salads that make you think, hmm I guess salads are not bad after all. You may have been going home after working in the CBD area and thinking to yourself, &#34;What I would do for a place similar to Grain Traders, or just something else other than the bar food that surrounds the area....well wait no longer true believer because &#34;Eat Me&#34; is here to save us all. The cafe is conveniently located in UE square, in the area where the Kopitiam used to be, and boy am I glad that this was the place to take the space over. Eat Me&#39;s tag line is &#34;Lettuce satisfy you&#34; (hehe) and the they do not disappoint. Once you stop giggling at some of the creative names on the menu (like &#34;Posh Spice&#34; and &#34;Big Miss Steak&#34; and finally get your food, your palates are treated to plethora of euphoric sensations. Best of all, you finish the food and you are actually full and you also do not get dragged down or feel heavy. Perfect for after working out. <br>I&#39;ve been here twice now and have tried the Daffy Duck and Big Miss steak, I&#39;m definitely coming to try everything.<br>The place also served breakfast! I have yet to try but they look yummy.<br>Oh and they have also just started putting cold press juices on the menu. I had the &#34;coconut, green apple, spinach and cucumber&#34; juice...and yes it tastes even better than it sounds! <br>Can&#39;t wait to come back to this place!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Svo-oZ03XbHG5xAnAhnYsQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/K-QTePbdIMAivLHd2PRWoA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/K-QTePbdIMAivLHd2PRWoA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/K-QTePbdIMAivLHd2PRWoA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/K-QTePbdIMAivLHd2PRWoA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/K-QTePbdIMAivLHd2PRWoA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/K-QTePbdIMAivLHd2PRWoA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Christopher H.', 'displayLocation': 'West Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Christopher H.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Svo-oZ03XbHG5xAnAhnYsQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 47, 'photoCount': 23, 'reviewCount': 29, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This is a nice location, right by the river. It has a relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. The breakfast we had was a little expensive - $17 SGD each, but the portions are &#34;Westernized&#34; - they&#39;re a lot larger than other places.<br><br>I like the coffee - my cappuccino was good. My girlfriend really liked her Earl Grey Lavender &amp; Orange tea.<br><br>This is a nice place to hang out and relax.

text: Right along the river...walking difference from several<br>Hotels..we were at four points and found it handy..prices are pretty reasonable by Singapore standards...latte was really good...I had a bacon egg and cheese toast sandwich and it was only $6 and it was really good...wish they were open earlier for us jet lagged folks.

My standard breakfast. Simple but hits the spot...and you don&#39;t feel too heavy after', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "My standard breakfast. Simple but hits the spot...and you don't feel too heavy after"}]
text: Excited to try the place. Woke early on a Sunday morning and looking for spot nearby to &#34;break&#34; my fast. I was happy to see that this cafe opened early and served simple breakfast that I&#39;m looking for. Initial impressions are that the spot gets a lot of recurring business which is always a good sign.<br><br>I ordered a pretty standard breakfast that I would fix at home in the states. <br><br>Eggs, bacon and some wheat toast. They also had fresh juice, I had the watermelon. For lack of a better word, it was homey. Just what I was looking for. It wasn&#39;t anything extraordinary but the cafe gave me enough to want to come back and try out the specials. It looks like people were very keen on the Kith Coffee, so I need to come back and get that. I love the neighborhoody feel and the friendly service. I&#39;ll definitely come back and will be making this part of my breakfast go to places.

Breakfast', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Breakfast'}]
text: I was looking for a simple place to grab a quick bite of breakfast before I continued my exploration of Singapore, and I had walked past here the day before so I decided to check it out. I must say that it wasn&#39;t really the best place that I had visited here in Singapore, but then again you can&#39;t always expect to strike it lucky when exploring a new city. Okay, I do have to say that the staff were pretty good, but when I looked at the menu there really wasn&#39;t anything all that appealing. The place was pretty small, so all of the seats were outside, and while their coffee was okay, it wasn&#39;t the best. Mind you, the locals seem to quite like the place since there were always people gathering around here (usually mums with their strollers). However if I am ever back this way I&#39;d probably give this place a miss.

text: Nice small breakfast restaurant visited mostly by foreigners due to their western style menu. Everything just tastes very good so this is definitely a 5 star rating. And the coffee tastes how coffee is supposed to taste. Not like the watery Starbucks coffee but very good quality coffee. You sit outside in the shade. There are newspapers to read and children can play.

I feel this cafe has good food potential and was certainly recommend. Coffee is quite strong which I do enjoy. My chocolate crossaint was great and partners mango smoothly delicious. However the bacon, egg, tomato toastie I felt was a little lack luster. <br>What really let this place down was the speed of service. It took us 30mins to get the toastie and crossaint, which we needed to ask for as a reminder. <br>Also be prepared to sit outdoor or take away. As there is no indoor seating.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ZexzTC_rUSDG0ciiapZDaQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=4EoKcYssAIzXHguBWUTi-w&select=ZexzTC_rUSDG0ciiapZDaQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9huGDdrm-3Lc8Q_9V74e3w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=4EoKcYssAIzXHguBWUTi-w&select=9huGDdrm-3Lc8Q_9V74e3w', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Smoked salmon sandwich $12 and a skinny latte $4', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Smoked salmon sandwich $12 and a skinny latte $4'}]
text: Kith is definitely my favorite brunch spot at Robertson Quay. It&#39;s cozy, the coffee&#39;s good and food is great - especially for the price.<br><br>It&#39;s right down the street from where I live. So when I need some down-time to myself on the weekend, i&#39;d head down here with a good book for a cup of latte and sandwiches. If the weather is nice you can people-watch by the river while enjoying your meal too! Love!<br><br>On to the food - I usually get one of their sandwiches. It&#39;s easy no frills sandwich and cheap for what it is - they&#39;re priced at $8,$10 and $15. My favorite is the smoked salmon one for $10.<br><br>I&#39;ve had their big breakfast too and it&#39;s relatively cheap for about $15-16. It&#39;s a proper breakfast. Their mini toasties are good for if you don&#39;t feel like having any of the above but still want something to nibble on.<br><br>Coffee is excellent.<br><br>The only down side is, seating is mostly outdoors and there are no A/C, which can be downright unbearable when it&#39;s especially hot in Singapore

I stopped by here when wandering from Clarke Quay towards Robertson Quay when the hunger and heat got the better of me and I just had to stop somewhere. I saw Kith and recalled that I had been at their other location by Dhoby Ghaut and did not find it horrible so I was up for giving it a shot (and to be honest at this point I would probably even have given McDonalds a chance). Kith has a pretty relaxed setting at a corner of a house with some shade but it does not really have any seats inside so even if it is shaded it is still fairly warm.<br><br>I had some pretty decent pasta with a pretty good flat white while S went for a toastie and a freshly pressed juice. Neither of these were anything special but more what one can expect and prices are a bit higher than I would like to pay but then it is Robertson Quay after all so perhaps to be expected. I have since been a few more times and they are in a sense reliable, there has so far never been anything amazing nor anything really disappointing. It can tend to get a bit too noisy around as many families with children appear to like to come here and at least when I have been there it has been the type of people who do not feel like telling their kids to behave and take it easy so if that disturbs you it may not be the best place.

Spaghetti meatballs', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Spaghetti meatballs'}]
text: Who love Mondays? Well I do &#39;cos I&#39;m having lunch at kith&#39;s cafe. <br><br>A little Monday pick-me-up lunch of Spaghetti Meatballs and Flat White makes my Monday that much sweeter. <br><br>My first time here, I was abit disappointed that the place was a bit small (no seating inside) but managed to get a seat outside, facing the river. However, since it was a Monday, there wasn&#39;t much crowd save for the odd Caucasian couple with kids, Caucasian yuppies and a few passer-bys getting some takeaway coffee. The view was good - luckily the sky was overcast and the weather was cool; I can&#39;t imagine what it would be like if it is a hot sunny day!  <br><br>Food was ok but coffee gets my nod of approval! I drank one cup and got another one to take back to the office. <br><br>Will definitely drop by again - but not on weekends!

This is always a stop for us along our walk. Great place to see friendly and smiling people. Breakfast is our favorite time here. However, lunch is delicious as well. Great coffee, and all at reasonable prices. <br>Favorite stopping point for me on my frequent walks/jogs

Mushroom toastie', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Mushroom toastie'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/WCfZdwhzeBhVFG-jCiYUEA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=KIliMMIPfwg8PHydjqtbNA&select=WCfZdwhzeBhVFG-jCiYUEA', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/dlHmCX36jOKibMeh2rN3iw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=KIliMMIPfwg8PHydjqtbNA&select=dlHmCX36jOKibMeh2rN3iw', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: I&#39;ve been coming here for so long..sometimes you forget to highlight a place because it&#39;s always there. <br><br>What I like about Kith is that it&#39;s kinda cute and quirky, it&#39;s always sincere and honest..and that reflects in the coffee, food and service.<br><br>It operates out of a tiny space but they expand quite a bit outside. The tables and chairs are built for small people (luckily I&#39;m one) but many tall expatriates seem to squeeze in comfortably (kid in tow). <br><br>I personally think the old location was prettier inside..more seating but the new location is less food-fumey and has more shade so I think overall it&#39;s better.<br><br>The food is simple and straightforward but there are little touches of brilliance. Love their white bread in the big brek always nicely toasted and love the homely strawberry jam - it really looks like someone spent all day cooking it on the hearth.<br><br>Free wifi - always a nice bonus.<br><br>Prices for the big brek and coffee are attractive. I&#39;ve had the toastie several times for a lighter bite and it&#39;s very simple but it&#39;s served nice and hot with a tart apple salad on the side.<br><br>The coffee is not the best but it&#39;s usually a nice to good cup..at $3.80 it&#39;s worth it. If you get a cup that&#39;s over-extracted and bitter, give your feedback to the staff. I think they will hasten to replace it.

text: Given that I had low expectations for this place, I was pretty impressed with the food and service. We were a group of four and though it was just, we were seated in a matter of a few minutes. I ordered a cheese pizza and pineapple ginger juice and my husband ordered some roast beef wrap thing. Both were pretty good (not to-die-for but not bad) and the juice was quite refreshing.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=I426NDZK2FF-9gE_vVWpqw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/_kQpSHkidwHVcsqoSMiTwg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/_kQpSHkidwHVcsqoSMiTwg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/_kQpSHkidwHVcsqoSMiTwg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/_kQpSHkidwHVcsqoSMiTwg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/_kQpSHkidwHVcsqoSMiTwg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/_kQpSHkidwHVcsqoSMiTwg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Guy G.', 'displayLocation': 'Dublin, Republic of Ireland', 'altText': 'Guy G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=I426NDZK2FF-9gE_vVWpqw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 13, 'photoCount': 44, 'reviewCount': 35, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Loved this place, I thought the coffee was strong and tasty, toasted sandwiches were nice and crisp and they had some great cookies, this place was a welcome break from the sun.

Friendly service, good food, reasonable prices (for Singapore) and litle unexpected added touches like apples with the toastie that turn this suburban corner cafe from ordinary to extraordinary¡!! <br>Highly recommended but you&#39;ll need to beat off the joggers and mums with bubs to find a seat on a sunny day...

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/br-DJkZbEdMaSWh651wWmQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=3h3qEKguUb7MYtQgOb5kag&select=br-DJkZbEdMaSWh651wWmQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/qNxYeb7qIizepO_Lu9rtPg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=3h3qEKguUb7MYtQgOb5kag&select=qNxYeb7qIizepO_Lu9rtPg', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Hotdog', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Hotdog'}]
text: A good advantage of staying relative near town is the accessibility to all these little cafes that are sprucing up in town. Kith Cafe has become one of my usual brunch places on the weekends to grab a quick bite with &#34;free&#34; parking. My typical brunch there would be their hotdog and a glass of  lychee watermelon iced blended. <br><br>Kith Cafe is very popular with expat families and increasingly popular with the locals too.  Great place for informal group gathering and even playdates for the kids. It can be quite chaos  on weekends with kids and pets around.  Well, its one of the very few cafes that is both kids and pets friendly. <br><br>Recently, my husband and I brought my 8 months old baby girl along to have brunch. She loves to sit and watch the older kids play. I think she must be wishing that she is old enough to join in the fun. <br><br>Great place to people watch by the river too!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/QEnKZYd1Za0H8_9XsnJrXQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=wlX2KtKM2pSqOOPv_Qm3GQ&select=QEnKZYd1Za0H8_9XsnJrXQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: In all honesty, i can&#39;t see why theres so much hype about this place? probably cos of its indie concept and the fact that it appeared on Monocle.<br><br>The tables and chairs were pathetic and tiny. The view... well by the canal (wouldn&#39;t really call it a river tho it connects to the Singapore River)<br><br>Coffee was decent, but the toastie I had was terrible. I ordered a egg and ham toastie. it was very homemade style, which wasn&#39;t quite what i was looking for.<br><br> Worst part of the toastie was that the scrambled eggs inside was definitely cooked eons ago and was too dry. more like a scrambled egg bits.<br><br>Kitchen looked make-shift, small and dirty.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/LnIzJX9vlsy2W-h56as6RQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=qMyRQR-c79f1IR3SBX6eFw&select=LnIzJX9vlsy2W-h56as6RQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9V5l7_AK-phcpXd7LWIiMg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=qMyRQR-c79f1IR3SBX6eFw&select=9V5l7_AK-phcpXd7LWIiMg', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Front of the cafe', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Front of the cafe'}]
text: Another addition to the brunch places popping up all over the city, Kith café is located along Robertson Quay and provides expats, families and yuppies with good coffee and sandwiches. <br><br>On weekends, Kith is generally crowded unless you come a little later in the afternoon. I usually order an unsweetened iced coffee and a cheese and bacon toastie (I love the little apple slices they provide on the side to temper the savouriness of the toastie with crunchy sweetness). <br><br>Sitting outside along the sidewalk with a newspaper and coffee at hand is a great way to spend a peaceful Sunday.

I thought the coffee here was excellent. I also had the toast with Jam for breakfast. The bread wasn&#39;t great, but the jam appeared to be homemade and was quite good although they don&#39;t really give you enough of it to cover the giant pieces of bread. <br><br>On this weekend, the place looked like an expat daycare center because of all the toddlers running around--that could be a positive or negative depending on your point of view but just be aware. Plenty of seating outside though and a nice place to have a cup of joe.

We walked with our dog close to three miles from Tangling Mall along Orchard road, through Ft. Canning park, down to Clarke Quay and finally Robertson Quay. Having the dog with us limited the places we could eat at but then we found Kith. They were happy to let us sit outside with him, even providing water for him. <br>We ordered the smoked salmon sandwich and the steak sandwich. We also ordered the pineapple and ginger drinks. The service was prompt and friendly. The drinks were cold and refreshing, never having tasted pineapple and ginger before. The sandwiches were very tasty, the steak getting the slight edge over the smoked salmon. The side order of bacon for the dog was tasty enough that a couple of pieces did not make it to the intended customer. <br><br>All in all it was a good experience, we will be back.

Kith is a cute, cozy place on the quieter side of Robertson Quay .  <br><br>It&#39;s one of those places I&#39;d been meaning to try for years, literally, and I finally got round to it about about 2 months ago - this tells you I&#39;ve got quite a backlog of reviews!<br><br>Kith offers a decent selection of food (ranging from biccies to small bites to traditional full breakfasts and to sandwiches) at reasonable price points, e.g. $10 for a sandwich.  Our table only tried several simple food items like the smoked salmon sandwich, brioche with yogurt and strawberries, and a tuna + green apple toastie.  Even simple dishes can sometimes go awry, but I&#39;m happy to report that all these items were well executed and presented.<br><br>Where I felt a bit let down was in the coffee department.  I&#39;d heard a lot about Kith&#39;s coffee and had been tremendously looking forward to trying it.  However, the coffee was disappointingly average.  I&#39;d certainly put places like Toby&#39;s Estate and Smitten above Kith in the coffee stakes.<br><br>Still, Kith is a pleasant place that&#39;s hard to dislike.  It&#39;s a comfortable place which is family-friendly, pet-friendly and offers ample people watching opportunities.  If I lived in RQ, I&#39;d be happy to call it my local.

Quirky little cafe by the river (canal?). I like how it&#39;s hidden from everything else, like a little sanctuary.<br><br>Brunch sets and coffee here are average but the laid back atmosphere makes up for it. Salads and juices are great, the first time I visited Kith, I wanted something more than what was offer on the blackboard so I asked if I could request for a specific salad. I was in luck because the person who would soon say yes was none other than lady boss Jane herself.<br><br>So I had a ginger grilled chicken salad with baby spinach, wild rocket, japanese cucumber and cherry tomatoes, and have had it again every time I return. It tastes awesome.<br><br>Perfect for a lazy weekend.

The interior is very small- a couple of bar seats, and a long bench for a large group. Furnishing is pretty spartan, the legs of the bar and chairs reminds me of book stacks. Feels pretty much like an old classroom with the blackboard as well. The &#39;alfresco dining&#39; is in fact a couple of tables and chairs/stools scattered along the corridor. Fits very much into the home and patio concept. I can see how the residents are drawn to this little spot.<br><br>Breakfast food is a must have (if i have my way that is). I would also insist on all day breakfast too. We were there for tea so we didn&#39;t try the food.<br><br>Kith&#39;s scone looks pretty but tastes crappy and it got worse as the temperature dropped. The texture is almost cardboard-ish and dry. It was only a little better with the.. wait for it... WHIPPED cream (oh how i hate it when they serve whipped instead of clotted). The jam was kinda weird with the watery texture. It looks like it was curdled and then defrosted. Anyway, just avoid the scone at all cost.<br><br>Drinks are good though.

If you like your food home-made style, then you should check this place out. <br><br>A good time to go would be during breakfast so you can try out the toast and homed strawberry jam that is quite good actually. Coffee on the other hand, was just average and nothing to shout about. <br><br>The place is quite stuffy so don&#39;t come overdressed or you&#39;ll be perspiring throughout your meal, which is never good.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/G8nZJZa36xUy2SzJmzpqwQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=Y9TiBR2Dr54M81bN1nYXwQ&select=G8nZJZa36xUy2SzJmzpqwQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Kith Café is an awesome hole in the wall along the Singapore River. It actually recently just expanded but before was literally a tiny little space frequented by the River Valley neighborhood. Staff is super friendly and the food is simple but very satisfying. <br><br>Go for their breakfast which is served with the best toast in Singapore and home-made strawberry jam. Their coffee is pretty great too. Try the Kith macchiato, which is espresso, chocolate, topped with a marshmallow. They recently expanded to a bigger space, in the same location. <br><br>Have lunch outdoors facing the Singapore River. They also just opened a new branch in Park Mall, serving dinner as well.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/b-mMPjFLUccxLhXKN7MViw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/kith-cafe-singapore?reviewid=-k-Y02CyDfQzorgH5yyjyg&select=b-mMPjFLUccxLhXKN7MViw', 'altText': 'Photo of Kith Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. A Nutella milkshake... Yum!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'A Nutella milkshake... Yum!'}]
text: Paired with the glistening surface of the Singapore River and the occasional bumbleboat whizzing by, a sip of ice-cold liquefied Nutella blended with nuttily fragrant hazelnut ice cream over at Kith Café is the rest-stop for winners after a day-long poach at flea markets at Clarke Quay. Drink it before it melts - it is good to the very last drop!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=BgPgfu6KIvCMsarRczXnZA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'PT B.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'PT B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=BgPgfu6KIvCMsarRczXnZA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 133, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Kith is the little cafe with outdoor seating right along the river to the west of the Martin Road bridge.  This is a favorite of congregations of expat wives with black spandex leggings walking their dogs.  Their brunch-y fare hits the spot - especially the smoothies - but don&#39;t expect huge portions.  The atmosphere is homey, friendly and sweet.  A nice place to meet friends, especially on weekdays when it&#39;s not as crowded as on the weekends.
Love the bfast in here w the view n services are great too. Its still my fave plcs to go for bfast among all 3 outlets that they have in sg.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=CkFcjgaNgx5oNW3wrHILkQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Hayley D.', 'displayLocation': 'Brisbane, Australia', 'altText': 'Hayley D.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=CkFcjgaNgx5oNW3wrHILkQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 7, 'eliteYear': None}
text: A great little cafe down at Rob Quay. This place is always swelling with people, no matter what day of the week and once you have been in there it is evident why. Great coffee, fresh, tasty simple food and mouth watering fruit juices every time. Service with a smile is guaranteed. I&#39;ve eaten many of their meals in the past and each time they have been delicious.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/7JzmpmZ6dIoW3SZpEyj5yQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/hoshino-coffee-singapore-6?reviewid=HEp_t2Vf6S20E2n_YalvjQ&select=7JzmpmZ6dIoW3SZpEyj5yQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Hoshino Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Super cute place for afternoon tea or just to hangout. Staff are friendly, food were good. <br><br>Their Japanese pancakes were so good! We got the original and matcha. I think I liked the original better, matcha was good at first but the bitterness was a little overkill towards the end. <br><br>They have weekday afternoon tea specials where you can get a drink and a cake for about 10sgd. Which is a great deal considering their cakes were at leave 7sgd a la carte. They also have discounted sliced cakes at for 5sgd. But there is no special discounts on weekends.<br><br>They take card and/or Cash. Super tourist friendly.

Private booth', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Private booth'}]
text: Look out Starbux!  This up and coming chain is rapidly expanding and serves a much better coffee with OUTSTANDING soufflé pancakes. The witting booths are intimate and comfortable for private chat or business meeting.  I needed to confirm my order 3x and still not right.  We were able to fix when the receipt was brought ahead of the food.  Probably English skills related as I did order sauce and whipped cream and ice cream on the side, and accidentally pointed to the wrong pic.  Quickly fixed and issue completely resolved.  Bring your bill to the front cashier to pay.  Very nice and I will certainly go back for more next time!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/nXh90EPgtR6iElH2Oa6CAQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/hoshino-coffee-singapore-6?reviewid=mynUdgl9UUPA4PGgAFll5w&select=nXh90EPgtR6iElH2Oa6CAQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Hoshino Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. The delectable lobster bisque spaghetti', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'The delectable lobster bisque spaghetti'}]
text: Like a hidden gem, the newest branch of Hoshino Coffee is nestled in the relative obscurity of Capitol Piazza Basement 2. The place stands out for its general ambience at first sight - all dark wood and crystal chandeliers. So its pricing came as a pleasant surprise. The food too was nothing overly sophisticated, which I thought worked in its favour.<br><br>We tried the lobster bisque spaghetti, the omu rice and the clam chowder soup for starters.  The broth of the lobster spqghetti was rich with flavour and in texture and it came with a reasonable serving of prawns and lobster meat. As for the omu rice, the omelette was fluffy and soft and proved satisfying for my friend. The clam chowder soup had average consistency but flavour wise, it was still good.<br><br>A nice spot to chill in the city and the fact that it is little known (for now) makes it the perfect place for a catch up with friends or to read the day away.

text: Second time in a month I&#39;m here at their Capitol outlet. I like this outlet as its not too crowded and this time I get to sit near the fountain. <br><br>Food is good here. This time I had the Chicken Mushroom Pie Pizza and an Ice Coffee. Their ice coffee is served in a high thermal conductivity copper cup to sustain the coldness. My partner had the Omelette Risotto. <br><br>I will definitely recommend this place.

Pancake soufflé', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pancake soufflé'}]
text: This place has upscale decor with plush furniture and smartly dressed waiters. It is very conducive to sit and chat with friends  over coffee and desserts. My friend had coffee which came with a tiny portion of milk that was surprisingly enough to enrich the taste. Refilling another cup costs half the price of the first cup. A few of us shared the pancake soufflé with maple syrup and vanilla softee. Preparation took 20 minutes which was indicated in the menu. While the dish was fluffy and tasty, it felt more like a regular pancake instead of having much resemblance to soufflé so next time I would rather order a proper soufflé.

text: Love the coffee and fruit tea as well as the desserts. Food is quite good too. Prefer this outlet to the one at ION where service isn&#39;t as good. The soufflé and pancake soufflés take time so do order from the start!

Marriott Angus Burger', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Marriott Angus Burger'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3gALO7xZ_22HMlRqMcGLbg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crossroads-caf%C3%A9-singapore-2?reviewid=15i4HrvGUdDAs5CuaRZAxg&select=3gALO7xZ_22HMlRqMcGLbg', 'altText': 'Photo of Crossroads Café - Singapore, Singapore. Ahhh - A pint of Erdinger', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Ahhh - A pint of Erdinger'}]
text: Nice combination of grabbing a decent food or drink of your choice while you feel right in the middle of the Singaporean hustle and bustle!  Nice place to spend solo and people watch as 100&#39;s go by in this famous and busy intersection or in small groups and enjoy your chats. <br><br>The food menu is very western but sometimes that&#39;s exactly what it feels like having been exposed to local cuisine.  I had a very nice long hike in the forest in the morning so this occasion felt just right being hit, humid, and tired. The refreshing draft beer was probably the best part of it! And the sandwich held me all they way to the end of the day. So. Well earned 4-star for this place.

text: Nice oasis in orchard road area, much more open than Privé opposite from the crossroads. Long menu and drinks list for a Café. The char kway teow is less good than the one at One Ninety at Four Seasons Hotel, but it&#39;s pretty good. Friendly service staff. If you have Entertainer 1-for-1 deal, it&#39;s excellent value. You should cross the crossroads to have a bite at Crossroads.

text: Decided to grab an easy lunch at Crossroad Café today. <br><br>Entrance to the café is located along Scotts Road (not inside the hotel). I have been to Crossroads many many years ago, it looked different then. I am sure it has gone through renovations and upgrade since. If anyone is worried the café would be too hot for comfort, there is no need to fear. There were huge ceiling fans and in fact it was really comfortable dining there. Trust me on that since I am always so scared of places which have no air conditioning in Singapore. <br><br>FOOD 5/5<br><br>Char Kway Teow - This is a local dish which comprised of flat wide noodles with eggs, vegetables, fish cake, huge prawns and squids. I know the locals may cry foul with anyone eating a local street food at a 5 star hotel with 5 star pricing. I beg to differ. The portion of my Char Kway Teow was huge, the ingredients were fresh and the café was generous with the prawns. Mmmmm... Yummy!<br><br>Lychee Iced Tea - I never have a Lychee Iced Tea. Very refreshing!! I really like it :) <br><br>AMBIENCE 5/5<br><br>Despite the café not being enclosed, it was not warm. There were huge ceiling fans mounted and it was rather breezy siting under the fan. It was like me sitting in a resort restaurant except we were in the middle of the bustling Orchard Road area. <br><br>This is probably the best café in Orchard area for people watching. I have no interest in people watch, I only like to look at the food I am eating, lol!!<br><br>SERVICE 4/5<br><br>The staffs were nice. Service was what I expected from a 5 star hotel like Marriott. Took a while to holler down a staff to get my check at the end of lunch though. Also, the bread should come before the meal and not together. Hence, the one star off. <br><br>Overall, Crossroads is a great place for a nice, relaxing lunch. Bonus for people who like to people watch.

Nice place, great people. They can make a drink the way you teach them and you can meet other people on the tables because you sit in front of them. They made all of the drinks that I asked and I also learned about a new drink from one of the people I was sitting next too who told me about something called the perfect martins.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=KtifOdLCkdUaMDi63BFTuQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Ux3NyR2Mo1sX82d2fs3QxA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Ux3NyR2Mo1sX82d2fs3QxA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Ux3NyR2Mo1sX82d2fs3QxA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Ux3NyR2Mo1sX82d2fs3QxA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Ux3NyR2Mo1sX82d2fs3QxA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Ux3NyR2Mo1sX82d2fs3QxA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Reinhardt V.', 'displayLocation': 'Bakersfield, CA', 'altText': 'Reinhardt V.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=KtifOdLCkdUaMDi63BFTuQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 2, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 95, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Excellent place. High class dining. Fresh high quality ingredients. Excellent service. Glat diet friendly options. I could have eaten for days. They&#39;ve got a little bit of everything. They focus on French, Chinese, Indian, and Australian cuisine.  My favorite as usual was the fresh fruit. I eat a whole bowl of pineapple and blue berries in one sitting, and just as a warm up. The place is hopping. Got to try it. Excellent tea. You won&#39;t regret it.

This place has the best location and is a fancy place to get your local fare. Never knew the name but I&#39;ve walked past this place like since 10 years ago. Tried the Chicken Rice and I must say it&#39;s hotel standard. The meat is tender and comes in copious amount. The rice is fragrant and the whole set is displayed in a neat and very appetizing way. The creme bulee was sweet and pretty good too.<br>The menu is not overwhelmingly difficult to read and there&#39;s all your local and Western stuff. I hear the burger is not bad too, but I wanna try the Char Kway Teow and Laksa Lemak the next time I&#39;m here.
Best people watching in Singapore. <br><br>Diverse menu with many options.<br><br>The food is good, not great, but see the first point above.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0zChWMXb-0I7exAbIAU2Uw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crossroads-caf%C3%A9-singapore-2?reviewid=1Ikey3gGz1PxE4YqMK0Urg&select=0zChWMXb-0I7exAbIAU2Uw', 'altText': 'Photo of Crossroads Café - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: They say that Times Square in NYC is the Crossroads of the World. That may be so, but people watching at the Crossroads Cafe on  a Sunday afternoon makes me think I am at the Crossroads of Asia. <br><br>Great place to watch the world go by with good happy hour promos to go with the good service.

Perfect place to get your alcohol fix in the afternoon or at night and also people watch. Staffs are friendly except one pinoy with short hair who&#39;s very bitchy and seems fake. <br><br>It does get kinda hot though, I wish they could always turn the fan into high speed all the time, otherwise it&#39;s pretty stuffy. There is a smoking area at the corner which is great. I always appreciate cafes or restaurants who cater to smokers. Don&#39;t get food here though, there are much better options around the area.

Upon walking past Crossroads Cafe one morning I noticed a sign offering a discounted breakfast buffet for guests who were willing to sit outside. S$32++ was the price - still not cheap but better than the S$50++ it would have cost by sitting inside. <br><br>Let me start with the positive. The selection is absolutely amazing. If you can&#39;t find anything to eat, then we need to have a different discussion. Their cappuccinos are from Illy - their beans are of a high standard and drinking coffee becomes an instant pleasure. <br><br>As for the issues. Everything has sugar in it and is made extra sweet (roti prata, yoghurt, bircher müsli, etc.) - aspartame-laced, perhaps. Not the best for you or your body. In addition, they use genetically modified (GM) oils to cook their dishes. When their omelette Chef started taking the canola oil can to spray on my eggs, I almost lost it. <br><br>I tend to (try and) reeducate people on the risks of these GM foods, yet the Chef tried to convince me that it was indeed healthy (does that mean everything is booked with Canola Oil??). The scenario turned somewhat comical when the caucasian Chef - overhearing our conversation - sprinted over to the station and immediately confirmed that the dish could of course be made just as I requested. <br><br>So I am happy to report that they understand the risks but I guess in order to maximize their contribution margins and minimize food cost, they look the other way. If you don&#39;t care for your health for at least one day a week, eat here!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=3g_vgaCNlvR5uKmUkSz8Rw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Debbie T.', 'displayLocation': 'East Bay, CA', 'altText': 'Debbie T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=3g_vgaCNlvR5uKmUkSz8Rw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 361, 'photoCount': 670, 'reviewCount': 443, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Smacked between Scotts Road and Orchard Road, this is a perfect place for a drink, especially if it&#39;s &#34;1 for 1 cocktails&#34; all day.&#34; There&#39;s a good number of different cocktails to choose from and the drinks aren&#39;t water downed like most places. Roughly $18-22 per cocktail. The vibe is good, but it does get quite stuffy and hot ever now and then.<br><br>After a few cocktails, stumble into Tang&#39;s for some shopping. Just don&#39;t shop for shoes bc you (or rather me!) will trip and fall.  <br><br>Tip: Tell the server before ordering that you&#39;re planning to share! You&#39;re not supposed to, but sometimes they&#39;ll close one eye and grant you that favor ;))

Waygu fois gra burger', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Waygu fois gra burger'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/bZq4LryJYaxnOi72C3U4mg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/crossroads-caf%C3%A9-singapore-2?reviewid=Ug1hVplGK8_io5qhtQrVmw&select=bZq4LryJYaxnOi72C3U4mg', 'altText': 'Photo of Crossroads Café - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Food was still delish thou my order was not correct. Great place to people watch. Ordered the Waygu truffle burger and milk shake. Never got the shake and they recommended my burger medium well.  I ordered it medium rare and got it medium. :(. It still tastes good.

I ate here while staying at the Marriott.<br><br>I got the chicken and rice and the nasi lemak (coconut-flavored rice, peanut and anchovies, chicken Kapitan, fried hard-boiled egg, and prawn sambal). The food&#39;s generally pretty good, but I think it&#39;s way too expensive. The restaurant IS located at the Marriott, so it kind of makes sense.<br><br>Still.. I can&#39;t justify not taking a star away just because its price is &#34;justified&#34; by being in a hotel. There are better options nearby, especially because you&#39;re so close to ION Orchard.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=XGs7hAvjlGSFqkSVG_8fqg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TssQJ2i3dfweuCs6nKbJGw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TssQJ2i3dfweuCs6nKbJGw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TssQJ2i3dfweuCs6nKbJGw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TssQJ2i3dfweuCs6nKbJGw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TssQJ2i3dfweuCs6nKbJGw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/TssQJ2i3dfweuCs6nKbJGw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Mark C.', 'displayLocation': 'Friendswood, TX', 'altText': 'Mark C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=XGs7hAvjlGSFqkSVG_8fqg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Drinking: good selection of beers other than Tiger on tap. Drank here with colleagues on three separate nights. Good, amiable service. Ordered some bar food: truffle fries; satay. Average. <br><br>People watching: excellent.<br><br>Eating: was looking for something quick and easy on my last night in SG. Scanned the menu and saw NZ Wagyu Ribeye for S$70. I was interested! Ordered medium and got a nice medium with nice grill marks, about 20mm thick. Was the juiciest steak I have ever eaten, including other Wagyu! Every bite was juicy and rich. The Chilean Cabernet whose name I have forgotten was a pricey (S$25/glass) but good accompaniment. The frites were standard, thin cut 5mm square fries. Such a great piece of meat deserves thicker, hand cut fries. Next time I am in SG and have a hankering for steak, I will come back here.

Misses the mark In so many ways. The good... the location is good for people watching and the 1 for 1 cocktail deal is an incentive. The Bad.... the food.... I had a BLT.... how to you mess that up?! It has 3 main ingredients between two slices of bread... food was not fresh... bread, lettuce, tomato wilted and stale. And the bacon had a not so fresh flavor to it. Everything was cold. They completely forgot about my husbands food with no apologies. The rest of the party was finished eating by the time his food came. We confronted the manager a dark skinned man with zero management skill, he just hovered over us, mumbled something.... sorta argued back a little as we signed our credit card slips. He was not managing this place, many people we getting annoyed at the service and he just stood behind the podium like we was gearing up to give a speech. He was managing absolutely nothing. Did not ask us how out food was, but asked us for our money. Great service starts from the top and he sets the bar pretty low. I was going to give this place 2 stars until we interacted with the manager... promptly removed a star with enthusiasm.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Fjojjctc-Kmfh-i0WyCO_g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/fHeJwW-FgsbkP0SEpgctGQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/fHeJwW-FgsbkP0SEpgctGQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/fHeJwW-FgsbkP0SEpgctGQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/fHeJwW-FgsbkP0SEpgctGQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/fHeJwW-FgsbkP0SEpgctGQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/fHeJwW-FgsbkP0SEpgctGQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Roland B.', 'displayLocation': 'Zürich, Switzerland', 'altText': 'Roland B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Fjojjctc-Kmfh-i0WyCO_g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: We just love this place as it is integral to our favourite hotel and give a great view on the crowds strollong up an down orchard road. But most of all we like the food and the excellent service!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Y0tw2XzunPnwjOErMYY1xw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'David A.', 'displayLocation': 'Wesley Chapel, FL', 'altText': 'David A.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Y0tw2XzunPnwjOErMYY1xw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: As others have stated, this is a terrific spot to have a pour and people watch.  &#34;Crossroads&#34; is a reality since there is a tube stop here.  Since I am staying in the Marriott Tang Plaza, which this restaurant is part of, it was convenient that they were serving food until 0200 the night that I arrived at 0030 from 30+ hours of travel.  The food options here is a good mix of Westerner options and local.  The draft beer selection at the time of my visit is: Tiger, Kirin, Kilkenny, Guinness, Erdinger Weissbrau, and Heineken.  A decent mix of mainstream options, in a place that I didn&#39;t expect to have much past crappy lagers/pilsners.  Overall, not a bad place to hang for a few hours if you get in late, or are jet lagged, hung over, or otherwise do not feel like going out.

Ate lunch with my boyfriend here and I ordered a salad which was very delicious. After my 24hours of traveling with airport and airplane food my appetite was messed up and I have to say this place really helped me get back my appetite for food. Would definitely recommend this place!
Grab a beer here and people watch, but Go eat somewhere better not far down the street.
Best burger at any time of the day - this place is a godsend at 4am for a last beer or a salad regardless of your reason for being up that late!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=BgPgfu6KIvCMsarRczXnZA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/b-8CMjYy49H83Oj_AiV3WQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'PT B.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'PT B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=BgPgfu6KIvCMsarRczXnZA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 133, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This may be the best spot for people watching on all of Orchard, outside on the wide sidewalk but tucked behind planters and situated at the corner of Scotts and Orchard.  The dinner buffet is spendy but comprehensive, fun, includes lots of Asian fusion options and delicious.  Not a place to go if you&#39;re watching your pennies or your figure.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=zqeOwIpO1a2IUXkU8s1oyg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jVMyPHV1GwkXoKg9YWgckw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jVMyPHV1GwkXoKg9YWgckw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jVMyPHV1GwkXoKg9YWgckw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jVMyPHV1GwkXoKg9YWgckw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jVMyPHV1GwkXoKg9YWgckw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jVMyPHV1GwkXoKg9YWgckw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ali H.', 'displayLocation': 'Wellington, New Zealand', 'altText': 'Ali H.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=zqeOwIpO1a2IUXkU8s1oyg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 629, 'reviewCount': 496, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This cafe is a great place to sit and watch the busy Orchard Road world go by ... there is a steady stream of shoppers and communters going by and you could entertain yourself with the fascinating, changing view for hours. You may need to ... the service at this cafe, whilst very friendly, is very slow ... after you are seated and given a menu there is quite a gap between attendances by staff to take and deliver orders. Even the bill is slow in coming. As far as the food goes, I&#39;ve had lunch here - I&#39;ve ordered the Heritage Salad - this is small, not enough for a meal, even with the complimentary (very nice) bread provided. The heroes of the dish are the heritage tomatoes, several types - but they are hidden under a shower of sprouts and a very meagre sprinkling of fetta and avocado. I&#39;ve also had the Watermelon and Haloumi Salad - you wouldn&#39;t want to be hungry if you ordered this one, it&#39;s not quite enough. However, the fresh fruit platter is beautifully presented and marvellously fresh and delicious.
Excellent coffee and light lunch place, but this is the Marriott, so you pay for it. Also a nice place to watch the beautiful and the less beautiful walk past.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=gnMKBKb8NJ8LIut-8zuLTQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Daniel B.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Daniel B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=gnMKBKb8NJ8LIut-8zuLTQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 180, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 7, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Horrible service, extremely rude staff. I would try to avoid this place if I were you.  If there was a way to give  it zero stars I would do so.

Great coffee, among my top 3 in Singapore so far (Coffee Academics, Alchemist and Mellower are my favourites). This shop has a lot of cachet.<br><br>They also have a tiny shop in CBD, close to Market Street.

Exterior', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Exterior'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UXPsJypbLk5P804HORzsMw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/alchemist-singapore-2?reviewid=DkhqQaq3MAi-Fz_eTddICQ&select=UXPsJypbLk5P804HORzsMw', 'altText': 'Photo of Alchemist - Singapore, Singapore. Building entrance', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Building entrance'}]
text: Hipster coffee in a conservation building...<br><br>Alchemist is known for their excellent coffee in Singapore&#39;s CBD, and they have now opened an outpost in the heritage Khong Guan Building. <br><br>The building&#39;s interior has been done really nicely with the large windows letting natural light in, and recreation retro 60s furniture that reminded me of my grandma&#39;s living room. The focus is on the coffee, so no food, just a couple of croissants and danish pastries to accompany the coffee. I see the roaster and bags of coffee at the back.<br><br>Seems like a cool spot to hang out for a coffee, I&#39;ll be back.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/QNxvan86yBAsZCj7Kw1ccw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/wang-cafe-singapore-14?reviewid=rV_3hZaLFCXjMYWLRJwfqQ&select=QNxvan86yBAsZCj7Kw1ccw', 'altText': 'Photo of Wang Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/KjHLWMcMs9JKyG6nvVvAfg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/wang-cafe-singapore-14?reviewid=rV_3hZaLFCXjMYWLRJwfqQ&select=KjHLWMcMs9JKyG6nvVvAfg', 'altText': 'Photo of Wang Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: This version of the wang cafe is found on the first level of the hospital in the KKH mall. It is frequently packed especially between 8-9 am and for that afternoon coffee rush between 1-3 pm. It has all the standard things that you would find in a regular wang including the coffee/tea drinks, toasts, noodles (mee Siam, laksa, macaroni, mee rebus) and even bao. The staff is very efficient and courteous. A good place to get a quick caffeine fix or a quick bite

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=AbfS_oXF8H6HJb5jFqhrLw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Paco G.', 'displayLocation': 'México, D.F., Mexico', 'altText': 'Paco G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=AbfS_oXF8H6HJb5jFqhrLw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 44, 'photoCount': 22, 'reviewCount': 55, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Another interesting, hip place in Tiong Bahru, the kind that is frequented mostly by expats and local hipsters. It has the feel of an old canteen, reminding me of those desperately-trying-to-look-old, kitsch cantinas so popular in Mexico City, with tiled floors, posters on the walls and vintage marble tables, a bit crammed on the inside. To the untrusting observer, The Tiong Bahru Club may appear to be one of those places where form is more important than essence. However, the environment ultimately works and the place feels strangely authentic and inviting.<br><br>The first interesting thing are the two different menus: East Asian and North Indian. Both of them contained snippets of information, kind of &#34;explaining&#34; the dishes. We were told to choose what kind of menu we wanted to have, so we chose the Indian menu (I&#39;m always keen on Indian food). We had a very good, fragrant and spicy fish curry. Then I tried the masala chicken liver, which was spectacular. It was rich in flavour, while at the same time full of subtle surprises. I could say food tasted almost home-cooked, there was a special level of care involved. There&#39;s no way I couldn&#39;t love that.<br><br>It must be hard to keep the balance of style and substance in a restaurant. My first impression of The Tiong Bahru Club was that of a place favouring the former. It is always good to be proven wrong. Here, style is no more than the background to a sense-appealing meal. I will surely come back.

Bucket of Beers, Feet Up, Street View - Tiong Bahru Club', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Bucket of Beers, Feet Up, Street View - Tiong Bahru Club'}]
text: It&#39;s Hip to Be Square! Here, There &amp; Everywhere!<br><br>TBC could be a 5-star hipstar hangout. It&#39;s got the trendy hipster location; it&#39;s got the style, swagger and streetcred. It&#39;s got the Singapore shophouse meets grandma&#39;s basement chillstar vibe.<br><br>Instead it wallows in the 2-to-2-and-a-halfy range with lackadaisical lacklustreness.<br><br>The service is the friendless math-olympics nerd who spent the weekend indoors doing times tables instead of outdoors chilling with chums.<br><br>The food is the cowardly four-eyed flusher you bullied in first grade using their spiked hair liked a scrubbing brush in the lads lavatory.<br><br>The brews are the too-cool-for-school kid who is trying too hard to be liked by everyone, and only marginally succeeding.<br><br>The views are the pretty princess that makes attending class worth the while, and worth your smile.<br><br>TBC coulda stood for The Best Club; Ten Beer ChillSpot; or To Be Continued (as in let&#39;s keep coming back). But instead it evokes Too Bland Chili; This Big Chode; or Tad Boring Chad.<br><br>Huey got it wrong. Take it from me. TBC is a square, despite the hip!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EXMswbJRlQOXBp5SMRPL4g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-tiong-bahru-club-singapore?reviewid=IYKXi2URYqWvLAlXl6mLbQ&select=EXMswbJRlQOXBp5SMRPL4g', 'altText': 'Photo of The Tiong Bahru Club - Singapore, Singapore. Devil&#39;s Chicken, rice, and chai', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Devil's Chicken, rice, and chai"}]
text: Absolutely delicious Devil&#39;s Chicken Curry (at $16.80, a bit on the pricey side) really made my brunch! The sauce was bursting with flavor and spices, and the carrots, pork, and sausages were a fantastic accompaniment. A nice cup of chai went along with it superbly, and it was served with just the right amount of rice. I&#39;m lactose intolerant, and it was lovely to find Indian in Singapore without ghee (clarified butter) so I could eat it! My friend&#39;s biryani was delicious too: light and fluffy, tasting of gardens.<br><br>The outdoor seating was the perfect blend of the aircon from inside and the heat of the sidewalk, with people watching and a good breeze. Decor is cute and appealing - a blend of the club and the chaiwallah stand which both supply the place. <br><br>The issue was that our server was quite obviously completely new and pretty inept (sorry, buddy, but you were.) He said they offered chai by the pot and let us order some - by the pot - but they only serve it by the glass, as the server who brought it over explained after our mystified glances at the solitary cup. He also said they were offering their Bento Box special but when I tried to order it, turned out that&#39;s only available on weekdays. Study your menus and learn your stuff, servers, so that your service can match with your fine establishment&#39;s prices.

text: The overall look and feel of this venue is ok, that&#39;s why I still give 2 stars.<br>The foods are overpriced compared to the quality offered. I took a cappuccino and a Cheese beef burger (22$ ++)<br>The cappuccino is too milky, and when it was served, I don&#39;t feel like having ordered a real cappuccino (4 or 4.5 $ ++, see my photo). <br>The minced beef in the hamburger was too salty.<br>When I asked for ketchup, they give you ketchup in small package. I asked mustard twice, because the first time they did not say they don&#39;t have mustard, the second time they kind of simulate like they are looking for it then announce that they don&#39;t have mustard. Can&#39;t they say directly that they dont have if they already know...?<br>About the bread, it seemed to me that they are using first price quality. The burger was not worth 22$

text: A new upmarket restaurant has opened in Tiong Bahru! I know.. What&#39;s new right? <br>Located at the corner of Eng Hoon St. And Seng Poh road, we&#39;ve seen this place transform from an old coffee shop (our favourite Loo&#39;s Hainanese curry rice used to be here) transform into this upmarket eatery. <br><br>At first glance, this place looked like just another upmarket, snooty diner, filled with expats, yuppies and a certain breed of Singaporean females that have a certain preference for guys I should not name. <br><br>Anyway... What got us trying this place was the nostalgic feel and the fact that it did not serve the usual eggs Benedict, breakfast sets, waffles or pancakes, and they certainly didn&#39;t promote themselves as the next big coffee joint with magical beans from the bottom of the Amazon River. <br>Instead, what this place specializes in is... Indian food and chai!! Surprise surprise! <br><br>Well.. I guess it made sense considering that the Brits and the Indians / Sikhs have long had a history together. <br>Anyway... I&#39;m a sucker for indian food so this place, despite how hard I tried to say no, still got the better of me. <br><br>They have 2 sets of menus here, an Asian menu, with fried rice and soto Ayam and an Indian menu. <br><br>We decided to go for a Murgh Dum Briyani, my favourite Palek Paneer,a Masala Chicken Liver and what better way to wash down our food than with a nice pot of Himalayan Sikkih tea.<br><br>First came the Briyani. A good sharing portion that could easily feed 2-3 pax. The rice was wonderfully fragrant with the spices and flavours beautifully infused in and the chicken, despite being the breast, was tender and oh-so-flavourful. So good in fact that it just might be one of the best Briyani&#39;s I&#39;ve had in a while. <br><br>Next was the Masala Chicken liver. Now this dish was the star of our lunch. It is literally to die for! The liver was nice and tender and the sauce, with all its onions and spices was amazing. Every bite was a dream and this dish is enough to bring us back for more. <br><br>Finally the Paneer, my personal favourite. The sauce was nice and smooth without the spinach being over powering while the cheese was smooth and &#34;bouncy&#34;. Only thing it could do with was a little more salt, otherwise it was another very good dish. <br><br>The tea itself was nice and fragrant and proof that chaitime, the guys behind this restaurant, know their teas. <br><br>Overall, it was s wonderful experience and the only reason this place didn&#39;t get a 5 is down to a few simple factors. <br>A) indoor searing was a little tight, with most 4 pax tables nearly touching each other and effectively becoming a 3 top. <br>B) service was slow as well, with the 2 waiters clearly being inexperienced and frankly a little lost most of the time. <br>C) food did take a little longer than it should, with U.S. almost finishing our Briyani by the time the paneer came. <br>D) the prices. A little on the strap side at around $20-$25 per pax for an Indian meal. <br><br>Overall, I love how they kept some of the coffee shop&#39;s elements while updating it, leaving a nice nostalgic feel, down to the music choice. <br><br>We&#39;ll definitely be back for more!

text: My review will be in line with most of the other ones. This place is average. Prices are expensive because of the locations but not because of the food taste which is average and overpriced. The manager and staff is nice but that&#39;s it. Another Tiong Bahru overpriced place that is most likely replacing a good ole Chinese joint.

text: On a hot Saturday afternoon, this place caught our attention because it was an old kopitiam refurbished to a modern day pub restaurant. We were just looking to quench our thirst. Seeing that Chaiholics was serving their tea specialties, we decided to give the chai a go. Firstly, I thought the teas were overpriced. $6.50 excluding taxes. But nonetheless we went for it. If the tea was good, no issues paying. But the tea was a big disappointment. Mainly that it tasted so watered down.  Additionally the spoons looked quite stained and dirty. We didn&#39;t dare use them. Such a shame.

Brew of the week', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Brew of the week'}]
text: The food was excellent as was the service. Personally greeted and recommendations were made for strawberry lassi. It was very refreshing for a hot Saturday afternoon. We ordered the lamb biryani and murg tikka. That may be too much food for the two of us but it was so delicious, we finished it all. It is made to authentic north Indian standard, very difficult to come by here in Singapore. Loved the food very much! The ambience is great too. There are always people eating there regardless of what time of the day I go past it. Especially at night. It is however slightly pricey, at about $20-25 an entrée and $6-8 for a drink. Total of about $30-35 per person. I&#39;ll definitely be going back for more.

Kinda cool vibe indoor outdoor and not too hot. Not familiar with the vibe which I guess is like an old timey coffee shop or harkens back to colonial times. Am always uncomfortable with that bc yeah it might&#39;ve seemed cool but was not cool for the majority of those not in the elite. Anyhow it was cool enough in the evening inside and they had mixed chairs and cool wood floor etc. just be careful if ur inside and then you moved your chair back and one leg falls off the elevated floor and u could fall and hit ur head. The food was actually pretty good - the Indian food only. We had chicken not the spicy one and it was juicy and citrusy and delicious. Also had the Dahl and the baigan bartha and naan and plain rice and one more thing. But it was all tasty and very spicy but good. The service was meh. I asked for ginger ale and they said no we don&#39;t have it. I pointed out on the menu where it was listed. Was advised they don&#39;t have it anymore. Asked what on this list they had. They have juice and coke. There were five more things listed. Ok I&#39;ll just have water. Have to flag them down if you want anything so they don&#39;t check back. But at least they don&#39;t bother you and let u stay to chat. They&#39;re not clearing ur plates as soon as ur done which was my experience in most other restaurants in Singapore.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=X3bJXRs56JieQQjJH3Xk2w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/oqE9n_q6TGS754KPpHL3EA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Trish M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Trish M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=X3bJXRs56JieQQjJH3Xk2w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 16, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 4, 'eliteYear': None}
text: If I could give it no stars I would. I went here on a friend&#39;s recommendation but either the management has changed or they were having a really bad night. The service was so bad it was comical. I don&#39;t see how any restaurant can charge prices like this when they offer such poor or no service. The menu prices were quite expensive.<br>We struggled to get drinks. One waiter barely spoke English and when we did finally manage to order he would take an order  from 1 out of 7 people and disappear. We&#39;d try to call the waiter back and he would take another order but forget half of the drinks. So we had to send our son to the bar to remind him. Then they ran out of beer. There was wine on the table but noone knew how much it cost.<br>The food we had was OK but nothing to rave about. we only got a few entrees and this was only because my husband ordered them earlier as he had arrived 1/2 hour before  us. We had to get up and get our own plates as the waiters forgot.  After we had been in restaurant for 1.5 hrs we asked how our food was going and discovered the order had not been put through. The waiters were inept. We left as we&#39;d run out of patience by then and everyone was grumpy.<br>What was supposed to be a special birthday dinner was a disaster and I had 3 tired hungry children you feed at 9.30 pm.<br>I&#39;ve had better service in a hawker market for a fraction of the price!

text: Understand why reviews continue to become lower. An attractive place that wants to portray itself as a &#34;neighborhood&#34; facility. In reality, however, the prices mirror the tourist spots on Orchard. S$12 for a small bottle of Tiger beer. Really? Seriously? It goes down hill from there. Won&#39;t return.

text: 2 of us decided to walk there after coming back from the fantastic LeonardoDaVinci&#39;sBlueprints exh on the final Saturday of 2014. It was pouring heavily but fortunately, the place was just 10mins&#39; walk from apt. Was enticed by the 3for2pints of draft HoffbrauDunkel and had those with tandoori roll, sambal eggplant and lotsa complimentary groundnuts. Everything was tasty and ended up staying until they closed shop@10:30pm.

text: Distinctly average. Very disappointing considering the fact that everything else in this area, has really good food and service.

Easily my favourite bar in the Tanjong Pagar district.<br>Good selection of cheap draught beer and bar snacks to wind down with colleagues after a long day in the office. There&#39;s a reason this place is packed every weeknight. Guinness pint for $11 without happy hour? Yes please

text: Visited today. Nice place to relax after office hours. Reasonable prices, good quality food and nice draught beer makes for a perfect combination. Staff is courteous and helpful. Location is easily reachable. Recommended place

text: This is a favourite hangout of mine after work. It is also somehow my usual meeting place with my clients for discussion. Food is great and the drinks are decently priced. Most importantly, the beer to me is not watered down. The service is also excellent. Highly recommended for a good chill after work.

text: Visiting from the US and had a fantastic experience at Tom&#39;s!  Great ice cream and super friendly staff!  Definitely recommend!

A hidden gem between Raffles place and bugis tucked away in the corner of a nondescript building Toms Palette has made it to my list of best ice cream spots in the lion city. The menu is a mix of Very inventive and traditional flavors that hit the spot. We tried the salted caramel cheesecake and the rum and raisin.. two flavors in a cup for $5 nett! Talk about value for money. And both flavors were spot on. Rum and raisin was boozy and sweet with the saltiness of the cheesecake balancing it off perfectly. They have a ton of other interesting flavors that I will be back to taste soon!!

Matcha and plum ice cream!", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Matcha and plum ice cream!'}]
text: Nestled in a strange food complex (think food court style stalls with a pub outside) is Tom&#39;s Palette! Tons of flavors to pick from, and the texture was really light yet creamy! Saw pipagao (Chinese cough syrup) and had to try it - was so strange but in a good way! Ended up with the matcha and plum, both were delicious. Definitely worth a visit if you&#39;re close by!

I enjoyed Tom&#39;s a lot. I had half passion fruit and half botany, which was a Mother&#39;s Day special gelato with floral notes and some white chocolate pieces. Their flavours are very unique- even includes Pepago (the traditional Chinese cure-all medicine syrup)! <br><br>The texture was very creamy too- I would highly recommend.

Love the creativity and abundance of gelato flavours here, but unfortunately the waffles lose out to Merely and Creamier. Still, good location (Bugis) and the 3-5pm promotion means I will still visit frequently.<br><br>French Waffle: 3.5 stars<br>Very eggy and warm out of the iron, but slightly overcooked, nothing extraordinary. Nice thing is they serve the waffles with crumbled Oreos, berry coulis and syrup on a pretty plate.<br><br>Brownie Waffle: 4 stars<br>Crispier and more flavourful than their French waffle. If you like chocolate or brownies (I&#39;m neutral on both) you will LOVE these.<br><br>---- ICE CREAM ----<br><br>White Chocolate Nori:  5 stars<br>Lots of that umami seaweedy taste. Very generous with the chocolate chunks. So frickin tasty.<br><br>Yuzu: 5 stars<br><br>Lychee: 4.5 stars<br>Has lychee chunks in it!<br><br>Ale and Crack Candy: 4.5 stars<br>Sugar overload. Candied pecans, yumminess.<br><br>Triple-S:  4 stars<br>Shoyu, Sesame seeds, Salted chocolate. Super flavourful and slightly too salty, but I love the uniqueness.<br><br>Chocolate Stout: 3.5 stars<br>If you like the title, you&#39;ll probably like this flavour.<br><br>Salted Egg Yolk: 3.5 stars<br>Unfortunately my least favourite of all the flavours I tried. Tastes like 奶黄, but the texture lumpy gritty. And there are already so many salted egg yolk desserts so I don&#39;t particularly want to taste it again in my ice-cream.<br><br>Cornflake: 3 stars<br>Disappointing compared to Humphrey Slocombe&#39;s Secret Breakfast and Momofuku&#39;s Cereal Milk.<br><br>They also had some pretty standard flavours like Rum &amp; Raisin, Goma, and more snazzy ones like Banana Honey Roasted Nuts, Smokey Road, Salted Caramel Cheesecake, Mala Chocolate but I couldn&#39;t try them all!

text: The icecream flavors are really interesting, and you get to choose 2 flavors in 1 small cup. I had the passionfruit and milo dinosaur flavor- and loved it!

text: Interesting flavors and pleasant staff. The stand in located in the back of Shaw Tower, not too near to much. We walked there from The Fairmont Hotel and were very pleased. The flavor selections seem to rotate frequently. You should try some of the flavors - there seemed to be a large range from delicious to &#34;why would you make that into an ice cream flavor?&#34; I found the alcoholic stout beer flavor to fall into the why did they make it category,
